column10: Device: Motorola Droid Kernel Version: 2.6.29-omap1-g04df51f android-build@apa26 $477 Build number: ESD20 Neither Gallery nor browser nor any other imaging application IQ'Eve tested are able to view a large resolution PNG at true quality. All seem to exhibit some compression/resampling and associated lossy degredation. My test image has been this image at 3274x2067 resolution: http://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/movie_narrative_charts_large.png As you can see in the top right corner the word Q"EAragornQ"E is clear and legible and the green line is clearly surrounded by the gold line. If I take a 1x1 crop of that portion of the image it can be viewed clearly on screen. If I load the full image the quality is substantially degraded. Does Android have a maximum supported file resolution? This image is just over 1MB in size I wouldnQ'Et think it would be difficult for the Droid to view.

column15: My company uses Exchange ActiveSync policies that as I understand it are not currently Android-supported. However when running 2.0 on my Verizon Motorola Droid IQ'Eve always been able to set up an Exchange account and sync my calendar and contacts when in the office and connected to the company wifi network. This morning I was in the office and things were working fine as usual when I received an OTA update to 2.0.1. After installing 2.0.1 syncs fail (with a rather uninformative error message: Q"ESync failedQ"E). I tried removing the account and setting it up again but after entering my server and login information I get: Setup could not finish This Exchange ActiveSync server requires security features your phone does not support. I donQ'Et think the IT people rolled out any Exchange changes in the five minutes it took to upgrade my phone so I believe that the new release has a bug that prevents me from using Exchange over wifi. Model: Motorol Droid Firmware version: 2.0.1 Kernel version: 2.6.29-omap1-g0dd7e0b android-build@apa26 #511 Build number ESD56 Steps to reproduce: upgrade from 2.0 to 2.0.1 Expected behavior: Exchange calendar/contact syncs work can set up Exchange accounts Actual behavior: Syncs fail cannot set up Exchange account.

column14: Recording system is not shutdown properly on abnormal program termination leading to unusable microphone until phone is rebooted. No recording can be performed after the crash. Proposed proper behavior: the system handles/resources should have been returned on process exit regardless of the user program correctness (i.e. it may get killed and not get chance to properly shutdown). I.e. the microphone should be usable again without having to reboot the phone. Steps to reproduce On Motorola Droid (Firmware 2.0 build ESD20 2.6.29-omap1-g04df51f android-build@apa26) build write a sample app that initialized AudioRecord and starts recording and then crashes before calling stopRecording() I.e. AudioRecord recordInstance = new AudioRecord ( MediaRecorder.AudioSource.MIC 44100 AudioFormat.CHANNEL_CONFIGURATION_MONO AudioFormat.ENCODING_PCM_16BIT 2*4096); recordInstance.startRecording(); short[] audioData = new short[4096] int shortsRead = recordInstance.read(audioData 0 4096); throw new RuntimeException(?Unexpected crash?); Afterwards in adb the attempts to read print the following Q"E...obtainBuffer timed out (is the CPU pegged?)...Q"E

column8: I have a fairly new Motorola Droid running Android 2.0 IQ'Eve had issues with the Browser hanging when visiting certain sites. When this occurs the only option was to reboot the phone to get the Browser working again. IQ'Eve since installed an application that lets me kill the Browser process. After killing the process I can restart the Browser and it operates normally until I visit one of these pages that causes it to hang. HereQ'Es a URL of a page on www.archive.org that consistently causes the Browser process to hang: http://www.archive.org/details/xoc_SMW My hunch is that perhaps the JavaScript based audio player or some other plug-in on the page is causing the issue but I havenQ'Et had any luck getting the page to load even with JavaScript and plug-ins disabled via the BrowserQ'Es settings. The tool I installed Astro Process Killer shows the Browser process using about 40 megs of memory and up to 60% of the CPU even when itQ'Es backgrounded. If possible IQ'Ed like if the browser wouldnQ'Et hang at all but at the very least having the ability to restart the Browser process without the need of an external process manager would be greatly appreciated. I think the easiest fix would be to have the process show up under the list of running Applications inside the native Settings menu for the phone.

column6: I have the Motorola droid of course with the 2.0 OS. The problem I am having may just be a nuisance but when IQ'Eve got a 3g signal the os runs hunky dory however when I get to the house lose the cell signal (and 3g) and switch over to wireless android notifies me that Q"Eyou lost data connectivity becausQ"E... thatQ'Es it. IQ'Ell drop the notification bar and click on the error but it just disappears and then reappears around an hour later. I live in the mountains so itQ'Es no surprise to me when I lose the signal however this is very annoying. Also I noticed this morning that when I should have had a 3g signal I did not. Turning off the wireless signal popped up the 3g.

column5: If headphone is unplugged to answer call music will resume upon call end
column6: Problem: While listening to music if the phone rings and you unplug the headphones to answer it once you end the call music will resume playing on the speaker (loud!). I considered calling this a feature request but seeing as how unplugging the headphones without a call pauses music I think this is a bug. Platform: Motorola Droid OS version 2.0.1 Steps to reproduce: 1.Plug in headphones 2.Play music 3.Have someone call you 4.Unplug headphones and answer call 5.End call 6.Enjoy the music youQ'Ere now sharing with everyone around you. Correct behavior: If the headphone jack is removed pause music (even if there was a phone call in there somewhere).

column5: WIFI on Android 2.0 will not reconnect to known networks after leaving and returning Motorola Droid
column6: I am running Android 2.0 on the Motorola Droid. I have my house and my workplace saved in the Wireless Q&E networks section of the phone because I have connected to them before. Randomly when I leave my house for instance and return the WIFI will not be recognized. It is enabled and I see Q"EhomeQ"E in my list but it says that it is out of range. If I disable WIFI and then re-enable it it automatically re-connects to it. This seems completely random as sometimes it connects with no problem. I know that there is nothing wrong with my WIFI hotspots at my house or my workplace because I have another pocket device that connects automatically with no problem.

column5: WiFi doesnQ'Et work with certain routers (DHCP ARP works succesfully but everything else fails DNS ICMP TCP etc - can provide pcap dumps if needed)
column6: This problem happens with Motorola Droid (Android 2.0) though it looks like G1 ADP (Cupcake) has same or very similar issue. The WiFi works with other access points but fails with some (e.g. mine). My access point is a FreeBSD 7.2-p4 with an Atheros card. IQ'Em using WPA2- PSK though I donQ'Et think this has any significance in the problem IQ'Em experiencing. I logged the traffic both using tcpdump running on the FreeBSD and a laptop running Kismet. Seems that all of the communication on OSI layer 2 works correctly the problems seem to happen with some communication on higher layers. For example after doing the whole WPA2 handshake the phone obtains its IP successfully also the ARP requests seems to work fine. The problem happens when I try to communicate. Even a ping from adb shell to the default gateway doesnQ'Et get a response. HereQ'Es an example communication: phone does a handshake with the AP * -Q>E DHCP DISCOVER * Q<E- DHCP OFFER (10.0.1.189) * -Q>E DHCP REQUEST * Q<E- DHCP ACK * ARP (asks for 10.0.1.1 - Gateway) * Server sends its MAC address * Q<Enow here is something strange that I donQ'Et understandQ>E * for some reason phone responds with ICMP Destination unreachable (Port unreachable) after checking it seems that the router sends 2x DHCP ACK and this is the response to the second one. * then thereQ'Es lookup for IPv6 (though I donQ'Et have IPv6 setup) * phone starts asking for its MAC address (I was doing ping 10.0.1.189 on adb shell maybe because of that but still seems strange) * IQ'Em starting pinging the gateway but for some reason the gateway doesnQ'Et respond anymore (I know the packets do reach the destination but for some reason are being dropped canQ'Et say what the problem is; could the port unreachable have anything to do with it? ShouldnQ'Et the dhcp client be running all the time?) No other device but the android phone seems to have problems working with my AP. If itQ'Es necessary I can provide more information just please let me know whatQ'Es needed. P.S. DHCP server is running on another subnet on the one with WiFi clients IQ'Em running a relay.

column14: This is actually a combination problem with Google Calendar Sync for Windows and with Motorola DroidQ'Es calendar sync with Google Calendar. The problem has 2 parts (the 2nd part is possibly related to the first so IQ'Em describing both parts here -- feel free to split this into multiple issues if you feel that is appropriate). Up until a week ago I was using a Palm Treo 650 which was synchronized via USB Hotsync to Microsoft Outlook 2003. I had Google Calendar Sync for Windows installed and set to sync only 1 way - Outlook to Google (at that time I was only using Google Calendar to make my schedule available read-only to my wife). About a week ago I switched to a Motorola Droid and after the initial setup and synchronization I changed Google Calendar Sync to be 2-way. The first part of the problem is that with a recurring appointment when some dates (but not all) are changed those changes donQ'Et get synchronized from Outlook to Google Calendar. I had a repeating Monday appointment that I moved to Wednesday a few weeks into the schedule. Although it was properly appearing on Wednesday in both the Treo and Outlook on Google Calendar it was still showing on Mondays (and I only discovered this when I got the Droid a couple of weeks later and noticed that the appointment was on the wrong days). Then I had another recurring appointment for Tuesday evenings (Dance Q&E Funk). This appointment typically happens at a specific time for 3 to 6 weeks (depending on when it is in the year) and then gets moved a half hour earlier and extended by an extra half hour for 3 weeks before going back to the original schedule (and the text change to Dance Q&E Funk Learn Steps). This move/extension happened for the 3 weeks starting Tuesday November 17 and then returns to the original schedule on Tuesday December 8. Several weeks ago I implemented this change on the Treo (and then synchronized it to Outlook) by changing the November 17 appointment and then choosing to apply the change to all following appointmentsto and then going to December 8 and changing it back and again choosing to apply the change to all following appointments. The result on the Treo and in Outlook was then the modified schedule for November 17 November 24 and December 1 with the original schedule remaining for the Tuesdays before November 17 and the Tuesdays from December 8 on forward. However after synchronization to google calendar all of the appointments from December 8 on forward vanished. Again I only noticed the problem when looking today at the next few weeks on the Droid. Now for the 2nd problem. On the Droid I went to Tuesday November 10 and edited the Dance Q&E Funk appointment for that date and chose to change only that one appointment. I changed its date to December 8 I changed the start time from 4:50pm to 4:45pm I changed the reminder time from 45 minutes to 30 minutes and I added a repeat every week on Tuesday and I tapped done. Then I checked the subsequent weeks and I didnQ'Et see the appointment there. So I went back to December 8 and I saw that the appointment had moved back to 4:50pm. So again I changed the time reminder time and repeat. I saw the change reflected on the week calendar for December 8 but didnQ'Et see the event when I moved to the following week. Then I went back to December 8 and again the event had reverted back to 4:50pm. I repeated the change one more time and had the same results. In order to fix the problem I had to delete all of the Tuesday appointments from December 8 on forward from Outlook add a new repeating event starting on December 8 and synchronize that to Google Calendar.

column11: I have a Jawbone Prime bluetooth headset and a Motorola Droid running Android 2.0.1 with a build week of 41/09. Anytime I turn on my headset the in-call volume is always set to minimal requiring me to turn the volume back up to an audible volume. This does not occur on every call. Once the headset has been connected and the volume has been increased during a call. Any subsequent calls will maintain the previous volume settings. I would expect that the volume should be remembered from the last time I had my headset connected and be defaulted to that volume setting. Or at worst case be the same setting that I had on the handset prior to connecting the headset to the phone.

column16: I would like the email app to allow me to choose how many messages are downloaded and stored from the server onto the handset and to be able to choose whether those messages are stored on the internal memory OR the SD card (or other removable memory). I do not like having to Q"ELoad more messagesQ"E that I have already ready just because I need the content of a message that is a few days old. Adding the option for encryption to the stored messages would be even better yet. In addition I would like the email app to allow me to tell it to automatically download all messages and message content (such as attachments) rather than just the text or headers. I dislike having to wait for a message to download every time I select one with an attachment. Plus the message wonQ'Et be marked as Q"EreadQ"E until the entire message is downloaded and the phone will keep bugging me that there is an unread message until I download it. Sometimes I am in places where the data service is not so good so by the time I know there is a message I am many times in a bad place to download it. The data service is good enough to tell me there is a message but with large attachments it takes far too long to download. When this happens itQ'Es just annoying. This is an important feature for people that need access to their emails but may not always work in places with good data coverage. I have a Motorola Droid (ver 2.0)

column19: DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) On the Motorola Droid running the latest Android 2.0.1 the phone will connect to the wrong Wifi SSID on an Access Point serving multiple SSIDs. For example in the NY-NJ metro area Optimum Online has a street-level Wifi service (Optimum Wifi). Optimum put up access points with solar panels on telephone poles around the area and the service works great (login required). I then noticed Comcast Wifi was being added to these access points -- two SSIDs being served from the same physical device. When you select the optimumwifi network (IQ'Em a subscriber) the phone connects to comcastwifi instead. If there is only Optimum Wifi available at a hotspot it works fine. Comcast uses a different login system so my Optimum credentials do not work making this large Wifi network unusable for me. If I leave Wifi enabled the phone wants to connect to Optimum chooses Comcast and since I have not logged into the nag page the phone has no network capability (no 3G since Wifi is connected). It appears as though the phone tries to connect to the first SSID alphabetically which would be C for Comcast. Normally this isnQ'Et an issue for people because either network will take you to the same Internet. In the case of Optimum and Comcast youQ'Ere being directed to different login systems so it matters which the phone chooses. Kind of a hidden bug but definitely a problem.

column23: I am unable to send text messages to my boyfriend because my phone is failing to recognize the area code. I have tried restarting the phone removing the battery deleting and re-adding IQ'Em as a contact and entered his number in 1-555-555-5555 and 555-555- 555 formats. I have the Motorola Droid running Android version 2.0 with an AllTel plan on the Verizon network. He has the HTC G1 running Android version 1.6. I am able to send and receive phone calls from him and receive texts from him. I have another friend on the T- Mobile network and I am ablebto successfully send him texts. I believe that this issue lies with the messaging application as I have been able to successfully send text messages to him using SMS applications from the Market such as HandCent. When I enter his phone number I can see that the zip code is removed from the phone number after clicking off of the phone number field (onto the compose field). I have talked to Verizon support regarding this issue and they are investigating. Please do not hesitate to contact me as I would be more than happy to help you troubleshoot the issue.

column18: Phone: Motorola Droid Steps to reproduce the problem: Place phone in Motorola car dock which turns on car dock mode. Have a friend call you To accept the call you have to swipe your finger across the screen as is always the case. The way I think it should be: Larger single touch buttons should be presented to the user to Accept or Decline the call. Since the phone is in the car dock IQ'Em likely driving. It is sometimes too difficult to get the swipe motion just right while driving. The large single touch buttons are a better solution while in car dock mode.

column13: While there may be other existing Exchange client bugs that are causing this this is a newly reported effect: 1. Composing and Sending a new email from the Exchange client works as expected. 2. Replying to a message produces an undesirable result. The email fails to send and is placed into the Q"EoutboxQ"E folder. 3. Pressing Q"ESend outgoing messagesQ"E does not result in any success or error message. 4. The outgoing message is permanently stuck in the outbox until manually discarded. Correct Behavior 1. User Attempts to send a reply to a message in the Exchange Client 2. The message is placed into the outbox and the message attempts to send 3. The message fails sending. A notification should be given to the user that the message has failed to send with an error code. 4. The user attempts to send outgoing messages by selecting the Q"ESend outgoing messagesQ"E option in the outbox. This should result in immediate feedback as to success/failure Device/OS Motorola Droid Build ESD20

column22: When you mark emails from POP accounts as Q"EreadQ"E in the Android email app some will forget they have been marked as read and will show up as new still. It appears that the messages that behave this way have only the header downloaded and not the body usually due to images in the body that cause the message size to be larger. The only way to permanently mark these messages as read is to open them and allow the full message to be downloaded. This behavior can easily be observed by simply setting up any POP email account and marking messages as read without opening them. Issue observed on Motorola Droid using original factory firmware as well as the 2.0.1 OTA update.

column13: Phone OS: Android 2.0 Device: Motorola DROID (Verizon Network) Problem: Frequent reboots/restarts (could be in the middle of any task or while idle on desk) I have attached several log files below. column24: I am using a Motorola Droid. Firmware Version 2.0.1; Baseband Version C_01.3E.01P; Kernel Version 2.6.29-omap1-g0dd7e0b android-build@apa26 #511; Build Number ESD56 This issue existed before the recent OTA update () and exists after the update as well. - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Place a call to any number. Let the call connect. Lets call this Call_1. 2. Click Add Call which brings up the dialer screen. Call_1 continues normally and I can still hear the person on the other end as I dial a new number on the dialer. 3. Enter a new number and click the green phone handset icon to dial. Lets call this Call_2. At this point Call_1 is placed on hold and I hear the dial tones for Call_2. An icon to Q"EMerge CallsQ"E now appears on the screen. Do not click that icon. 4. Now try to end Call_2 by clicking the red Q"EEnd CallQ"E button (regardless of whether it was connected or not). - What happened. This ends both Call_1 and Call_2. - What you think the correct behavior should be. Only the active call should end (Call_2 in the scenario above). The call on hold (Call_1) should resume. Furthermore I should have the option to switch or swap between the calls (this was present in the out of the box firmware version but is not there after upgrading to build ESD56. Note: Before the recent OTA update. After connecting to Call_2 there used to be an icon on screen for swapping between two Call_1 and Call_2. Even after swapping between calls clicking Q"EEnd CallQ"E would still always end both calls so the behavior was slightly different but the end result was the same issue. After the update the Q"ESwapQ"E option is replaced by Q"EMergeQ"E.

column7: How to produce it: Use a phone where light sensing Q"Eauto-dimmingQ"E is a settings option such as the HTC Hero or Motorola Droid. Run any number of flashlight applications such as: com.android.flashLight. Notice that the phoneQ'Es auto dimming will override any adjustments made to the screen brightness. Which phones/platforms: This only happens for phones that have a light sensing feature that automatically dims the backlight in dark situations. And occurs on Android versions 1.5 and 2.0. Currently there are no version 1.6 phones on the market with auto dimming features. Expected behavior: I would expect there to be some way to programmatically override the auto dimming feature. Either by default from the WindowManager or by some additional privileges granted to the program to do so.

column4: Long phone numbers (eg. 18004664411123412345678#) are not dialed when proximity sensor is engaged
column5: I have a Motorola Droid with Android 2.0.1 installed. Long dialing strings are ignored or delayed when the proximity sensor is activated. The initial numbers are dialed but anything after a PAUSE or WAIT is not dialed until after the proximity sensor is off again. To reproduce: 1. Dial any valid number followed by pauses () and then additional numbers (ex. 180046644111234). 2. Put the phone up to your head. 3. Listen for the numbers after the pause to be dialed. They will not be. What happened: Numbers not dialed. Correct Behavior: Long dialing strings should continue to be dialed regardless of the proximity sensor. NOTE: THIS DOES NOT OCCUR WHEN DEBUGGING OVER USB! It only happens when the phone is unplugged!

column13: I have a Motorola Droid 2.0. Calendar app. Possibly related to issue 4206. I have a repeating event in my calendar that doesnQ'Et show up. This is a monthly event that is the 1st of the month every month. I created the event on my PC more than a year ago the first occurrence is 11/1/2008. If I go all the way back to 11/1/2008 the event is there on my phone but it never shows up after that. In the phone the event is marked as monthly reoccurring (circular arrow icon). I tried adding a new monthly event and it shows up. For this one it starts on 11/26/2009. I tried adding a new monthly event again that starts 11/2/2008 but that doesnQ'Et show up. Maybe the syncing doesnQ'Et go back to last year?

Reproduce (on Motorola Milestone): * during the initial setup set the time to Q"Enetwork timeQ"E * the phoneQ'Es time stays at January 1 1970 (donQ'Et know why it doesnQ'Et pick up network time but it doesnQ'Et) * Internet connections generally work but certificates are considered illegal by the phone. This causes all sorts of things to fail in obscure ways: software updates software installs and Google data synchronization. The user doesnQ'Et get any indication of the source of the problem. This is a real head-scratcher if one doesnQ'Et know about what bad system clocks do to certificates. Suggested solutions: * force the user to provide an approximately correct time during sign-up * when certificates are rejected due to time issues alert the user and give them the option to set the system time right in the dialog box where the connection failed * recognize obviously bad times and dates like Q"EJanuary 1 1970Q"E and do something sensible

column11: the wrong picture is shown from my contacts but thatQ'Es because 2 different facebook friends with the SAME name are synced to 1 contact to which i call and interact with regularly and have their name/number stored in my phone. if i have two friends named john smith on facebook but only have one particular friend as a contact under john smith how would i prevent facebook from syncing BOTH john smiths on my phone? Steps to reproduce: 1. Make sure that Q"ELocation Q&E security Q>E Require patternQ"E is turned off then set your phoneQ'Es locale to de_DE. 2. Lock your phone. 3. Drag the mute button to the left two times. Observed behaviour: You can see two messages appear: 1. Q"ETon ist bereits AUSQ"E (translates to Q"ESound is already OFFQ"E) and 2. Q"ETon ist momentan ANQ"E (translates to Q"ESound is currently ONQ"E). Expected behaviour: As the first message is clearly wrong and the second message is somewhat misleading they should both be replaced. Being a native speaker IQ'Ed propose... 1. Q"ETon ist AUSQ"E (Q"ESound is OFFQ"E) 2. Q"ETon ist ANQ"E (Q"ESound is ONQ"E). This way both messages would match their counterparts in the english locale. Environment: Android 2.0 reproducable using the Android SDK emulator as well as using a Motorola Milestone (German variant of the Droid).

column8: If an application background service or widget calls requestLocationUpdates it will lock out any other applications services or widgets from accessing the same. Reproduce: 1. Use any app that can use the GPS in the background like WeatherBug. 2. Enable GPS in the background in Weatherbug 3. Use Nagivator or GPS Status (they wonQ'Et be able to get a lock while the GPS in the background is running) 4. Disable GPS in the background 5. Navigator or GPS Status will now work. Have reproduced this with market applications and my own code. If someone knows a correction/work-around please advise. It seems it may be when the first call to requestLocationUpdates is called with a longer timeout and the second calls it with a shorter one. Only fix I have come up with is to set an alarm and on that alarm call requestLocationUpdates. As soon as a fix is obtained cancel the update request to free the GPS for others. This pretty much defeats the idea of a location listener system. Also since getLastKnownLocation is pretty much useless this make it very difficult to have more than one application that uses the GPS running at the same time. Device: Motorola Droid Android: 2.0.1

column11: Using the Motorola Droid firmware version 2.0. column19: IQ'Em using a Motorola Droid running version 2.0. HereQ'Es my situation my brotherQ'Es home phone number is the same as dadQ'Es home number because they live together. column12: The stock messaging (MMS) application periodically freezes on the Motorola Droid as described here: http://forum.androidcentral.com/motorola-droid/3633-droid-freezes-when-texting-onscreen-keyboard.html when I click in the text box the on screen keyboard fails to be displayed. About 15 seconds later I get a message to Q"EWaitQ"E or Q"EForce closeQ"E for the texting application. The keyboard is finally displayed when I press the Q"EWaitQ"E button. Here is how I reproduce this bug: 1) Physical keyboard must not be open/visible and screen needs to be in portrait mode 2) Have a texting thread open with someone (need to have already texted someone) 3) Click on the Q'EType to composeQ'E textbox for onscreen keyboard to popup 4) A few seconds later click on the lock button on top of the Droid for the screen to go black 5) A few seconds later (time must be short) click on lock button again and slide to unlock 6) On-screen keyboard will have disappeared click on textbox 7) On-screen keyboard will fail to be displayed and texting app appears to be frozen 8) Click on back button on bottom of screen 9) After about 15 seconds you will receive the dialog Q"ESorry! Activity Messaging (in application Messaging) is not responding.Q"E 10) You will have the option to click Q"EForce closeQ"E or Q"EWaitQ"E clicking wait allows you to return to the app with the keyboard open ready to type.

column16: NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs in 2.0. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have making sure that it runs Android 2.0 If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem. Emails texts and calendar reminders would all vibrate initially but following installation of a 3rd party app they stopped vibrating. The handset does still vibrate for incoming phone calls. Device: Motorola Droid running Android 2.0 Settings selected: Incoming call vibrate and ringtone selected Incoming text vibrate and silent (no ringtone) Incoming email vibrate and silent (no ringtone) Calendar reminder vibrate and silent (no ringtone) Text email and calendar reminders also show in the Notifications pull-down. Locale was installed and set to silence all at night. The following morning the handset did not return to the settings it was still silent. Locale was turned off all setting options were reset to allow vibrate and Locale was eventually uninstalled. However I am unable to get the handset to vibrate for notifications since this occurred. Steps taken: Local uninstalled handset turned off to reboot. Factory Data Reset on phone reset settings for each program - still no vibrate. Reset all settings to default - turn phone off then on then reset all settings to vibrate - still no vibrate. Hard reset done by Verizon tech at store - no help. Today I replaced the handset with a new handset at Verizon. Settings were then input to vibrate for phone calls incoming text and incoming email. And still the phone will not vibrate when I receive a text or email. FYI Sound settings do work - I can choose a ringtone instead of silent and I do receive the audible notification for email text and calendar. Also the volume rocker switch on side of phone does not appear to have any impact on this. I can turn phone to vibrate only or turn volume up all the way - either way the device no longer vibrates for text Q&E email notifications. What SHOULD happen: Text email and calendar notifications should vibrate or not vibrate based on the check box under settings for each of these applications. Thank you for your assistance.

column14: device: Motorola DROID OS: 2.0.1 application: Locale From the Locale support forum: User: I want to be able to turn off or on auto/background sync This will save a lot of battery power as I would turn off the backgronud / auto sync while at work. The Locale Sync Plug-in accomplishes this under Android 1.5/1.6. Response: Due to security restrictions in Android 2.0 this is no longer possible in later versions of Android. Please find a compromise. If I donQ'Et need special permissions to click this setting on/off I should be able to ask an app to change it for me at certain times/ locations. At the very least make an Android Settings Widget available for this!

column11: NOTE: This form is only for requesting new features in Android. For all discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the feature youQ'Ere requesting in as much detail as possible. If youQ'Ere an application developer and are requesting new APIs please include sample code showing how you are proposing the API should be used. IQ'Em a Deaf consumer of the Motorola Droid. In discussing my problem with others in the #android IRC channel it was determined this is a design flaw with Android and not Motorola. When an incoming message whether SMS or GMail or any other type that shows up in the Notification bar arrives there is a single vibrate. I have not found anything that allows me to change the behavior of the vibrate to be longer. This single vibrate is way too subtle to be of any use. And I end up having to pull out my Droid frequently just to check for messages. If the device is not on me but rather on my desk thereQ'Es far less chance IQ'Ell even detect the vibrate. The only time its useful to me is when I have both vibrate and audio on and wear my hearing aid. This is a sad oversight considering that Deaf consumers were the early adopters of messaging devices in the early 90Q'Es and now have been apparently completely left out of the equation in any usability studies. I really like the overall Android experience but if I canQ'Et use it effectively I may have to resort back to Blackberry where paying a monthly feature to keep connected and informed actually happens. Deaf consumers helped pave the way for mainstream adoption of smartphones. I have already showed off my Droid to a number of Deaf people and all were totally turned off by that almost-no vibrate feature. Surely you can push out an update or an app that can fix this soon and re-appeal to Deaf consumers which today remains a significant portion of consumers and GoogleQ'Es history of making their services accessible to Deaf consumers surely should be a part of the Android namespace as well.

NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

Android code version you are running: 1.5 and 1.6 Your development environment: Eclipse with Android 1.6 SDK Describe the problem: If an activity sets the FLAG_FULLSCREEN window flag in the onCreate method it will cause a second instance of the activity to hang at startup for 5-10 seconds. Steps to reproduce: 1. Compile the attached activity in SDK 1.6 and target 1.5 or 1.6 API level 2. Install the activity on a Motorola Droid (OS 2.0) 3. Launch the FullScreenBug activity 4. Immediately click the Menu button. Notice that the menu displays fine. 5. Click the home button and then immediately launch the FullScreenBug activity again. 6. Immediately click the Menu button. Notice that the menu is not displayed. Wait 5-10 seconds and you will see a Q"Enot respondingQ"E dialog displayed. Expected results: Activity should not hang when launched the second time. Observed results: Activity does hang on Android 2.0 (Droid) Additional information: As a workaround I set the FLAG_FULLSCREEN flag the firstTime onDraw is called in the view (the app does not hang with this workaround).

column15: There are two ways to make this problem occur (it could possibly be two separate problems with the same symptoms). IQ'Em running on the Motorola Droid (Android 2.0.1). The first way is to set up an exchange account. Then through exchange (or windows) change your password. The android device will fail to sync and will seemingly never stop trying. Throughout the day the device was relatively hot and the battery didnQ'Et last the entire day. CPU usage was at 50%. I suggest that if there is an authentication error that sync should completely end and a notification be added saying an authentication failure occured. The second way is to once again set up an exchange account but this time go somewhere where there is no service. I ride the train underground two times a day and the email keeps trying to sync. It never takes a break (never goes to 0 CPU just stays at 50% the entire trip). Under Android 2.0.0 I used to turn on airplane mode to tell the email to stop syncing and this seemed to work. Under 2.0.1 this seems to no longer work. There is a possibility that airplane mode relieves the problem in both versions only if it is enabled before a sync attempt occurs; in other words it may be that once a sync attempt starts not even airplane mode can stop it). I suggest that you attach an event handler to the device so that when data service returns to try syncing again (but not to sync until that time).

column6: Calendar entries include creater as guest causes Exchange sync problem
column7: Steps to reproduce: 1. Add appointment from device wait for sync 2. Look at appointment from Google Calendar. Note that creator of appointment shows as a guest. 3. Try to sync to Exchange (2003) using Google Calendar Sync. This fails. 4. Remove appointment creator from guest list on Google Calendar. 5. Appointment successfully syncs to Exchange using Google Calendar sync Given that the Google account holder is not included as a guest by default when an appointment is created on gmail they should not be included as a guest when created on Android. This also makes these appointments sync properly to Exchange. This problem was noted on a Motorola Droid Android 2.0.1 build ESD56.

Turned up the volume on the car stereo 5. As the music played I started to hear little clicking / popping noises coming from the car speakers. 6. Turned off the media volume on the Droid 7. I hear the clicking / popping noises - like the clicking noise of an old movie reel. 8. Played other songs on the Droid and even went the Droid Desktop / Home and the sound still continues. 9. No issues at all when plugging other audio devices w/ the 3.5mm cable (ex. iPOD) so the issue is with the Droid... ---------- NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs in 2.0. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. column15: IQ'Em not sure how to recreate the problem from scratch and IQ'Em guessing that if this problem was on everyoneQ'Es phone I would have found some useful information while searching. I tried several times to find information on this before posting. If I missed something I apologize in advance. For me to recreate I do the following: 1. Reboot Phone (shutdown/power on) 2. Use pattern to unlock phone 3. Try to open a few apps. The first 2 open fine the third will not open. This could be any app that isnQ'Et already Q"ErunningQ"E from Advanced Task KillerQ'Es perspective. The problem started of course with not being able to open anything. Since then I have uninstalled a few apps and can open a few before I hit the Q"EceilingQ"E. 4. Open up Advanced Task Killer (which IQ'Ed prefer not to use at all) and kill just ONE application. 5. Try to open the application(s) in question again. This time it works. And not just for one every app that I previously had a problem with starts working just fine. When this happens there is no visual notice on the phone of whatQ'Es going on the application highlights after I press it and then nothing happens. One thing I can replicate every single time is the following chunk of code. This time it was when trying to open flixter but again this could be for anything that isnQ'Et already running (sometimes happens to be the browser which is how I first noticed it). --java vm crashing-- I/ActivityManager( 1030): Start proc net.flixster.android for activity net.flixster.android/.Flixster: pid=1591 uid=10070 gids={3003 1015} W/ActivityManager( 1030): Activity HistoryRecord{44886120 net.flixster.android/.Flixster} being finished but not in LRU list D/dalvikvm( 993): GC freed 290 objects / 11040 bytes in 112ms E/ProcessState( 1591): Using /dev/binder failed: unable to mmap transaction memory. I/dalvikvm( 1591): Debugger thread not active ignoring DDM send (t=0x41504e4d l=38) D/AndroidRuntime( 1591): Shutting down VM W/dalvikvm( 1591): threadid=3: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x4001b180) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): Uncaught handler: thread main exiting due to uncaught exception E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): java.lang.NullPointerException E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at android.os.ServiceManager.getService (ServiceManager.java:55) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at android.app.ActivityManagerNative.getDefault(ActivityManagerNative.java:78) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at android.app.ActivityThread.attach (ActivityThread.java:4257) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at android.app.ActivityThread.main (ActivityThread.java:4308) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative (Native Method) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Method.java:521) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run (ZygoteInit.java:860) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main (ZygoteInit.java:618) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): Error reporting crash: java.lang.NullPointerException E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at android.os.ServiceManager.getService (ServiceManager.java:55) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at android.app.ActivityManagerNative.getDefault(ActivityManagerNative.java:78) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit.crash(RuntimeInit.java:337) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit$UncaughtHandler.uncaughtException (RuntimeInit.java:76) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at java.lang.ThreadGroup.uncaughtException (ThreadGroup.java:887) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at java.lang.ThreadGroup.uncaughtException (ThreadGroup.java:884) E/AndroidRuntime( 1591): at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) I/Process ( 1591): Sending signal. PID: 1591 SIG: 9 --java vm crashing-- I am using a Motorola Droid with Android 2.0. I have attached 3 files. app-state.txt - DDMS Q"Edump app stateQ"E device-state.txt - DDMS Q"Edump device stateQ"E logcat.txt - a logcat from around the time I was reproducing the problem. A search for flixster will show the first few attempts that failed and then you will see where I forced a close on com.akproduction.notepad. After that flixster was successful The only thing that seems to alleviate this problem for me is to use Advanced Task Killer to close everything that doesnQ'Et necessarily have to be running whenever I reboot. Please let me know if there is anything else i can provide. I tried to be as thorough as possible. -Tommy

column17: I found this on the motorola forums while investigating my own email crashes. https://supportforums.motorola.com/message/65802#65802 Quoting the above message: SOLUTION: I noticed through trial/error that messages with invalid headers tend to cause a crash. Example: if the Q"ETo:Q"E line is Q"Eundisclosed recipients ;Q"E rather than an email address that can be parsed it crashes EVERY TIME. I use Fastmail and was able to resolve my issues by creating a sieve filter that moves email with invalid headers into a subfolder which I never open from my phone. This discussion should probably be moved to a forum that Google monitors - *** does Motorola care about the software? I havenQ'Et tried to reproduce this myself but the guy sounds like he narrowed it down quite thoroughly. Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. Send an email with an unparseable email address in one of the address headers in this case Q'ETo: Q"Eundisclosed recipients ;Q"EQ'E - What happened. Email application forced closed (I donQ'Et know if it happens on every message since I didnQ'Et try to reproduce it myself). - What you think the correct behavior should be. DonQ'Et try to parse the email address and just leave it as a string that cannot be used in a reply/reply-all This is all related to the VZW/MOT Droid

column10: This issue occurs on a Motorola Droid: Firmware version 2.0 Baseband version C_01.3B.01P Kernel version 2.6.29-omap1-g04df51f android-build@apa26#477 Build number ESD20 situation 1: The voice recognition does not interpret a contact consisting of Q"EDr.Q"E or Q"EDrQ"E to be a spoken Q"EdoctorQ"E; it only interprets it as a spoken Q"EdurrQ"E. On occasion a google search is the result of prompts. This occurs in both Q"Edial doctor weissQ"E and Q"Ecall doctor weissQ"E prompts. situation 2: The voice recognition has much difficulty discerning between initials Q&E individual letters and other contact names among a variety of attempted contact naming schemes: Q"EEBCQ"E Q"EE.B.C.Q"E Q"EE B CQ"E. It is always the last on the suggested list--unless a google search is the result (with erroneously-interpreted words)--with many erroneous suggested contacts being listed before it. Oddly Q"EDBT CenterQ"E is usually listed as the first suggestion despite the two extra syllables in the contact name yet sequential suggestions are often solely 2-syllable contact names. Frequently a google search is the result of prompts. This occurs in both Q"Edial E B CQ"E and Q"Ecall E B CQ"E and Q"Edial E A BQ"E and Q"Ecall E A BQ"E prompts.

column16: NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs in 2.0. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have making sure that it runs Android 2.0 If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem. Emails texts and calendar reminders would all vibrate initially but following installation of a 3rd party app they stopped vibrating. The handset does still vibrate for incoming phone calls. Device: Motorola Droid running Android 2.0 Settings selected: Incoming call vibrate and ringtone selected Incoming text vibrate and silent (no ringtone) Incoming email vibrate and silent (no ringtone) Calendar reminder vibrate and silent (no ringtone) Text email and calendar reminders also show in the Notifications pull-down. Locale was installed and set to silence all at night. The following morning the handset did not return to the settings it was still silent. Locale was turned off all setting options were reset to allow vibrate and Locale was eventually uninstalled. However I am unable to get the handset to vibrate for notifications since this occurred. Steps taken: Local uninstalled handset turned off to reboot. Factory Data Reset on phone reset settings for each program - still no vibrate. Reset all settings to default - turn phone off then on then reset all settings to vibrate - still no vibrate. Hard reset done by Verizon tech at store - no help. Today I replaced the handset with a new handset at Verizon. Settings were then input to vibrate for phone calls incoming text and incoming email. And still the phone will not vibrate when I receive a text or email. FYI Sound settings do work - I can choose a ringtone instead of silent and I do receive the audible notification for email text and calendar. Also the volume rocker switch on side of phone does not appear to have any impact on this. I can turn phone to vibrate only or turn volume up all the way - either way the device no longer vibrates for text Q&E email notifications. What SHOULD happen: Text email and calendar notifications should vibrate or not vibrate based on the check box under settings for each of these applications. Thank you for your assistance.

column17: Android code version you are running: Motorola Droid with 2.0.1 but I also saw this on the 2.0.0 firmware Describe the problem: Handbrake for the Mac turns B-frames on by default when it rips DVDs. These movies cannot be played using the Q"EMoviesQ"E media player. This also happens with the Q"EMeridianQ"E player from the Android Market. Encoding the same video with the same parameters but without B-frames results in the video playing without any problems. Steps to reproduce: 1.Using Handbrake for the Mac to rip a DVD using the Q"ENormalQ"E settings. I used a 1 minute clip at 720x400 to speed up the rip. This video will have B-frames set to 2. Rip the same clip but set the B-frames to 0 in the Advanced Settings. The default settings are MP4 container/H264 video/AAC audio. 2. Copy the videos to the phone and play them using the built in Movies or Meridian. Expected results: Video should either play properly warn the user about being unable to play the video or play the video improperly but not freeze the system. The third option is how other incompatible video formats are handled. Observed results: The system becomes unresponsive and reboots after a while. Additional information: When the video is encoded at 240x128 with B-frames the system doesnQ'Et freeze but the video still drops frames.

I have the new motorola Droid with the google 2.0 software. I went into the email application installed on the phone and had seen there was no updated emails or my phone notifying me of new emails. I have the email frequency set to every 5 minutes due to getting a lot of emails the correct behavior should have been to have the device notify me and not have to go in manually and retrieve my emails then have my phones notifier advise me i have emails. Has anyone else had this problem before? If so how did you get around it?

column14: IQ'Eve noticed that sometimes launching the Maps application with a geo: URI containing latitude and longitude will instead snap to the userQ'Es current location. Performing the same action again a few seconds later causes the map to be centered on the requested location. IQ'Eve seen this on both the ADP1 1.6 build and the Motorola Droid so it doesnQ'Et seem like a vendor-specific bug. What IQ'Em doing: Starting the Maps application with an intent specifying: - Action = android.intent.action.VIEW - Data = geo: URI containing latitude/longitude coordinates What I expect to see: The map display centered on the location provided in the intent. What I see: On first attempt the map might be centering as requested but then immediately jumps to the userQ'Es location. Subsequent attempts work properly. The center on user location seems to coincide with a possible starting up of the mapping engine so it snaps to user location on the first try after the device is rebooted then works successfully for a while and fails again later.

column5: Clock on Droid set to GPS time not UTC
column6: The clock on the Motorola Droid is ~15 seconds fast. This means its clock is being set to GPS time instead of UTC. The GPS epoch began in January 1980 and there have been 15 leap-seconds since then. GPS does not recognize leap-seconds so it leads UTC time by exactly 15 seconds. Since just about everyone else in the world synchronizes to UTC time this means the DroidQ'Es clock is wrong. I wrote an app Q"ESNTP ClientQ"E to perform an NTP query to measure the clock offset. I have had other Droid users report the same 15 second offset. 15 seconds may not seem like a lot but I have received reports that there are apps that depend on a fairly precise clock that wonQ'Et work correctly on the droid because of this offset. Hardware: Motorola Droid Android: 2.0 Q&E 2.0.1 Carrier: Verizon Wireless Settings: Settings -Q>E Date Q&E time -Q>E Automatic is checked.

column14: My friend and I are noticing a serious and reproducible sound output bug present on Android 2.01 with our Moto Droids (both different build weeks): If you receive an incoming call while using either the native audio player or other applications such as Mixzing with headphones connected and attempt to unplug them to answer the call the system does not switch back to the ear speaker. Work-around for listening to the call is speakerphone or plug the headphones back in. Correct Behavior: System should automatically detect stereo mini-plug disconnect during incoming call and default back to earpiece. This seems like a coding error where the scenario described was not considered. Thanks for noting this; hopefully the fix will be present with the 2.1 release as it is a serious and commonly occurring bug. Issue has also been submitted to Motorola. Best Dave

column17: I am using Android 2.0 on the Motorola Droid. Problem: If my phone is initially on vibrate then if I put my phone into silent mode via the lock screen and then back to Q"Esound onQ"E mode the phone does not return to vibrate but rather to some default volume. How to reproduce the problem: 1. Put phone on vibrate. 2. Hit power button twice to go to the lock screen. 3. Drag speaker icon to the left to put phone in silent mode. 4. Drag speaker icon again to put phone back to Q"Esound onQ"E mode. 5. Volume will not be on the vibrate setting as was initially but rather some default volume. How the phone should behave: It would be nice if the phone went back to vibrate as it initially was. I usually keep my phone on vibrate but occasionally put it on silent. Whenever I want vibrate back I have to unlock my phone and fiddle around with the volume rocker instead of a simple swipe on my lock screen. The volume seems to return to its initial value (i.e. the value before I put the phone in silent mode) for all volume settings except for vibrate. Thank you in advance.

column20: Phone: Motorola Milestone Android version: 2.0 Background info: Vodafone Spain has a sms service where you can send sms very cheap to your partner using a special telephone number 101. (If my partner send a message to 101 I will receive it if I send it to 101 my partner will receive it) SMS messages are not threaded together when send from a short (3 digit) phone number. It also shows WRONG information about the sender; it takes the first word of the actual message as as being the sender ignoring the actual number. Steps to reproduce: Send a message Q"Ehello how are youQ"E to a three digit phone number like 101 and then a message Q"Eare you coming home?Q"E to the same number Result on receiver phone (running Android 2.0): Message arrives as being from Q"EhelloQ"E with the text Q"Ehow are youQ"E user is unable to reply as phone tries to send it to Q"EhelloQ"E and fails The second message gets a new thread as the phone thinks the second message came from Q"EareQ"E Expected/correct result: Message arrives as being from 101 or contact name (depending if 101 is a known number in the contact db) and replies will be send to 101 The second message should appear in the same thread as it comes from the same sender

column18: When copying CDQ'Es over to my Motorola Droid I noticed that if the album happens to have multiple . (periods) at the begining of the title it will not display in the Music Player. However when you remove the leading .Q'Es it will display fine and when the album is displayed in the player it correctly shows the leading .Q'Es from the ID tag. Steps to reproduce: 1. Purchase MetallicaQ'Es album Q"E...And Justice For AllQ"E 2. Use your favorite software to rip it (But donQ'Et share it or every member of Metallica will personally hunt you down and punish you... and itQ'Es wrong) 3. Make sure that the ripped directory structure preserves the exact album name as a folder (...And Justice For All) 4. Transfer this album to your Motorola Droid 5. Open the Music Player 6. Note that the album does not show. 7. Re-mount the SD card 8. Access the album Directory on the SD card 9. Rename the Album folder to be Q"EAnd Justice For AllQ"E 10. Unmount SD card and launch the Music Player 11. Note that the album now displays while reading the ID Tag correctly and displaying the album name correctly. Device: Motorola Droid Thanks!

column20: Guys Unlike Blackberry on a Droid when you receive a calendar appointment there are no Accept or Decline buttons in the message. In order to Q"ErespondQ"E to an appointment you need to exit the email application enter the Corporate Calendar application and then click on the appointment and respond from there. This is obviously not desirable they need to make this work better in order for corporate email to work seemlessly. Steps to reproduce: 1) Set up your Motorola Droid running Android 2 for corporate sync confirm email and calendar are syncing correctly. 2) Have a friend send you an invite 3) Notice no Accept or Decline buttons in the invite email 4) In order to accept or decline the appointment you have to leave the email app enter the calendar app find the appointment and reply from there. 5) This is really cumbersome for heavy corporate email users and should be fixed asap. Thanks Brian

column13: For those of us that are not likely to ever use the car or multimedia dock functions in some Android devices it would be very handy to be able to disable the trigger intents for those entirely. A checkbox located somewhere in the Settings app would do nicely. The reason for this request: At least in the case of the Motorola Droid (Milestone Tao Sholes etc.) the magnetic sensor that triggers the dock events becomes an annoyance when used with phone cases that are sized properly for the phone but werenQ'Et designed with the existence of that sensor in mind. That includes at least 70% of the cases marketed as being compatible specifically with that phone.

Contact displays multiple Q"EFacebook profileQ"E entries
column6: Something is causing Q>E 1 Q"EFacebook profileQ"E entries to appear when viewing a contact. I suspect this may occur when a Facebook user changes their profile picture. Motorola Droid Firmware version 2.0 Kernel version 2.6.29-omap1-g04df51f

column18: I am using a Motorola Droid phone with the stock Android 2.0 OS. These particular emails are being received using Q"EEmailQ"E and not Q"EGmailQ"E. If you think this makes a difference I will see if I can forward the exact message source to my gmail account. While most multipart/alternative emails work (text/plain and text/html) such as those sent by gmail or the Android software itself these particular emails sent out by UC BerkeleyQ'Es bspace system do not display and instead render as two attachments (no description on either) neither of which will open: just says Q"EThe attachment cannot be displayedQ"E. This combined with the fact that there is no obvious Q"EView Message SourceQ"E feature on the phone makes it impossible for me to read any course announcements at my university. By doing some hand editing of the .eml file and dragging and dropping the emails into Thunderbird I was able to determine that itQ'Es caused by a space before the Q"E; charsetQ"E in the content-type header. Every other email client I have used handles this correctly (Even gmail). HereQ'Es an example of a broken email: Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=Q"EABCDEFGQ"E Message-ID: Q<Eblah-2009-12-02@message-idQ>E Date: Wed 2 Dec 2009 09:00:45 -0800 (PST) Subject: Android multipart/mixed test --ABCDEFG Content-Type: text/plain ; charset=iso-8859-1 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit This attachment will not display on the phone --ABCDEFG Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1 Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit This attachment will display --ABCDEFG--

column5: Two contacts with same phone number adding direct dial shortcut dials the first of the two - no recognition that two exist.
column6: Running Android 2.0 on the Motorola Droid. 1) Two contacts: BO Q&E KB 2) Create home screen direct dial shortcut to KB 3) Dial shortcut for KB 4) Call is made to BO IQ'Em assuming its finding the first one in the list that matches the number? Either way there should be some recognition of there being two numbers. Of course the fact I have two numbers is wrong due to BO leaving my company and KB taking over his phone (BO was never removed from contacts). Thanks!

column12: Android does not appear to be able to connect via DHCP to an APIPA network range (169.254.0.0 - 169.254.255.255). Specifically my home network uses 169.254.25.0/24. Through debugging with a Motorola DROID I was able to alter my network range to 10.x.x.x or add a static IP address of 169.254.25.34 and connect to the network. When attempting to obtain a DHCP address on 169.254.25.0/24 DROID will successfully connect to the network then fail with the message Q"EUnsuccessfullyQ"E when attempting to Q"EObtaining IP address from network...Q"E This was tested on both a Netgear WGT624 v3 and a D-Link DIR-655. Latest test was using Android 2.0.1. FWIW I started using this range long ago before I knew its significance. I understand why Android might be intentionally not obtaining an IP from this range.

column15: Here are several apps which are affected (only a sample there are far more!!!): GeOrg - Geocaching Organizer v1.1.3 Application for Android | Entertainment OpenTable v1.0.8 Application for Android | Lifestyle FlightTrack v1.1.0 Application for Android | Travel My Coupons - Eat FREE Daily! v4.00 Application for Android | Shopping New York Subway v1.3 Applikation f?r Android | Reisen WayFinder NYC v1.02 Applikation f?r Android | Reisen I am one of the affected milestone users and I am far from alone. At least all of the milestones sold by amazon Germany are affected! Milestones branded by Vodafone or O2 Germany are working perfectly. I know it is unusual for the USA but in Europe it is quite common to buy phones WITHOUT an carrier-contract. Those phones are NOT branded by Vodafone or others and they are simlock-free! Exactly those phones have no access to copy protected apps in the market. Our guess at the moment is that google missed those configuration and handles them as illegal (rootet) phones... are we right with this assumption??? But our phones are 110% legal with plain Motorola configuration right from the factory! It is not only that we can not buy or download any new copy protected apps. User who bought such an app on another Adnroid phone and now got themselves a new Milestone can not access their legaly bought apps anymore!!! Google need to react here really quick. We are honest users and your loyal fanbase! All of the affected phones have the following ORIGINAL Motorola setup: Modellnummer : Milestone Firmware-Version : 2.0 Firmware-Konfigurationsversion : GAS_EMEA_USASHLS00RTDACH_P001 Baseband-Version : 3GDMEPU91A_U_91.08.0DP Baseband-Konfigurationsversion : UCASHLSEMEAB1B803F.0R Kernel-Version : 2.6.29-omap1 a21146@ca25rhe53 #1 Build-Nummer : SHOLS_U2_01.03.1.125764182 Please also see those discussions: http://www.google.com/support/forum/p/Android+Market/thread?tid=303d62515914af75Q&Ehl=en http://groups.google.com/group/android-developers/browse_frm/thread/bda3d385db2b44dc?scoring=dQ&E PLEASE HELP US! best regards Christian

column12: How to reproduce: 1. Create an event 2. Save it 3. Now edit it and write something into the Q"EDescriptionQ"E field. 4. Leave te Tab open and wait til screensaver/lock screen appears. 5. Unlock the screen 6. Description is either gone or has been reset to previous state I often put Notes into the Description-Field while listening to my mentor. I ended up not typing anything for 15 seconds and bam gone they were :( The Bug does not exist upon creating an event only editing. It happens with all fields not just the Description! How it should be: Save (not save to calendar but Q"EkeepQ"E it on the screen) while lockscreen is active. Found on Android 2.0 on a Motorola Milestone

column21: Entering the url: http://test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.com (16 tests one .com) into the browser causes a crash and disappear with no message to the user. Instead a server not found page should be shown. However http://test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.com (15 tests one .com) works just fine (by fine I mean it displays a page that says the server canQ'Et be found). IQ'Em conjecturing now but itQ'Es as if the domain name is parsed into an array that can only hold 16 strings and an OutOfBounds error is happening. This also happens for embedded urls. If a web developer entered something like Q<Eimg src=Q"Ehttp://test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.test.comQ"EQ>E in their site the Android browser would crash with no explanation given to the user. I was only able to test this on the Motorola Droid but it is consistently reproducible.

column17: Recently you updated the camera on the Motorola Droid to correct issues with focus etc. This worked but now if I take a picture in any focus mode but close up with the flash on it will only take the top 1/3 or so of the picture and the rest is black. I donQ'Et know if itQ'Es not taking it or if itQ'Es an issue with the flash but this didnQ'Et happen prior to the update.

column15: When restarting the Android operating system on my Motorola Droid once the operating system has fully loaded it doesnQ'Et seem to recognize the environment for quite a while. I have to turn the screen off then turn it right back on and it recognizes it again. Not sure if whatever is keeping track of this just isnQ'Et loaded yet possibly?

column14: This is an overlapping bug with the Zimbra email product - it appears that both platforms have small bugs that end up with a very bad net result. Zimbra is an exchange alternative that has a Mobile connector using the ActiveSync protocol. It works well with Windows Mobile Symbian iPhone and some 3rd party ActiveSync emulators for Blackberry. When you configure the Motorola Droid device to connect to this server it works reasonably well except 1 large problem. By default only the first 512 bytes of the email is returned to the device - and unlike other ActiveSync devices - the Droid doesnQ'Et appear to understand the response code that says the email was truncated and you should offer the ability to download the rest of the email. Based on some research (described on the above link as well)... part of the problem is that the Zimbra server is taking the Q<ETruncationQ>E7Q<E/TruncationQ>E directive and interpreting that as 512 bytes. I cannot find documentation to say exactly what code 7 should be. So the server is returning a partial email with the Q<EPOOMMAIL:BodyTruncatedQ>E1Q<E/POOMMAIL:BodyTruncatedQ>E response. It appears that the Droid is blindly assuming that the entire email was retrieved or not properly handling the response code because it doesnQ'Et give any ability to download the message. Related bug has been posted to the following URL - but both devices seem to be not fully implementing the protocol correctly. http://bugzilla.zimbra.com/show_bug.cgi?id=42482

column5: Sound turns on after selecting Q"ESilent modeQ"E option when phone is on vibrate
column6: I am using Android 2.0 on the Motorola Droid. Problem: When the phone is on vibrate and I select the Q"ESilent modeQ"E option in the Phone Options menu the sound turns on. How to reproduce the problem: 1. Put phone on vibrate. 2. Long-press power button until the Phone Options menu pops up. 3. Select Q"ESilent mode.Q"E The phone is the exact opposite of silent; the sound is on. What the phone should do: If I select silent mode the phone should go silent regardless of my initial volume setting. This is the case if I set my phone to silent from the lock screen. I donQ'Et think people would expect the volume to go up when they hit a button saying Q"ESilent mode.Q"E

column17: Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: When forwarding an e-mail from the Corporate e-mail account the forwarded message is sent as an .EML attachment. This includes the entire conversation thread up to that point sans any new text entered which is sent along properly. This makes following the flow of a simple e-mail thread extremely cumbersome for other users especially those on mobile handsets. Additionally some corporate policies prohibit or discourage users from sending forwarded messages as attachments. - What you think the correct behavior should be. Messages forwarded should be sent using the same formating (rich text text HTML) that the original message was sent in and not encased in an attachment no matter how well supported. At a minimum the message should be converted to plain text when forwarded from the handset. Device: Motorola Droid OS Ver: Android 2.0 This is apparantly listed as a bug to be corrected on an internal Verizon Memo but I do not see it listed here for tracking purposes.

column10: Android 2.0.1 (Verizon Droid) The SPACE and DEL onscreen buttons donQ'Et always vibrate or vibration is very weak and random when in portrait mode. When in landscape mode it is much better with those two keys. It appears the problem is better/worse depending on the app using the onscreen keyboard. The Native Gmail and Exchange have the problem but MotorolaQ'Es Q"ECorporate DirectoryQ"E works on 99% of the keypresses (space and del). At times it goes 10-20 key presses before space button will vibrate once. As a test I turned to landscape mode and tested the Q"EpQ"E button - which is where the space would be in portrait mode and it works consistently. So it appears to be a software issue vs. hardware (to me anyway). It may not be noticed by many because it really manifests itself when repeatedly pressing space and del. It seems to have gotten worse after the 2.0.1 update. To reproduce the problem: 1. Ensure haptic feedback on Android keyboard is on 2. Open Gmail and compose new message in portrait mode. 3. Touch letters and notice a solid vibration feedback. 4. press SPACE or DEL repeatedly until you no longer feel vibration on every keypress. Sometimes it will be on first press or it could be on the 5th. 5. download MotorolaQ'Es Q"ECorporate DirectoryQ"E - note that the problem is hardly noticeable.

column12: I have the Motorola Droid running 2.0 and when I first got it I transfered a bunch of pics to it via Bluetooth from my MacBook (white). It worked fine the first time. Now when I try sending a file Bluetooth File Exchange shows my phone in itQ'Es discovered list but when it tries to send the file it cannot do it. It shows the message Q"EThe file transfer failed: the recipient has stopped or refused the transfer.Q"E Nothing shows up on my phone at all when the Mac is trying to send the file. The phone and computer are paired and still nothing happens. IQ'Eve tried unpairing them and pairing them again and it still doesnQ'Et work. Both are set on Discoverable. Like I said it worked perfectly the first time and another time after that but now nothing.

column6: I recently tried to open the Q"EGalleryQ"E application and got the Q"EApplication is not installed on your phoneQ"E message. Then I noticed that actually had 2 copies of the Q"EGalleryQ"E application on my device. When I launched the 2nd one it worked. How can I remove the defective one? For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

column7: IQ'Em using the Motorola Droid with 2.0.1 since the OTA update on Friday and everything was working great until today. Shortly after installing an app (unfortunately I installed a few in a short space of time so I donQ'Et know who the culprit is) my phone went into a reboot loop. The loop skipped the Motorola logo when it rebooted and would come up to the lock screen and when restart maybe 10 seconds later at most. I tried removing the memory card plugging the phone into my computer and I tried to get the phone to enter safe mode which it did but that didnQ'Et stop the loop. Eventually I managed to be quick enough to initiate a factory reset of the phone within that 10 second window and it seems to be fine now. However something is obviously wrong if an app was able to cause what was almost an unfixable issue like this.

column20: I have the Motorola Droid on Verizon firmware 2.0. There is no way that I can see to move emails to a subfolder. There is also no way to move to the next/previous message when you are in landscape mode. Landscape mode is mostly useless without this as it is way too much of a pain in the ass to have to keep alternating between portrait and landscape. Thank you Raul

column26: I have a Motorola Droid with Cupcake (2.0). In our rural area most people give their number as Q"E1034Q"E or Q"E5154Q"E. Most of my contacts in my address book are either 4 or 7 digits but the phone needs to dial the entire 10 digit string to complete a call. My Palm would automatically prepend the number. Can this be added to Android?

column14: It would appear that after a given period of inactivity whether on AC or battery power the device stops synchronizing emails in all account types (Exchange IMAP POP and possibly the Gmail app as well) until activity is once again detected or a manual synchronization is performed. The correct behavior should be either that the device never stops synchronizing regardless of how long the device has been inactive or that there should be a setting that governs this function allowing the user to define the period of inactivity before email synchronization stops. Issue observed on Motorola Droid using both factory firmware and the 2.0.1 OTA update.

I would like Android to automatically vibrate for incoming calls when IQ'Eve turned on Silent mode. IQ'Em using Android 2.0 on the Motorola Droid. I see that when using the volume buttons the last step before Silent mode is Silent mode with vibrate enable. But when using the Silent mode option on the lock screen there isnQ'Et a way to enable vibrate without unlocking and going through the Settings-Q>ESound Q&E Display menu.

column11: When I take a photo with my Motorola Droid I can see the gps info in the phone but when I upload to Picasa Picasa does not show the location. Also the exif info does not always have the lattitude/longitude right.

column15: Motorola Droid. When in the Call Progress Screen the notification bar is visible and updates but it cannot be pulled down.

column20: With the android 2.0 on the Motorola Droid phone the home screen and itQ'Es icons will not auto rotate even with the function enabled with the physical keyboard closed. When opened it will do this but not when closed. An exception to this is when it is in the car dock. If you back out of the car mode menu to the home screen and rotate the dock between portrait and landscape the accelerometer will trigger the correct rotation of the screen and itQ'Es icons.
