column16: NOTE: I reported this bug to Motorola who sent me here: https://supportforums.motorola.com/message/72810#72810 - Steps to reproduce the problem. On a Motorola Droid running Android 2 (Kernel version 2.6.29-omap1-g04df51f android-build@apa26 #477) tap on a link or menu selection. It may take a few tries but eventually your tap will be ignored and the screen will scroll instead. - What happened. Tapping on a link or menu selection sometimes causes the screen to autoscroll to the bottom of the page. ItQ'Es just as likely to happen on a fast tap as on a slower tap. IQ'Eve personally noticed it intermittently in the web browser android market and Gmail but it may happen elsewhere as well. IQ'Eve also made sure I only have one finger on the screen at a time while tapping. Many many others have reported seeing this problem but so far it doesnQ'Et appear that anyone has reported it here. Here are some examples: http://androidforums.com/motorola-droid/17131-quick-scroll-bottom-bug-feature.html#post126845 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ocoxDHg09tE http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=du0NkYiuX3I - What you think the correct behavior should be. Tapping on the screen should never result in scrolling.

column10: I bought my Motorola DROID (Android 2.0) about a week ago returned it due to frequent restarts. Exchanged my phone thought it was working good but it has the same issues. The restarts are not really related to any specific task. It has frozen and rebooted on the password pattern screen checking messages while taking a picture etc. My first DROID even restarted right after I got the phone and got in my car so I donQ'Et think its related to any installed Apps. This is my 2nd phone and IQ'Em pretty displeased with the overall stability of it. I have also noticed that fast/rapid navigation easily causes the system to reboot. An example would be rapidly tapping one of the appsQ'Es buttons that spawns a sound clip or moving through menus quickly. However My device restarts even when IQ'Em not using it. I can leave it on a desk idle and notice it reboot itself. IQ'Eve seen this happen with my old and new/replacement DROID. Let me know if I can do anything. IQ'Em thinking about returning it again but I have a feeling it wonQ'Et make much of a difference. Also I noticed on my new replacement when the person first turned it on (preparing to go through setup) it loaded to the screen with the green robot and rebooted at that screen (it was laying on a desk while the person was busy so I donQ'Et know if it was due to automatic timeout or not but maybe this causes a problem with the phone if it happens). IQ'Em not sure if it is suppose to do that the first time around but I thought it was worth noting.

column12: The application interface to the BOA mobile interface is not correct. I have 6 accounts with BOA. Only 3 random accounts were selected to view in the accounts select tab. The remaining 3 have no ability to select or drill down to see transactions or pending items to be posted with either my screen or keyboard. CanQ'Et believe I could stroll through 20 pages of USA today with no problem on my Verizon Motorola Droid in record speed and only 6 accounts which is about 1 page cannot be displayed properly to view detail. Well folks I am disappointed in the QA testing of any product released by Android to the public. This is great technology but with flaws to the biggest USA Bank in America is A MAJOR PROBLEM. I called Verizon Motorola Google but yet noone has a technical staff that can address a problem with just minimal testing can be fixed. Hello developers and corporate enterprise the customers want a product that can do well with what is advertised. Test it on all the devices. Hello is there any technical staff out there!! If not no wonder we are where we are in America... God Bless you all.

column15: I recently purchased a Motorola S9 for us with my Android for phone calls as well as for music listening. The problem is that although the phone is paired properly with the S9 device and music listening with A2DP works well the headset does not connect for phone calls. Steps to reproduce: *Turn on phone *Turn on S9 headset *Enter bluetooth settings *Click on S9 headset choose to pair *Click on S9 headset choose to connect *Dial and connect to a contact or phone number Expected behavior: Audio will play through the S9 speakers and audio will be captured through the S9 Mic. Actual Behavior: The device shows that bluetooth is being used (bluetooth logo is shown menu option Q"EbluetoothQ"E has green bar. Audio is played through the phone speaker audio is capture through phone microphone. Phone Version: 1.5 Cupcake

column8: Please note that this is not a request related to the existing volume control on the Motorola Droid handheld. Blackberry Curve has an option in the ring tone assignment menu to designate the volume as Q"Eescalating.Q"E When chosen the ring tone begins at a low volume and escalates until maximum volume is achieved or an action causes the ring to end. Motorola Droid allows you to set the device volume through a range as low as Q"EoffQ"E -Q>E Q"EvibrateQ"E -Q>E and a scale from low to high. This volume level is constant for all applications (incoming call notice email notice calendar event notice etc.). Sometimes I wish to have my all my notices - except phone calls - subdued and at a low volume. Request feature to either allow all ringtones to escalate in volume (so a longer or repeating tone becomes louder) or to assign a volume parameter to each notification tone. Thanks.

column19: IQ'Em running Android 2.0.1 on the Motorola Droid. Not sure if this is an every time occurrence or just once in a while but when getting a text or call from someone who is a Facebook contact (with their phone number as part of the contact) their name/photo doesnQ'Et show up only the phone number as if theyQ'Ere an unknown caller. I donQ'Et have the problem with Facebook contacts merged with traditional contacts just when the person is ONLY a Facebook contact (with the correct phone number added to their contact). Makes it very interesting when you think youQ'Ere getting messages and calls from random people only to discover that you already know them via Facebook. It then becomes necessary to create a regular contact for them and merge the two defeating the purpose of having the Facebook contact in the first place.

column11: I am unable to open a POP3 connection with the Droid for my mail server. The incoming server is Q"Email.truvista.netQ"E and the outgoing is Q"Esmtp.truvista.netQ"E and must authenticate. I am running 2.0.1 on the Motorola Droid. This problem was with version 2.0 as well. It will let me get half-way through the set-up; i.e. it allows the incoming server to authenticate but it WILL not authenticate the outgoing server when trying all of the server security options. NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

column19: When calls come into the Motorola Droid running Android 2.0 the caller id picture quality is extremely poor very pixelated and neigh unrecognizable regardless of the quality of the original image. The image quality of the caller id pictures should be a lot higher and the images should be larger.

column5: Music continues to play while receiving phone call resulting in missed calls
column6: Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Set phone to vibrate mode 2. Start playing music 3. Place phone on padded surface 4. Receive a call What happened: Music continued to play while the phone call is being received. My opinion of the correct behavior: I think that Android should pause music while a phone call is being received to correctly indicate to the user that they *are* receiving a call. I have often been on a bus with my phone next to me on the seat while listening to music and I have missed many calls because I could not feel the phone vibrating. If the user ignores the call (presses ignore or uses ignore slider) the music should resume playing. Once the phone call is over if the same audio channel (headphones speaker) is being used the music should resume playing. If the audio channel has changed (i.e. headphones to speaker) the music should remain paused to prevent accidentally playing music (i.e. in a waiting room). Motorola Droid 2.0.1

column12: I am using a Motorola Droid. Firmware Version 2.0.1; Baseband Version C_01.3E.01P; Kernel Version 2.6.29-omap1-g0dd7e0b android-build@apa26 #511; Build Number ESD56 - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Create a new contact in your Gmail or Microsoft Exchange account 2. Enter 2 phone numbers for this contact such that the main phone number is the same but the extension is different. e.g. Put 1234567890;1111 for home phone number and 1234567890;2222 for mobile phone number. 3. Now sync this accountQ'Es contact (Gmail or Exchange) with the Motorola Droid. - What happened. Motorola Droid Contacts list displays only one number (generally the mobile one) under this contact. It should recognize that the extensions are different and should display both numbers. Or not intelligently parse the numbers at all to separate phone numbers and extensions and just sync whatever I have entered. Parsing could be done when the number is dialed. - What you think the correct behavior should be. The phone should display all numbers that I have entered for a contact even if they are duplicate (or even bogus for that matter). Just sync and display what I have entered and let the dialer application worry about if it is a valid number or not. Note: It may very well be only be a display problem. May be the numbers are synced properly but some checks are in place while displaying contacts where it does not display the same phone number twice even if it has a different extension.

column10: Me and other users canQ'Et mount the DROID to the PC. For verification please refer to: (https://supportforums.motorola.com/thread/16342? start=180Q&Etstart=0) Prob. description: - I methodically followed the DroidQ'Es UM ?pp. 32-34 to mount the Droid to my PC HP Win7-64bit. Plug OEM USB cord to the Droid / Pull down the Notification screen on Droid / select Q'EUSB connectedQ'E / select Q'EMountQ'E - But the phone does not mount. The DroidQ'Es behavior (always): go thru a series of messages: ?USB turn off? / ?preparing SD Card? The PCQ'Es behavior: 1- There are instances when for one second you can see a flicker in the PC where the drive shows up and ask if you want to open the drive and then immediately disappears from the screen followed up by a window stating: Q"EPlease insert a disk into Removable Disk (F:)Q"E 2- Twice when I opened Windows Explorer I was able to see the drive but I couldnQ'Et get access to the droid SD card. I clicked on Properties and the device/driver were working properly (no yellow exclamation marks). Steps taken to mount the droid / or ensure that SD card and Droid is reading the card. 1- I took out the DroidQ'Es micro SD card and connected the card to a micro SD adapter and plugged it directly to the PC. I was able to transfer files to the SD and the Droid read all the files I transfer (music pdf doc etc. In other words the SD card and the Droid are working. 2- I tried plugging the SD card to different USB ( though all of my USB are working) to no avail. 3- In one of the forums an expert suggested that we should go under settings/development/debugging to make sure that debugging was clear and not checked marked (green). A user did the opposite and the droid connected (on one instance). Once (and only one time) I was able to see/transfer files on the SD card from my PC directly to the droid by putting a check mark (green) to the debugging feature. That one time the droid and could transfer files thru the USB cord and sync playlists/ music through windows media player. IQ'Eve tried to connect the droid again using the debugging feature but it has not worked. Now IQ'Em back to square one. I canQ'Et mount my droid to my PC. 5- Since debugging didnQ'Et work any more I connected MY droid to an XP laptop on my job and the droid mounted lovely in less than a second. But due to companyQ'Es policies I canQ'Et transfer files to any device. 6- While visiting a friend I was able to mount MY droid to my friendQ'Es laptop (vista 32-bit) and droid mounted to the PC in less than a second. But this is not my PC. - We Q'EusersQ'E have tried: mounting the droid fully charged/using different USBs/different computers/different OS/etc/etc. TO NO AVAIL. [If you read the posts in the above link you will notice that this problem is affecting users with different OS vista 32 bit vista 64 bit win 7 64 bit and there is a report of a couple of XPs and one Mac. There are many DROIDs out there mounting their droids to the PC without any problem. But there are Q"EusQ"E -the ones- having problems to mount even when we have methodically followed the manufacturerQ'Es instructions.] - Mounting the Droid to the PC is not a minor issue. The phone is supposed to mount to the PC so we can access the SD card. The phone should mount to any type of PC without any problem. This is not an isolated problem of one or two people w/a defective phone (and if it is; then the straight forward solution would be to exchange our phones for new ones and our problems are solved). The Trio Moto/Google/Verizon should look into fixing this issue with an update or exchange the defective units for a DROID that works. There are numerous posts in different forums about this issue. Droid owners from all over have been trying to resolve the problem but no one has come up with a solution. I want a phone that can mount to the PC without the hassles we are going through. My plea to Moto/Google/Verizon is: Q"Eplease help! resolve this issue!Q"E. Phone info Model Number: Droid Firmware version: 2.0 Baseband version: C_01.3B.01P Kernel version: 2.6.29-omap1-g04df51f android-build@apa26 #477 Build number: ESD20 Suggestions are more than welcome! Please let me know if you need further info about this issue. Thanks.

column16: I experience this issue in both Android 2.0 and 2.0.1 on the Motorola Droid. To see this problem go to a room that has a bright area and a low-light area and start recording video. Everything looks OK while youQ'Ere recording the bright area but as you pan to the low-light area the camera will actually make the picture *dimmer* causing the video to get darker until it is practically black. This is perhaps best illustrated with these 2 videos: buggy Droid video recording: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Eeh295QsDLM expected behavior (Eris video): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pCyWbFvMR1Y as you can see in the Eris video the dim area is brightened so that it is actually visible. When the camera pans to the bright area the screen dims so itQ'Es not saturated and you can again see detail. Then as the camera pans back to the dim area the camera brightens again. This is how pretty much every video recorder IQ'Eve used recently works. The Droid does exactly the opposite: the camera brightens as it is panned towards the light and dims as it pans to the low light area! I have been able to Q"EtrickQ"E the Droid into making dim areas visible by quickly panning from a bright area to a low light one. In that case the low light area is brightened and visible for a couple seconds before the Droid erroneously dims to camera making the video go black. This proves this is a software not hardware issue.

column15: DEVICE: Motorola Droid Android Firmware Ver: 2.0 Build number: ESD20 I have half a dozen contacts with defined custom ringtones. However for one contact that has a defined custom ringtone [SteppinQ'E Out] when he calls it uses the phoneQ'Es default ringtone -- which I had set up as [Beat Plucker]. I should also note that I had another contact with a custom ringtone that I had inadvertently actually SET to the same ringtone as my default ringtone [Beat Plucker] -- that one obviously works fine. I was able to fix the problem by going to the contact with the issue changing his ring tone to a third ringtone and then back to the original ringtone I had set for him [SteppinQ'E Out]. I am not certain what initially caused the issue or if it applies to any other contacts.

column16: When a phone number is in multiple contacts (family home phone) and you dial that number from a contact the contact you dialed from should show up. This is not the case. I do not know how it chooses what contact shows but it is consistent as to which wrong contact shows up. John: 515-555-1212 Mike: 515-555-1212 Nick: 515-555-1212 Pick Mike to dial from and Nick will show up when dialing. Pick John and Nick will show up. Delete number from Nick and dial from Mike and John may show up as the Q'EdefaultQ'E owner of that number. I can not figure out how it chooses. I am running on Android 2.0 on a Motorola Droid.

column10: NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem. Model: Motorola Droid I turned the volume of my phone all the way up as high as it could go and after doing so all sounds (including ringtone) came through the ear piece and not the speaker. Turning the volume all the way up should increase the volume in the main speaker not in the ear piece.

Created POP3 Q"EcorporateQ"E email account. Incoming and Outgoing settings tested and functional. Delete from server set to Q"Enever.Q"E Can only see emails that have hit my inbox within the current hour. Unopened messages received more than 1 hour ago will not pull to handheld (Motorola Verizon Droid). Messages within the hour only show for 1 hour. Refresh after 1 hour will remove message from handheld - not server. Require setting to remove 1 hour limit.

column11: Recurring Appointments in the Corporate Calendar on my Motorola Droid do not have the ability to set an End Date. This results in the appointment going on forever. This wouldnQ'Et be too bad if I could delete the first Q"Enon-appointmentQ"E and all the rest after it. However the Corporate Calendar only has the ability to delete a single appointment or all appointments. In the Calendar (Google version) it allows me to delete the selected appointment and all those after it. It also allows me to delete all appointments. Neither has all choices. The following should be in both calendars: *Ability to set an End Date for recurring appointments. *Delete a single appointment in a Recurring Appointment. *Delete the active and all future appointments in a Recurring Appointment. *Delete the entire Recurring Appointment.

column7: Model: Motorola Cliq MB200 System version: Blur_Version.1.3.18.MB200.T-Mobile.en.US Hardware version: SJUG5469AA Firmware version: 1.5 Kernel version: 2.6.27 build01@il93lnxebld13 #1 Build number: R6380CP1_035.14 I have synchronized my phone with a contact database. Many of the phone numbers in the database are in the following format: 800-555-1212 ext. 405 800-555-1212 x12 The Blackberry and Windows Mobile donQ'Et have any trouble interpreting these phone numbers. However on the Cliq running Android 1.5 the phone is seemingly unable to call the number. Incidentally the problem I would have on the Blackberry is that the phone would pause a few seconds after dialing the phone number then dial the digits of the extension--even if a human being had answered the phone instead of an automated attendant. So I would add to this defect report a request for a feature enhancement. It would be nice if Google could somehow address this issue possibly by prompting the user to dial the extension instead of automatically dialing it.

Seems to only happen with emails with a lot of image content. IQ'Eve seen it maybe 4-5 times. Start to view an email Click Show Pictures Change your mind click Delete before all pics shown Header/subject etc. now matches the NEXT email in the inbox but the content from the deleted email is in the main body. column8: When using Wifi there are times when I move out of range of the AP where the signal is to weak to reliably use but still detectable. In this scenario the device will not release connection in favor of 3G network. This happens in North-Jersey frequently where Optimum Wifi is available to Optimum.net customers. If I am in an area with OptimumWifi coverage the device will associate with it but as I move out or move to an area where the coverage is weak it does not release back to 3G but it also is unable to send/receive any Internet traffic over the Wifi network. A similar issue is experienced in my yard where I may be attached to my home Wifi but as I move away from the house and the signal weakens the device will not release in favor of 3G but I am also unable to send/receive Internet traffic over the wireless network. Typically when this occurs the Wifi indicator is at 1 bar. It seems that the switching needs to be a little more aggresive and/or configurable by the end-user. Running Motorola Droid Firmware 2.1-update1 Build ESE81 Baseband C_01.3E.03P

column11: I just got the new 2.3 update on my Droid X and I was SO disappointed to see that NOBODY has fixed the Swype! When I first got my phone they Swype keyboard buttons were BLACK and LARGE the MAIN reason I GOT this phone in the first place. When 2.2 came along they ruined the Swype appt completely. There is no way to configure it back to the OLD version. I can BARELY see the grey keyboard and the buttons are super small even in keyboard layout. I tried writing at www.SwypeInc.com speaking directly to an Advance Tech at Motorola and there is no way to change my phone back. Swype HAD on their website that they keyboard was configurable but AFTER I wrote to them they took it down. Obviously they gave us here at Verizon the cheapy version of Swype because you canQ'Et configure the color or button size on ours. I want my OLD Swype back and IQ'Em not the only one who is complaining. I have to wear bifocals just to see my phone now. Very upsetting especially since my eyes arenQ'Et that bad! IQ'Eve downloaded and paid for three other app keyboards and they are just as bad. SlideIt is Q"EokayQ"E but itQ'Es quirky and only really knows a lot of UK words since itQ'Es a UK based app. ItQ'Es like NOBODY is listening to what we NEED or WANT on our phone and concentrating on Q"EdeveloperQ'EsQ"E junk. Come on someone there PLEASE help! Oh and the unlock button is horrible! Just HORRIBLE! The first version of DroidQ'Es had an Q"EarcQ"E slide so you could open it one-handed with your thumb. Now you have to HOLD the phone in ONE hand and slide it unlocked with your other hand. VERY bad design. I hope you change that back too or at LEAST have the ability to CHOOSE which kind of lock you want to use. And no I donQ'Et want the Q"Enumber choosingQ"E kind thatQ'Es horrible and will lock up if you donQ'Et key it correctly and if I hand my phone to my husband he wonQ'Et know what to do with it! Please change those SIMPLE things. Thank you.

column9: Device: Motorola Milestone Firmware: 2.1-update1 Carrier: Telus (Canada) Steps to reproduce: - Put phone in Media dock. - If there IS ambient light the black-lighting on the menu buttons turns OFF. - If there ISNQ'ET ambient light the black-lighting on the menu buttons turns ON. What happened: - I believe this issue is caused by the 2.1 update. I donQ'Et remember it happening with 2.0.1. - The phone senses the light level in the room and automatically turns on the back-lighting. The only problem is that when the phone is in the dock IQ'Em trying to sleep! Correct behavior should be: - Back-lighting should turn off while in dock. OR - When screen brightness is over 3/4 on the adjustment bar the back- lighting comes on. - When the screen brightness is below 3/4 on the adjustment bar the back- lighting goes off. OR - Add another button on the screen that allows you to turn the back- lighting on and off as you want. P.S. I have included images for those who might be confused about which back-lit menu buttons IQ'Em talking about. I have covered the sensor so that the phone thinks itQ'Es in a dark room. Also I followed the posting guidelines. I wish more people would follow them! haha

I purchased the Motorola Droid multimedia dock for two reasons: 1. To make the Droid an eye-pleasing easy-to-read clock visible from across the room. 2. To easily attach the phone to a charger. Froyo (Android 2.2) has rendered the first reason obsolete due to a screen saver that is not user configurable. With Froyo after approximately 2 minutes of resting in the dock the standard dock interface is replaced by a screen saver featuring a small and disappointingly simple-looking green clock. Disregarding the value (?) of a screen saver on a device connected to AC power with an LCD screen the screen saver greatly diminishes the appeal and functionality of the multimedia dock. The original Droid dock user interface on Android 2.1 and earlier was pleasing to the eye and featured a large legible clock. In fact they still show it on their product page: http://www.motorola.com/consumers/US-EN/DROID-Multimedia-Station-US-EN.do?vgnextoid=e17133289d704210VgnVCM1000008406b00aRCRD# In addition to the screen saver Android 2.2 simplified the dock user interface and reduced the size of the clock slightly. That would be tolerable--however disappointing in its own right--if the screen saver could be disabled. To be clear I am not talking about screen-dimming effects. I am talking about the green clock screen saver. Please allow me to turn it off and restore the utility of the large and legible dock clock. Thanks!

column8: There is a problem in the phone orientation when in the car dock. When making or receiving a call the phone stays in portrait mode which is side ways when in the car dock. Also on the Motorola Droid if the slide keyboard is open the phone does switch to landscape mode (as it should whenever the device is turned but it doesnQ'Et) but there is no way to dial. The keypad is gone on the screen. These 2 issues are a big hassle and in my opinion a bug. Now when I have the phone in the car dock and need to make or receive a call. I have to spend more time to figure out where all the button are and thus more risk of a car accident. What is the purpose of a speakerphone and hands free if everything is sideways.

column6: Steps to reproduce: Unsure issue is intermittent but if I had to guess ... 1) Have a ton of messages (to the point where the messaging application takes 5~ seconds to just come up) 2) Send a message to someone this message will potentially be sent twice (even though you only wanted it sent once). Correct behavior should be only sending the message once. My current device is a Motorola Droid 2.0.1.

column8: the LED notification light on the Motorola Droid has the ability to turn at least both Green and Blue. it would be a great feature to allow users to set the color of the light depending on what type of notifications are pending (for example green for missed email blue for missed calls). additionally i feel that the frequency of blinks is too slow. (about 1 blink per two seconds) itQ'Es just a hair to slow to be able to safely glance down at the phone while driving or to walk by the phone if its sitting on your desk. i think the frequency of the blink should be doubled and perhaps the length of time the light is on can be halved so that there is no additional battery usage. Motorola Droid 2.0.1

Using a stock 2.1 Droid X I could use my wired Motorola headset (S205/SYN1302A) to initiate the voice command menu. For example I could press the button on the wired headset and start a phone call (e.g. by saying Q"ECall John Smith WorkQ"E). Following the 2.2 update however pressing the button on the wired headset no longer initiates the voice command menu; instead it starts the music player. Pressing the button again stops the music player. However no amount of pressing or holding the button initiates the voice command menu. Interestingly if I receive an incoming call  I still can press the button on the wired headset to answer it; however when the call is over the music player starts. Other individuals have reported the same problems and the problems persisted even after using replacement wired headsets and Droid Xs from Verizon/Motorola. See here for more details: - https://supportforums.motorola.com/message/250259 - http://www.droidforums.net/forum/droid-x-general-discussions/82973-2-2-update-breaks-wired-headset.html

column7: Overall IQ'Ed say Android OS is an awesome platform! I was an iPhone user and loved my iPhone but ATQ&ET just doesnQ'Et have the coverage I need so I dropped and went to Verizon. I picked up the Motorola Droid A855 and I have been very impressed. There are some features that it still lacks I think to get it on par with the user community. One that is very important to me is the Media Player app. I have a few issues with it that IQ'Ed like to point out. 1. One thing that is very annoying is that if you have a series of MP3Q'Es that are numbered letQ'Es say from 62000 to 62075 the media player doesnQ'Et sort them numerically (62001 62002 62003 62004...). Instead you get something like this...(62001 62010 62020 62032 62043 62056 62066 62002 62011 62021 62033 62044 62057...). This is very annoying particularly in this case as this is an audio book. So you canQ'Et just add the files and play them in order and I have found no easy way to SORT. 2. You need to add some sort of equalizer presets to change the audio (rock pop voice etc). 3. You need to add a volume leveling option that will try to keep the volume levels for all your music files constant rather than some tracks being super loud and some being very quiet. 4. The Shuffle feature needs better logic. It doesnQ'Et shuffle through all the tracks in a playlist and it also replays tracks even if you have Repeat turned off. IQ'Em very big on music and media so these are things I use daily. I get frustrated many times with the Droid in that area. Make the phone robust for the Q"EtechiesQ"E but also make it do the cool stuff really well too. Do that and youQ'Ell be untouchable! Right now I still have to give my #1 pick to the iPhone and that is one of the major reasons. Might seem trivial but to me itQ'Es not. NOTE: This form is only for requesting new features in Android. For all discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the feature youQ'Ere requesting in as much detail as possible. If youQ'Ere an application developer and are requesting new APIs please include sample code showing how you are proposing the API should be used.

Motorola Droid Android 2.1 - Make a call - Put phone to ear - Screen should lock due to proximity sensor Seems more like a hardware issue but the Google Voice app should have an option for a drag lock as well as a proximity lock. One would think using the screen lock button would help this but it doesnQ'Et. Even after using the screen lock button placing the phone to the ear and pulling it away unlocks the screen and part of the problem with the droid sensor is hair or to much ambient light can trigger the screen to activate even when the phone is still near the face. Short of hardware working 100% of the time every time the software should have itQ'Es own safeguards in place to allow us users to use a different lock mechanism other then the proximity sensor.

Bug when the android calendar is synchronised with an MS exchange server: - The dates for (and only for) whole day repetitive events (created like that in outlook) appear with a false date (one day ahead) on an android 2.0.1 Motorola Milestone. - I found this bug when I looked at a birthday. The date is one day ahead this is a repetitive yearly whole day event in outlook. - I have other birthdays which are displayed with the correct date but a few of them are displayed whith a wrong date (one day ahead). - I have no problem with standard events. - The bug is reproducible I erased all my entries restored my exchange calendar and synchronised again the date is still wrong. Denis Rochat

column8: The first day of week is wrong for the brazilian portuguese locale. The current (wrong) first day of week is Monday. The right first day of week is Sunday. I have stated this problem on two devices: the brazilian Motorola Milestone and an HTC Hero running a CyanogenMod based build (Android 2.2). It seems that the Calendar app gets the first day of week from the java.util.Calendar class as stated here (search for the Q"EgetFirstDayOfWeekQ"E method): http://android.git.kernel.org/?p=platform/packages/apps/Calendar.git;a=blob_plain;f=src/com/android/calendar/Utils.java;hb=HEAD

Upon reeving a call on my Motorola Droid the sliders for answer or Ignore are always come up as showing the phone is in landscape mode when it is not. This started with the 2.2 update. Even under a controlled test where I make sure the phone is vertical and call from my house phone the sliders still show up as if the phone was in landscape mode.

column7: When I try to send touch tones to a system such as google voice by calling my google voice number directly the tones sent are much too fast. Even if I set the DTMF tones to Q"ELongQ"E. The exact steps to reproduce this error are to try dialing a number like 555-123-45672555-987-6543# The phone connects to the first number fine and sends the 2 but the second number is sent too fast for the system on the other end to register the tones. This error occurs on a Motorola Droid A855 running android OS 2.1

Steps to reproduce the problem. Turn on auto-sync. What happened Google Calendar application will try to sync constantly. This can be monitored in the Settings -Q>E Applications -Q>E Running Services screen. CalendarSyncAdapterService runs continuously and the timer counts up to approximately 20 seconds and then resets. This can also be verified by going to the Settings -Q>E Accounts and Sync -Q>E my account -Q>E and then individually syncing Contacts Gmail and Calendar. Contacts and Gmail sync within 5 seconds. Calendar runs forever until I click Menu -Q>E Cancel Sync. There is then an error Q"ESync is currently experiencing problems. It will be back shortly.Q"E Because I have to disable auto-sync I now have to manually check for new email (no push service). Also the continuous running of Calendar Sync drains the battery extremely quickly. This began happening on Jan 14th around 8pm EST. I installed the WaveSecure app that day. A couple hours after installing the application my phone shut down on its own. After rebooting the phone I noticed this sync problem. This may be a coincidence but I donQ'Et think anything else changed that would have suddenly caused this sync problem. What you think the correct behavior should be. Calendar should sync within 5 seconds and the Sync service should not run continuously. Device: Motorola Droid Firmware: 2.0.1 Baseband: C_01.3E.01P Kernel: 2.6.29-omap1-g0dd7e0b android-build@apa26 #511 Build: ESD56

Motorola Droid 2.1-update1 I have absolutely no LED lights for SMS/MMS or any other app that calls for the LED to flash. With v2.0.1 everything worked well. Now...nothing. This is not another Q"Ebring back the LED for screen-onQ"E complaint. Even when screen is off whether just turned off or has been off for several minutes/hours. Any notification I get has NO LED FLASHING. I made sure all the obvious options were correct when enabling LEDs with 3rd party apps so there is no issue with those. I even went to Verizon and they flashed 2.0.1 back onto the phone and miraculously it worked again. Updated to 2.1 and nothing works for LEDs. They would not exchange phones because they said it is a software issue. They tested the hardware any everything meets specs.

column6: For certain MP3 files the MediaPlayer of Android 2.1 (tested: Nexus One and Emulator) is not calling the onPrepared() state - at least sometimes. It works without problems on Android 1.6 (tested on G1). I attached an example. I uploaded one of the affected MP3 files to: http://marcreichelt.de/misc/android/test.mp3 I will leave it there until this bug is closed. The music is from Kyle Gabler: http://kylegabler.com/WorldOfGooSoundtrack/ (just for the reference) Steps to reproduce: 1. Create an Android 1.6 test project 2. Create a media player instance 3. Set the OnPreparedListener and call mediaPlayer.start() there 4. Set the data source to the URL shown above 5. Call prepareAsync() 6. The problem: onPrepared() sometimes is not called leaving the MediaPlayer in the transient Q"EPreparingQ"E state. Try to restart the activity until you get the error. Maybe you will have to set your network speed to Q"EGPRSQ"E. I also wrote a mail to the android-developers mailing list just FYI: http://groups.google.com/group/android-developers/browse_thread/thread/4beebeff7badc47c/9240020a88ef66ae According to Mark Murphy the Motorola Droid also seems to be affected. so I guess Android 2.0 2.0.1 and 2.1 are affected.

I bought my phone (motorola cliq) and so far I donQ'Et know if it will receive an update to Froyo and therefore have a better performance (Android 1.5 performance is really poor compared to Froyo). I like Android but I feel that if Android phones are not receiving an update to recent OS versions in the next 18 months it might be better to avoid them. Google please support us and ask phone producers to update every recent (recent equals at least one year based on the fact that most phones are bought with a two year contract) phone they have produced.

column7: Opening the Gallery application selecting both image/* and video/* items and using the Q"EShareQ"E function to send the items to another application results in only the video/* items being sent. IQ'Ed include sample code but this is perfectly reproducible using the included gmail application. What to do: - Open the Gallery application - Select an image file and a video file using the checkboxes - Click Q"EShareQ"E and select the gmail client What happens: - Only the video file is attached to the message What should happen: - Both the video file and the image file should be attached to the message Selecting one or more image files OR one or more video files using the checkboxes and clicking Q"EShareQ"E correctly dispatches an ACTION_SEND or ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE intent. Selecting image file and video files together causes an intent to be dispatched only for the video files. By selecting both images and videos the user is clearly demonstrating an intention to share both image and video files. The intent dispatched should be consistent with that. Observed on a Motorola Droid running Android 2.1

column6: Please provide an on-screen widget to enable/disable the search button or key on the exterior face of the Motorola Droid. If you accidentally brush the search button it interrupts whatever function you are doing. IQ'Eve been in the middle of taking pictures making a phone call checking voicemail using speakerphone writing email using google maps navigation etc and a slight stray tap of that external search button can derail the activity. In particular the position of the external search button in the lower right corner is almost impossible to avoid when using the camera. Major annoyance. Thanks.
Email (not GMail). Deleted messages go to trash. Trash folder cannot be emptied. I have 3200+ emails there now. Motorola Droid Android 2.2

column7: I have observed a marked difference in frame rate of 2-D (Canvas) graphics following a 2.1 update on the Motorola Droid. Details of the comparison between a 2.0.1 Droid averaging 60Hz and a 2.1 Droid averaging 30Hz can be found at the URL below along with a video demonstrating the issue: http://tesujigames.blogspot.com/2010/04/2-d-graphics-slowdown-after- motorola.html IQ'Eve attached the Eclipse project for the test code. Note that even when all drawing code is removed such that the only thing happening in the SurfaceView thread is locking/unlocking the surface the frame rate still averages 30 fps. All other devices used for testing (Nexus One Ion Eris) average around 60fps.

When the built-in email client setup connects to a IMAP server that does not support any authentication methods supported by the built-in Email client (e.g. Mac OSX Server 10.6Q'Es default) it returns a Q"EUsername or password incorrectQ"E message rather than reporting that there are no supported authentication methods available. To reproduce: Attempt to add an account in the built-in Email client; choose IMAP account select SSL (Accept all certificates) hit Next. Client returns: Q'ESetup could not finish Username or password incorrectQ'E message. (* SSL may not be necessary but I do not have access to a non-SSL IMAP server to verify) To work around: Enable auth=plain as a supported authentication method. In OS X Server 10.6 Launch the server administration tool then choose Q'EMail Settings Advanced SecurityQ"E and check plain as a supported IMAP protocol. Fix: Notify user that there are no supported authentication methods available from the server. Client: Motorola Droid Android 2.0.1

column19: Using Android 2.1-update1 Motorola Milestone build SHOLS_U2_02.27.6 When a BT headset is connected with profile HSP (and not A2DP) all phone calling sounds (ringing active call audio etc.) go out through the bluetooth headset except the dialing tones when dialing the phone. When dialing the phone (before pressing Q"EsendQ"E) the dialing sounds go out through the Q"EmediaQ"E channel (that is passed only to A2DP connected headsets) while pressing the dialing buttons after pressing send is passed through to the standard HSP connected headset. The phone application should make sure to send all tones through the HSP bluetooth headset regardless if before or during a call - as it is done normally in other phones.

column7: ThereQ'Es no way in the Camera API to change the orientation to portrait Repro steps: 1) Create a view (SurfaceView). 2) Create an activity that opens the camera and renders preview frames to a SurfaceView. 3) Override onPreviewFrame of Camera.PreviewCallback to process images. What happens: Preview frames are always delivered in landscape mode. Currently IQ'Em required to force my Activity to landscape orientation using setRequestedOrientation(ActivityInfo.SCREEN_ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE). My application is designed to allow users to use the camera in a portrait orientation so setting to landscape will not work for me. What I think the correct behavior should be: The Camera class should contain a method called setOrientation which accepts Landscape or Portrait. Preview frames should then be delivered in either landscape or portrait. IQ'Eve reproduced this on Motorola Droid HTC G1 and the Nexus One.

column6: I have the Motorola Droid running 2.0.1. I then have to use the little Q"EStartQ"E tab on the bottom to access all my programs or to even use the phone. Sometimes even this tab is missing. column5: When installing my application either from the Android Market or from a direct URL the software installer (not my program) crashes when you press the Q"EopenQ"E button. However the software installed correctly and works fine when you start it from the UI. Steps to reproduce: Method 1. Installing from the Android Market. * If Frink is previously installed from the URL below uninstall it first. * Install the application Q"EFrink Programming LanguageQ"E from the market. * After installation press Q"EopenQ"E. The installer will crash with the alert dialog Q"ESorry! The application Market (process com.android.vending) has stopped unexpectedly. Please try again.Q"E and has a Q"EForce CloseQ"E button. This happens every time. * Note that the software was actually installed correctly and runs correctly when opened from the home window. Since the Market application is not available in the emulator testing in the emulator is not applicable. Hardware Platform: Motorola Droid Android 2. Method 2. Installing from a direct URL: * If Frink is previously installed from the Market uninstall it first. * Download Frink (the exact same file as in the market) by opening Browser and downloading: http://futureboy.us/temp/frink.apk * Install the application by clicking it when download completes. * Press Q"EOpenQ"E when prompted. * The installer will crash with the Alert dialog: Q"ESorry! The application Package Installer (process com.android.packageinstaller has stopped unexpectedly. Please try again.Q"E) This happens every time. * Note that the software was actually installed correctly and runs correctly when opened from the home window. On the emulator note that this process produces a green checkmark (indicating success?) with the contradictory message Q"EApplication install unsuccessfulQ"E with the Q"ELaunchQ"E button greyed out. column7: When opening http/s hosted mp4 files in Android 2.2/Froyo https as well as cookie-based sessions are not supported. SSL/TLS: Opening a mp4 file hosted via https causes a download insted of playback (and download stalls with Q"Ewaiting for dataQ"E message) https://kensystem.com/test.mp4 or via https://kensystem.com/video.html (this link will test both direct hyperlink to mp4 file as well as html5-video tag) HTTP Sessions: Opening a mp4 files hosted via http the request is externally handled by stagefright and not the browser/webkit so the request does not send the session cookies that are presently in use by the browser: https://kensystem.com/video.html This can be observered server-side (or by tcpdump utilities): no session cookies are sent; and the user-agent filed reports Q'EstagefrightQ'E not webkit. The effect is that cookie-type authenticated sessions are not supported so some secure sites may refuse access to the media file. Suggested fix for these 2 issues is to request mp4 (all media) files through webkitQ'Es own URL connection handling; this will enable (I believe) re-use of existing http/s keepalives range request-header support and cookie/session support. Droid 2.2 build FRG01B; Motorola Droid; Verizon

column18: If I play music through my car stereo using the built in Android music player over A2DP/AVRCP then either make or receive a call my stereo tries to switch to phone mode. This handoff fails then when the call is ended the music stutters terribly playing a second of music then a second of silence off and on. I have to kill the bluetooth connection and reconnect for music to play agian. I am using a Motorola Droid running 2.1-update1 Build ESE81. The Car Stereo is a Pioneer DEH-P6000UB with BTB-200 Bluetooth adapter. - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Pair device with the stereo 2. Start playing music using the built in player over A2DP 3. Either make a phone call or receive a phone call. - What happened. 1. The car stero switches to Q"Ephone modeQ"E but no phone audio is heard. 2. Switching the phone to speaker allows me to conduct the call through the Droids speakerphon. 3. End the call the stereo switches back to A2DP streaming mode and music will attempt to play again but stutter. - What you think the correct behavior should be. 1. The Music should pause and the stereo should switch phone mode so the phone conversation can be held through the car stereo hands free. 2. When the call is ended the stereo should switch back to stereo mode and the music resume without issue. This issue does not occur when playing music or other audio using third party players such as DoggCatcher or TuneWiki. When using either of those programs the phone works and the audio resumes properly.

column6: I have a Motorola Milestone and am using a leather case that closes with magnets. column6: - tested on: motorola mileston / eg emulator with settings: Android 2.0 (API 5) - start the webbroser go to gmx-mail or some other portal you have to log on then click on the password field (to give it the focus) then change the orientation (landscape to portrait or the other way around) - The Result will be a duplicate password field wich is synchronized to the actual html-element. - What id expect would be that the Q"EoverlayQ"E or Q"EcopyQ"E follows the new ratio of the screen but it doesnt. Analysis - so far: For some reason the android-webkit-browser produces a duplicate of input type:password fields when the onfocus-event is thrown. It fetches position and size of the HTML-element and renders its own reprenstation of the element. If we change the orientation of the screen the Q"EcopyQ"E of that field will persist in size and position while the actual HTML wont. We could try and trigger the orientation change and then blur the focus by JavaScript. or find a possibility to supress that behaviour of creating copies generally. It seems there is no way I could find to influence the android rendered passwordfield because it is not html within the browser but an overlay coming from the android enviroment itself. As far as Im concerned theres no appropriate way to achieve the desired effect by reasonable efforts. Please see the attached screenshot. Its the GMX-mail Login Form wich is presenting the same behaviour if you confront it with the test-procedure as described. Greez Phil

column6: When the phone is at the rotary lock screen there is no validation on the path that the finger took to unlock it. This happens to me several times a day and has been the source of many embarrassing situations in meetings/class and movies. - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1) Lock the phone so that the rotary lock screen is visible. 2) Tap the side of the screen beside the green lock icon then quickly tap the side of the screen beside the volume icon. 3) The phone should now unlock and leave you in the homescreen. - What happened. Many times my phone has been toggled off or on to silent mode causing me to interrupt meetings or miss calls. This has also caused many calls to be made messages to be sent and websites to be visited in error and is very common in changing my music playing settings (i.e skippings songs while I am using the music app)! - What you think the correct behavior should be. The swipe mechanism should require some intermediate touches to reduce the chance of this happening in the pocket or even require a complete path to be traced from one side of the screen to the other. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have making sure that it runs Android 2.0. column7: IQ'Ell be listening to music in headphones played from the standard music player. IQ'Ell use Astro File Manager to delete a Word document from /sdcard/documents. This will cause the music player to stop. AstroQ'Es developer gave me this explanation: To give you the details Android uses what they call a Media Server. This server takes care of managing all of the media files on the phone (images videos music etc.) ItQ'Es the serverQ'Es job to scan the SD card and note any media file that have been added removed etc. and the appropriate applications like the music player get their information from the media server. Whenever ASTRO does a file operation it notifies the media server that a file or directory has changed so the media server can make sure it is up to date with any changes to media files. It is actually the media server / player that is stopping the music player and re-scanning the SD card (which I donQ'Et think is really necessary since we tell it which file changed but they donQ'Et bother to be smart about it). I think the correct behavior should be that the media player should continue playing as long as the deleted file is not the one currently being played. IQ'Em using a Motorola Droid with Android 2.0.1.

column6: First sorry my english. My device is a Motorola Milestone (A853) Firmware: 2.1-update1 Build SHOLS_U2_03.11.0 (Telus) I was experienced frequent runtime resets ( i mean system restart from Android logo kernel does not crash ) every 2-3 days aprox  so i decided to debug my system using logcat Q>E /sdcard/logcat.txt Q&E to get a constant log. So i waited for a crash and ran adb bugreport as usual but it does not shows nothing to me. On the other hand digging logcat.txt reveals to me system_server was running out of file descriptors so it restarts. Then i tried to monitor system_server open files with the lsof utility (ported to ARM) doing lsof -w | grep ^system_server | wc -l And i saw the number of open files increase constantly. Digging more with lsof i saw system_server opens the file /data/system/pc.key every time i wake up (SCREEN_ON) the device and does not close it. Since the limit is 1024  when reached it crash. I think this can be a possible bug. I was able to reproduce it just turnning off and on the display many times to increase the open file descriptor count in AndroidRuntime. The fix i found was deleting pc.key since i dont use password unlock security. Im including bugreport and logcat captured after crash. Regards.-

column6: ********************************* ** THIS IS FIXED IN FROYO 2.2. ** ********************************* I started to report this against Froyo 2.2 but before submitting it I used a tool that rebuilds the genre Q"EdatabaseQ"E on my Droid. Sure enough after running the tool everything was correct. I am still submitting this to the web site because I couldnQ'Et find this problem described anywhere. Hopefully it will help those running older versions of Android. ---------------------------------------------------------- On my Motorola Droid IQ'Eve been using Meridian as my media player. It has the feature to play music by genre. All of my songs have correct genre information except for my .m4a files. Those songs have the album title as their genre instead of the genre information displayed in iTunes or Mp3tag. I originally thought this was a problem with Meridian but I recently installed the 3 (Cubed) media player. It has exactly the same problem. Since the 3 (Cubed) media player is open source I went browsing through the source to see where the genre information comes from. Not being an Android developer myself it appears that the genre information comes from MediaStore.Audio. That would explain why both players have the same incorrect information. Here is the body of the e-mail I sent to the Meridian developer that is my best guess as to why the genre information is incorrect for .m4a files. Thanks MikeP ----------------------------------------------------- I have done some investigation about my problems with Genre handling in Meridian and it appears that Meridian does not handle the Q"EgnreQ"E tag in MP4 files the same way as most other apps in the world. This may be because iTunes does not follow the Q"EofficialQ"E standard and everyone has had to adapt their handling of the Q"EgnreQ"E tag to the way iTunes does it. For example Mp3tag handles GenreQ'Es the same way as iTunes does for .m4a files. (According to the Atomic Parsley web site the header of an MP4 file has some indicator of what Q"Emajor file brandQ"E the file conforms to. iTunes files have M4A in the header.) If a song in iTunes has a Genre from the ID3v1 pre-defined list see http://www.id3.org/id3v2.3.0#head-129376727ebe5309c1de1888987d070288d7c7e7 it writes a Q"EgnreQ"E tag in a binary-encoded format where the binary value is one greater than the value listed on the web site. For example the Genre Q"ERockQ"E is written as a binary value of 18. (If the genre is outside that list then iTunes uses the Q"EgenQ"E tag which contains the genre name in text.) MeridianQ'Es Genre handling expects that the Q"EgnreQ"E tag is followed by text and ends up using the title of the album as the Genre for the song for .m4a files ... because the album tag follows the Genre tag in most .m4a files in iTunes. Two informative discussions on this topic can be found at: http://www.hydrogenaudio.org/forums/lofiversion/index.php/t77947.html and http://forums.mp3tag.de/index.php?showtopic=10864Q&Est=0Q&Ep=43095Q&E#entry43095 I found these discussion threads by googling Q"Egnre vs gen genre tagsQ"E. Hope this is information you may find useful MikeP

The problem: Double-clicking (double-tapping) to block text is not possible in Landscape mode. In Portrait mode simply double clicking a word highlights it and enables further text blocking. To my knowledge it is a problem with Android on the Motorola Droid X. A friends Motorola Droid did not have this problem. Steps to Reproduce: Problem seems to be app independent and present in all text editing screens. Double-tapping a word to select it stops working in Landscape mode and starts working again when phone is returned to Portrait mode. The correct behavior: Users should not have reduced editing capability in Landscape mode. Especially since we do not have a hardware keyboard to use. Work-around: Long clicking and choosing Q"ESelect TextQ"E still works. (Long clicking is slow and cumbersome when compared to double-tapping.)

The Gmail app is incorrectly recognizin parts of E-Mails as quoted text due to similarity to text from previous E-Mails already in the conversation. This happens without fail on forum/discussion group topic reply notification E-Mails because in these the message body is nearly always the same with the exception of the link to the new forum post and the body of the new forum post which is sometimes included in the E-Mail. The Gmail app seems to think that most of the message has been quoted due to similarities with previous messages in the conversation and hides the parts it thinks are quoted. The problem is that itQ'Es hiding parts of the message that are actually very relevant and needed (such as the links contained in the E-Mail!). This is what the mangled E-mails look like: http://i302.photobucket.com/albums/nn108/bemymonkey/quoted.png This is what the E-Mails SHOULD look like: http://i302.photobucket.com/albums/nn108/bemymonkey/original.png As you can see the mangled version is useless as one canQ'Et click on the links. Unfortunately there doesnQ'Et seem to be a working alternative. The mobile web version of Gmail has issues of its own (folder list page often needs to be manually refreshed in order to show new messages even though the messages have shown up in the desktop version minutes ago) and the desktop version isnQ'Et touchscreen-optimized (although it works as a last resort). This seems to be an issue on all Android builds so far but for the sake of completeness: Running Android 2.1 with MotorolaQ'Es latest bugfix update (.36) on a Motorola Milestone.

Device: Motorola Milestone 2.0 Problem: MP3 playback does not recognise the TPOS frame as defined in ID3 v2.3. TPOS The Q'EPart of a setQ'E frame is a numeric string that describes which part of a set the audio came from. This frame is used if the source described in the Q"ETALBQ"E frame is divided into several mediums e.g. a double CD. The value may be extended with a Q"E/Q"E character and a numeric string containing the total number of parts in the set. E.g. Q"E1/2Q"E. Expected behaviour: MP3 playback is in the order TALB TPOS TRCK or to put it in English: Album disk track. Actual behaviour: MP3 playback is ordered by TALB TRCK or to put it in English: Album track. Example: I have the 13 disk BBC Radio version of The Lord of the Rings. The album title (TALB) for all tracks is The Lord of the Rings. Each disk is tagged to indicate itQ'Es position in the album (TPOS) e.g. 1/13. Each track (TRCK) is numbered according to itQ'Es position on the disk. This means there are 13 track 1s 13 track 2s etc. Correct behaviour is to play all the tracks of disk 1 in order before starting to play disk 2 and so on until the end of track 5 on disk 13.

column19: Carrier: Verizon Wireless Country / Language: United States / English OS / Browser / build number (if applicable): The version of Android that was released with the Motorola Droid X I cannot seem to be able to do the following on my phone and same is becoming increasingly frustrating. If there is no way to set these features in the current version of the Android software for my phone the software should be modified going forward to provide such capability by either making same a functionality standard or to give the user the option to change the settings to be in line with same: 1. When clicking the telephone or dialer app the telephone keypad is not always the first item that is automatically displayed. Instead it seems as though the last menu item (from amongst the four tabs across the top - dialer / recent calls / contact / etc.) selected is brought up as the app Q'Eis always running in the backgroundQ'E. This is very very annoying and no intuitive as when I want to make a phone call itQ'Es not that same can always be done from recent calls or contacts etc. but the actual dialer / telephone keypad should always be the (tab) first menu displayed as that is what is expected when someone goes to place a call. 2. When speakerphone is selected it does not remain selected from call to call and has to constantly be reselected if I want to use the telephone on speakerphone during each call I make. On most every single other phone that I have ever had you would be able to select speakerphone and it would stay on until you either turned it off or you powered down and turned the phone back on. With the Droid X if you are on a call and terminate the call and want to make another call you have to again select speakerphone instead of the phone staying in Q'Espeakerphone modeQ'E. 3. I use call forwarding not for my cell phone number but for two numbers that I have at my store - so that when I leave the store - if someone were to call on those two numbers - the calls would be sent to my cell phone. On all other phones that IQ'Eve had IQ'Eve had one contact set (named: Q"ECall ForwardingQ"E) with two numbers (Q"EMobile 1Q"E and Q"EMobile 2Q"E) which I would have set as speed dials and which included pauses and waits in the preset number (i.e.: the number for Verizon Call Forwarding WAIT the number of the store line I wanted to have called forwarded on PAUSE a password). The proceeding sequence would allow me to very easily toggle call forwarding on and off on the given two store lines. HOWEVER on the Droid X I cannot set these two preset contacts to have the same name Q"ECall ForwardingQ"E and to be differentiated by Q"EMobile 1Q"E and Q"EMobile 2Q"E as the phone makes it as if I have already stored the same number (The number for Verizon Call Forwarding) and name (Q"ECall ForwardingQ"E) as the ten digit number for Verizon Call Forwarding is the same. So in a way the phone is stupid to think that I am trying to program the same number twice because it only looks to the first ten digits even though what I am doing is actually different as the string of numbers includes two different numbers for the two store lines I am trying to work with. 4. The forgoing concern is indirectly related to both numbers 2 and 3 above: In the past whenever I wanted to check voicemails or call forward my numbers etc. itQ'Es always most comfortable to do same while speakerphone is on - not needing to put the phone up to your ear. However because I have streamlined the proceed to forward my call with the inclusion of WAITS and PAUSES I run into difficulty when I attempt to call forward and the screen asking me to send the additional tones on a WAIT pops up because it black everything in the background screen out and I cannot choose speaker phone. Instead I have to uncomfortably put the phone to my ear wait for it to prompt for the additional number I need to enter and then give my phone the instruction to send the additional tones as the screen requesting whether or not I should send the additional tones pops up IMMEDIATELY upon my placing the call. Note: I cannot enter a WAIT for the first set of tones because the tones would be sent too quickly and the prompt for the tones on the telephone line does not come up as quick. In all at the least I would like for these requests to be added as additional settings that users can toggle between whereby those who prefer the current funcationality can keep their phones the same and those who find the above more intuitive can modify same. Last w/r/t #4 IQ'Ell try to be more concise: When a WAIT is entered in the number of a stored contact and you go to dial the contact immediately a screen pops up asking you whether or not you want to send the additional tones. Becuase speakerphone does not remain engaged from call to call itQ'Es annoying to have to put the phone up to your ear to wait to hear when you are prompted for the additional tones. Meaning you do not have any time to engage speakerphone before the screen pops up asking you whether or not you want to send the additional tones.

It seems that every time I travel to a new timezone my email client (for an exchange account) crashes with the error: The application Email (process com.android.email) has stopped unexpectedly. I can not confirm that it is actually the timezone change but the pattern has been consistent so it would be the first place I would suggest to look. Here are the steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Have a working Exchange email account. 2. Put phone into airplane mode. 3. Move phone into an area with a different timezone. 4. Take phone out of airplane mode (The phone will then get the new time from the wireless signal). 5. Try to read an email from your exchange account. Currently the only way to read any emails from the exchange account is to completely clear the account by doing the following. 1. Clear the current settings by going to: Settings Q>E Applications Q>E Manage Applications Q>E Email Q>E Clear Data 2. Completely re-configure the exchange account The phone that I am having the issues on is: Motorola Droid 2.0.1 on Verizon Wireless Thank You!

column11: Observed on Android 2.0 on Motorola Droid. Android has 2 volume controls Media and Ringer (which appears to effect notifications as well.) This is confusing and not useful. The 2 should be merged; there should only be volume control with no distinction between the two. On numerous occasions I have been listening to music at a low volume on headphones and have been interrupted with an uncomfortably loud. Notification or ring tone. Other times I have been listening to music and have wanted to quickly adjust the volume with the volume rocker but have instead had to unlock the screen and open the music application before I could. This is not useful. Please observe how the iPhone handles it and do it that way. I switched from iPhone to Android and that is one of the few situations where the iPhone worked much better. I also advise making the volume rocker physical button turn the volume up and down when music is playing even if the screen is locked.

column6: There is no option to undelete e-mail from the android exchange mail client. I can see and read items in the trash but cannot transfer them to the inbox. Motorola droid running cyanogen 6.

Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. I am using a Motorola Droid with Android 2.0.1 browser v6. This bug manifests itself frequently on a forum I use regularly that employs a 468x60 google ads banner rotation at the top of the site. One particular amazon ad which uses an imagemap to specify a region of a banner that links to a privacy policy page also overspecifies the remainder of the imagemap which links to the actual ad. The offending are tag is of the form: Q<EAREA COORDS=Q"E001000010000Q"E [....] /Q>E where obviously 001000010000 is way beyond the 468x60 banner. While browsing the page any click even below the actual banner (but not to the left of it obviously) is passed to the banner imagemap and not to elements or links directly below where the click is physically registered. In effect the imagemap exceeds the boundaries of the iframe and pushes into the page region covering all the content. I expect (at least) that the imagemap be logically constrained to the boundaries of the iframe if not to the boundaries of the element specified in the Q<EimgQ>E tagQ'Es width/height. I also expect elements with z-indexes above the banner would receive the click event but they do not. Ultimately it renders the page mostly unusable because there is no way to navigate the links embedded in the page I have attached the source from the banner ad as well as the tags from the page that displays the banner ad. Not sure if they will be helpful.

column7: I have a Motorola Droid with version 2.0.1. The home screen should autorotate to landscape mode whether or not the keyboard is out. By not doing so a user working in landscape mode and needing to go to/through the home screen is forced to either - work sideways - manually rotate to portrait mode make their selection and manually rotate back to landscape mode. Either choice is not intuitive and makes for a just plain bad user interface experience.

column6: IQ'Em trying to display the camera preview aspect ratio correct full screen. Play video back on phone or other device. Notice audio gets ahead of video near the end of the video. The video and the audio should not get out of sync.

This is really a two part problem but one part at least has a workaround. Part one is that when the Motorola droid is put in the multimedia dock the clock app does not dim the screen very much this is personal preference but it would be nice if it could be adjusted separately below the default minimum brightness. This part of the problem however can be solved with the use of other clock apps. Part two and more importantly however is that the soft key backlight does not dim with the screen when the device is placed in the multimedia dock. When using either the stock clock app or one of the many replacements the soft key backlight is the brightest portion of the screen and does not respond to any kind of brightness control settings. The soft key backlight should either dim in relation to the chosen screen brightness have a seperate brightness control or toggle or be automatically dimmed by the clock app activated by the multimedia dock.

column6: Android code version you are running: 2.1-update1 Your development environment: Motorola Droid using 3G Describe the problem: 2.1 enhanced the Gallery app by automatically linking up your pictures that you have in Picasa. The issue that I am seeing is that any picture that is 1024x768 takes minutes to load. The icon is also indicating that the photo is still trying to load. I have not tried photos smaller then this size to see how they load. I have tried larger photos (4000x3000) and they all load in about 3-5 seconds. Steps to reproduce: 1. Add or use a photo in Picasa that is 1024x768. 2. Sync that account up to your phone. 3. Open the Gallery App and select the folder-Q>Epicture Expected results: Photo should load within a reasonable amount of time. It should load faster then much larger photos. Observed results: Photo takes anywhere from 2 minutes to 10+ minutes to load. Much larger photos take 3-5 seconds. Additional information: Once they are loaded going back to them is quick. However IQ'Em assuming that we are caching it somewhere and that explains the quickness.

When lying flat my Motorola Droid (2.1) will rotate to landscape after an unlock. Steps: 1.) Lie phone on a flat level surface. 2.) Unlock the screen 3.) Open an application that supports landscape mode 4.) Application will be in landscape mode regardless of the lying flat and that it was in portrait when locked. I feel this is a firmware issue with the accelerometer. I think the accelerometer interprets a flat surface to mean that the orientation should be landscape. This seems counter-intuitive.

My Motorola Droid gets stuck in headphone jack mode often when unplugging my headphone cord from the jack. Basically the internal speakers on the phone stop working after unplugging the headphone jack cord (such as FM Tuner earbugs etc.. anything you would use the jack for to output audio/music). to temporarily correct the problem you have to plug and unplug something in the headphone jack until the phone speakers start to work again or by restarting the phone. Also it appears that the headphone jack sound Q"EcracklesQ"E if the headphone jack (or a cord plugged into it) is wiggled or moved. Some users have reported that headphone jacks with 3 ring adapters (one used for a mic while traditional headphone adapters only have 2 rings) do not have the issue with no sound on the phone upon unplugging the jack. A forum thread with other users experiencing the same problem: http://www.droidforums.net/forum/tech-issues-bug-reports-suggestions/9648-official-thread-no-sound-after-headphone-use.html Please verify if this is a software issue or a hardware issue. It makes headphone playback nearly unbearable with the cracking sounds during headphone playback as well as loss of internal phone speaker sound upon unplugging from the headphone jack.

- Steps to reproduce the problem. While viewing a conversation in the Google Mail client receive another mail within that conversation. Leave the conversation. - What happened. The conversation appears as read from the Inbox view but the Inbox unread count counts it as unread. Notifications for following mails also use this count. The conversation is marked as unread in the Q"EAll MailQ"E view; viewing it from there fixes the inconsistency. - What you think the correct behavior should be. Mails arriving in a conversation that is being viewed should be marked as read. This is on a Motorola Milestone running 2.1 but has been the case since 2.0 and across full wipes.

- Steps to reproduce the problem. Use Android 2.0.1 on a Motorola Milestone build SHOLS_U2_01.14.0. Play some music or watch a video. Move through an area with reduced or fluctuating (3g/regular) network coverage. Wait until the network coverage either drops is regained or up or downgrades between 2g/3g/hdspa. - What happened. Everytime the network connection switches any music playing in the background will freeze/hiccup for a little until the operation completes. Using i.e. APNdroid to disable the dataconnection does not solve this issue when in flight-mode the issue does not surface. - What you think the correct behavior should be. It should be possible to use a phone as a music player as well as phone when on the move.

column11: When the name of the route a bus is traveling on changes -- for example from route 17 to route 27 even though the bus continues moving in the same direction and there is no break in service -- the Motorola map directions tell you to get off bus 17 and get on bus 27. Only after the 17 has pulled away from the stop and after you realize that there is no 27 coming do you realize that 17 and 27 are the same and that you should not have listened to google. The web application doesnQ'Et make this mistake only the android app. For example on this schedule: http://maps.google.com/maps?q=605+5TH+AVE+S++seattleQ&Eoe=utf-8Q&Erls=org.mozilla:en-US:officialQ&Eclient=firefox-aQ&Eum=1Q&Eie=UTF-8Q&Ehq=Q&Ehnear=605+5th+Ave+S+Seattle+WA+98104Q&Egl=usQ&Eei=x29KS6eKAYTYsgO0s9n1DwQ&Esa=XQ&Eoi=geocode_resultQ&Ect=titleQ&Eresnum=1Q&Eved=0CAgQ8gEwAA the web application says 17 continues as 27 and that you should stay on board. The android app on the other hand tells you to get off.

column7: Hi i am using a Motorola Milestone with 2.01 and i am developing an app where a Service periodically calls a Bluetooth discovery and after the discovery has finished i start a thread that attempts to connect to each device found. column7: About 50% of the time when I hit the home button I am brought to my home screen which is missing the app icons and widgets. The tray and notification bar are present. Navigating to other home screens is not possible during this time. After about 10 seconds the icons appear and the home screen responds normally. This bug happens when exiting an app via the home button. (I almost never exit using the back button so I canQ'Et remember if IQ'Eve experienced the bug in that way). The bug happens after exiting any variety of app but usually after being in the app for at least a minute. Apps IQ'Eve experienced this bug with include the browser gallery and Angry Birds. The bug is not affected by the wallpaper present. IQ'Eve used many different still and live wallpapers which didnQ'Et change the occurrence rate of the problem. I noticed this problem first a couple months ago while using the Helix Launcher while on 2.1 and it has continued to be a problem while on 2.2 even after the Helix Launcher was uninstalled. My device: Motorola Droid (the original) Version: Stock 2.2 (this bug was first noticed on 2.1) Build: FRG22D I tried to run adb bugreport but it outputs many more lines than fit in the cmd window history. Is there a way to output it to a file?
