Example: I search for Q"EKeith MartinQ"E. Finds it. I select his home address. Go. Tries to help me drive to Martin PA. Android 2.2 Motorola Droid.

column9: Motorola Droid - Android 2.0.1 Droid has pattern lock set. If a phone call comes in the phone rings and answer call screen appears. I answer and talk. When I finish talking I look at the phone to disconnect and the screen has gone dark as if sleeping. At that point I cannot wake the screen. Pressing the hard Q"EonQ"E button does nothing. Long press does not reboot. I tried for several minutes put it away tried again half an hour later. No luck. I eventually discovered two things that will wake it up: 1) place a new call to the phone. Phone rings (screen stays dark). Disconnect call at callerQ'Es end. Now press Q"EonQ"E button. Screen lights. 2) Plug the phone into USB or A/C. Screen lights. I have been able to reproduce this. I asked at Work and a co-worker has seen the same issue. He says it doesnQ'Et happen every time. IQ'Em 2 for 2.

column7: I have a Motorola Droid 1 and the problem may be phone-specific so I donQ'Et know. This has actually been happening since 2.1 was rolled out but I didnQ'Et notice it until about a month ago. Switching to 2.2 has not alleviated the problem. The problem in its essence is that some text boxes are not recognizing certain keys on the PHYSICAL keyboard. (The virtual keyboard works without issue.) I have only noticed the problem itself on Facebook and another site whose name escapes me right now. In nearly every text box on Facebook - login screen status update etc. - the text box refuses to acknowledge using the shift alt or arrow keys. With the shift and alt keys the text box simply ignores the previous button press and continues on adding lower case letters in place of numbers and shifted letters. The arrow keys however will actually scroll the page (same as they do when youQ'Ere not in a text box) and exit you out of the text box. After this you canQ'Et even re-click the text box to start typing again! This also happens in all browsers: the base one dolphin and Fennec. It does NOT happen in the Facebook app though. Help please!

column13: Motorola Droid Android v2.1 The most annoying issue is when I get a call in my car via bluetooth the screen turns on. When the screen is on and in my pocket it frequently goes to mute turns off bluetooth hangs up on people etc. because the screen is active and can be touched. The screen should never come on during bluetooth unless I turn it on. This bug needs to be fixed.

column17: Motorola Droid running firmware version 2.01 fails to mount SD card when connected to HP Pavilion dv6 running 64 bit version of Windows 7 Ultimate via USB cable. I have seen similar problems posted here. With my phone there seems to be a conflict between the phone and the Bluetooth USB connection on my phone. To produce problem plug phone via USB cable to computer. Select Home Q>E Menu Q>E Notifications. Select Q"EUSB Connected Select to copy files to/from your computer.Q"E Select Q"EMountQ"E form Q"EUSB ConnectedQ"E message box. Notification bar displays Q"ETurn off USB StorageQ"E then Q"EPreparing SD CardQ"E and finally Q"EUSB ConnectedQ"E. Open a Q"EComputerQ"E window on the computer. It will display the Q"ECQ"E drive a DVD drive and a removable disk drive. The later is the SD card on the phone. Open the removable disk drive and windows opens a message box asking you to Q"EPlease insert a disk into Removable DiskQ"E. So far nothing much to go on. Now Open the device manager. Under Q"ENetwork AdaptersQ"E I have 1) Bluetooth Device (Personal Area Network) 2) Bluetooth Device (RFCOMM Protocol TDI) 3) Broadcom WiFi Adaptor 4) Microsoft Virtual WiFi MiniPort Adaptor 5) Realtek Ethernet Under Disk Drives I have 1) Motorola A855 USB Device 2) WDC WD3200BEVT-60ZTC0 One of the USB Root Hubs is attached to HP Integrated Module with Bluetooth 2.0 technology. In Device Manager delete all the USB Root Hubs. Reboot. Attach phone via USB cable. Select Home Q>E Menu Q>E Notifications. Select Q"EUSB Connected Select to copy files to/from your computer.Q"E Select Q"EMountQ"E form Q"EUSB ConnectedQ"E message box. Notification bar displays Q"ETurn off USB StorageQ"E. The device manager under Q"ENetwork AdaptersQ"E does not display either Bluetooth Device (Personal Area Network) or Bluetooth Device (RFCOMM Protocol TDI). Open a Q"EComputerQ"E window on the computer. It will display the Q"ECQ"E drive a DVD drive and a removable disk drive. The later is the SD card on the phone. Open the removable disk drive. The folders and files are visible. I can successfully copy files between the two devices for a few minutes until ... The card unmounts without any action on my part. After the card unmounts 1) The notification bar on the phone says Q"EPreparing SD CardQ"E and next Q"EUSB ConnectedQ"E. 2) The Q"EComputerQ"E window on the computer displays the Q"ECQ"E drive a DVD drive and a removable disk drive. The later is the SD card on the phone. Open the removable disk drive and windows again opens a message box asking you to Q"EPlease insert a disk into Removable DiskQ"E. 3) The device manager. Under Q"ENetwork AdaptersQ"E displays 1) Bluetooth Device (Personal Area Network) 2) Bluetooth Device (RFCOMM Protocol TDI) 3) Broadcom WiFi Adaptor 4) Microsoft Virtual WiFi MiniPort Adaptor 5) Realtek Ethernet One of the USB Root Hubs is again attached to HP Integrated Module with Bluetooth 2.0 technology. It looks like the Windows reconnects the Bluetooth stuff after reboot but during the time required for reconnecting while Bluetooth is not wired-up I can access the Droid SD card. Disabling the USB Root Hub to which the HP Integrated Module with Bluetooth 2.0 technology is attached does shut down Bluetooth but the Droid SD card still will not mount. Chip Moore

column8: You cannot change the volume level of the ringer without unlocking the phone when require pattern is enabled. I donQ'Et think this should be wrapped in with the security layer. ItQ'Es something I change frequently and it does not need to be protected from unauthorized use. Device: Motorola Droid Firmware 2.0.1 Build ESD56 Reproduce: Set Q"ERequire patternQ"E in Settings-Q>ELocation Q&E security. Exit hit power button (to turn off screen) press power button again (now showing unlock grid) and attempt to use volume controls. Nothing happens. Expected: Volume controls should work without having to enter the unlock pattern. They probably should be available after you hit the power button (showing unlock grid) not when the phoneQ'Es screen is off which will prevent accidental unwanted changes to the ringer volume control.

column6: Android code version you are running: Motorola Droid version 2.0.1 Your development environment: ??? Describe the problem: I am having a problem with my email app and another co-worker is having the same problem. I use the default email application to check three email accounts. Two IMAP accounts and one exchange account. Sometimes the email application sends the wrong email. Here is an example. Bob sends me an email. I hit reply and type my message sending it off to Bob. Instead of Bob getting the reply I typed and sent it forwards him an email from another email account. This has happened countless times but I have been unable to find a way to reproduce it with certainty it seems completely random. It happens across all three email accounts and happens regularly. The email app also displays the wrong email sometimes. I got an email from a client yesterday and when I opened the email it was an ad from E-Harmony.com. I deleted the email account from my phone added it back in and the email appeared correctly. Steps to reproduce: 1. Reply to an email. 2. Receive an email.

After upgrading our Exchange 2010 server to Service pack 1 droids no longer connect at my company if they are on version 2.2 of the O.S.. which all of ours are. This behavior is consistent on our HTC droids and Motorola for sure but researching it on the web makes it seem like any droid with 2o2. O.S. has this problem. If we try to resetup our account with correct credentials/ authentication we get a Q"EFailed to create the account please try again laterQ"E. No iphones or blackberries or other email phones had any issues after this upgrade. I have heard a free trial for an app called Q"EtouchdownQ"E will allow for a workaround but I am not interested in starting a trial for a separate application for multiple people just for the purpose of getting around an issue that is clearly a Google Android issue as Echange 2010 works great with the service pack on everything but Droids running o.s. 2.2 . Is there a timeline for a fix for this from GoogleQ'Es end? I need a permanent solution to this issue or knowledge of when that is expected to happen as cant find any fix on the web for this issue but the above workaround. Please advise. -Aaron

column7: Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. Connect to an imap server thatQ'Es using chained certificates. - What happened. Notice that you canQ'Et connect. - What you think the correct behavior should be. You should connect. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) Motorola Droid (the original model) recently updated to FRG22D (although the problem started BEFORE the latest update was installed i.e under FRG01B). So hereQ'Es the real details. IQ'Em the guy responsible for ordering our certificates for web and IMAP. We buy our certificates thru Harvard from Geotrust. This year the certifcate they sent us was signed by a chained certificate not a root certificate and this was new to me. But once we figured it out we installed the certs properly on our IMAP server and Thunderbird and other mail clients were all able to connect successfully with no security warnings. BUT at that exact time my phone stopped finding new email and it says Q"ECannot safely connect to serverQ"E. So I think weQ'Ere pretty clear that this chained cert which works on all other mail clients we are using is causing a problem with Android Email. In a month when I upgrade our webservers can I look forward to the browser also failing to connect to our work webservers? This is my other critical use for these phones. THIS IS ULTRA-SUPER-MEGA-MASSIVE HIGH PRIORITY!!! I canQ'Et use my phone for email and potentially for connecting to work webservers then this phone becomes nothing more than a very very expensive cell phone. And GeoTrust is not exactly a minority player in the certificate field. Certainly it would be VERY BAD when the national news reports that Android is not compatible with Harvard University services. I look forward to seeing the fix for this. Very very soon. tom

column6: I have an A855 which appears to be gradually losing Internal Memory. The problem started under OS v2.1 and continued after the v2.2 update. I have also tried custom ROMs such as CyanogenMod 6.1.2. The problem shows up as a Low Memory warning in the taskbar. In the past the warning would not show up right away after a wipe/reset but would show up after downloading apps. Now the warning shows up immediately. Using ADB I find: # df -k df -k Filesystem 1K-blocks Used Available Use% Mounted on tmpfs 115684 0 115684 0% /dev tmpfs 115684 0 115684 0% /mnt/asec /dev/block/mtdblock4 143744 118744 25000 83% /system /dev/block/mtdblock6 268032 249896 18136 93% /data /dev/block/mtdblock5 94848 27792 67056 29% /cache /dev/block/mtdblock0 1536 1176 360 77% /config /dev/block/mmcblk0p2 468331 8238 435108 2% /sd-ext /dev/block/vold/179:1 14794120 3288 14790832 0% /mnt/sdcard /dev/block/vold/179:1 14794120 3288 14790832 0% /mnt/secure/asec The available space on /data (18136) closely matches the available space shown on the SD Card settings screen (17.71 MB). However when I analyze usage of /data in another way I get this: # du -sh /data du -sh /data 2.3M /data So somehow IQ'Eve lost about 248 megs of Internal Memory. I ran a debug report piped to a file which is attached here. I suspect that some of my flash memory is dying; there are a number of entries in the debug file about bad blocks on mtdblock6. Any suggestions on how to clean up mtdblock6 to recover (or map around) the bad blocks? ...dtw tags: internalmemorylosinglowsdcardandroiddroidmotomotorola

column6: If an event is created and saved in AndroidQ'Es Google Calendar app with any data in the event location (Q"EWhereQ"E) field that location cannot be deleted. When the event is edited if the Q"EWhereQ"E field is cleared and the event is saved it will appear to have saved without an event location. However once the app refreshes the calendar the Q"EWhereQ"E field has restored itself to whatever location was previously filled in on the initial creation of the event. If instead of trying to delete a location from the Q"EWhereQ"E field if it is simply modified to something else and then saved the change will stick. It appears that the Q"EWhereQ"E field can be modified it just cannot simply be deleted. Google calendar app should allow for complete deletion of data from this field. This has occurred consistently on the Motorola droid running 2.0 2.0.1 and 2.1.

I was experiencing the same problem described by the user here: http://www.droidforums.net/forum/tech-issues-bug-reports-suggestions/17375- moto-droid-having-issues-sd-card.html Basically seemingly out of the blue my Verizon Motorola Droid (Android 2.0.1) randomly stopped recognizing audio files on the SD card. The files would show up in Astro Manager and the audio list would populate with all of my music but when I tried playing them I would get a Q"EThis format is not recognizedQ"E error. The problem was intermittent and seemingly random. Sometimes I would reboot the phone which would sometimes resolve the problem and other times not. Other times the files would work again several hours later without me rebooting. If I remember correctly pulling the battery seemed to fix the problem every time but it would eventually return. I had this problem for about 2 weeks before seeking an answer online when I came across the above forum post. I cross checked the list of apps I had installed with the user Q"EMalitharQ'EsQ"E list of apps. I also had Q"EWhereQ"E and Q"ENo Signal AlertQ"E installed and after uninstalling both I have not had any SD card issues. IQ'Em inclined to believe that the problem was Q"ENo Signal AlertQ"E since I had Q"EWhereQ"E for quite some time without issue. I will update this report if the problem returns but it appears resolved.

Motorola Droid X Version.1.13.604.MB810.Verizon.en.US Firmware version 2.1-update1 Kernel version 2.6.29 w30471@il93lnxdroid08 #1 I have configured an L2TP/IPSec VPN to connect to a Cisco ASA 5510 version 8.2(1). The phone successfully completes IKE phase 1 and phase 2 negotiation and establishes an IPSec SA but no L2TP traffic flows. The android log shows a number of Q"ETimeout -Q>E Sending SCCRQQ"E messages then eventually a VpnService Q"EConnecting timed outQ"E after which it gives up. The Cisco side shows a successful negotiation and an established IPSec SA but it doesnQ'Et appear to receive any L2TP messages after IKE completes. There are no error messages or other additional log activity related to the session. To me it looks like something is not working correctly on the android side. I have attached an android log Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E output and a partial Cisco config with the last log messages output from the ASA. Please let me know if thereQ'Es any other information that would be helpful in diagnosing this issue.

column7: 1. Go to the far left desktop (On my phone there is 5 - note this bug doesnQ'Et seem to happen on the other desktops so this step is essential). 2. Long click on the background of said desktop. 3. Q'EAdd to Home screenQ'E menu appears. 4. Select Q'EFoldersQ'E. 5. Select Q'ENew FolderQ'E. 6. A folder called Q'EFolderQ'E is created on the specified desktop. 7. Press the central button on the desktop (i.e. the Q'EappsQ'E button that has a white ring as an icon). 8. The app menu comes up showing all the installed apps. 9. Long click Q'EBrowserQ'E (or probably any app). 10. Drag this app in to the folder we created. 11. Click on the folder. 12. The application we specified should is in this folder. This is the bug now: 13. With the contents of the folder still showing long click the Q'EBrowserQ'E app that is contained in the folder. 14. Now try dragging it on to the desktop. The desktop goes blank then the home desktop loads and we are on the home desktop. If we now go back to the folder in question the Q'EBrowserQ'E app is still in this folder. Platform: Motorola Defy - Android 2.1 This is 100% reproducable on my phone. Note that currently I am having problems dragging apps to any of my desktops sometimes and at other times I canQ'Et drag apps between desktops. This problem only started happening once I started using folders on my desktops for the first time. This is very serious for me. I might even have to return my phone and get a non-android phone. I canQ'Et risk buying another android phone because I donQ'Et know if itQ'Es just my specific phone or the Motorola Defy in general or all versions of 2.1 on ANY headset. I must assume the worst because I wonQ'Et be able to claim on my insurance more than once probably. Very sad as itQ'Es a brilliant phone. I am wanting to investigate this with the help of a developer. I am a developer myself and also have quite a good knowledge of testing. I am hoping that between us we can debug what is happening with my phone :)

For the past 2 days my back speaker on my Motorola Droid (Android 2.0.1) has not been functioning. It seemed that the problem started when I plugged the phone into my charger so I plugged it in tested the ringtone sound (no sound) unplugged it and tested it again (no sound). I have rebooted several times and have done a battery pull with no fix. Speakerphone does not work I cannot hear the phone ring or hear other notifications. I had not used headphones prior to this occurring but I did just try them and when I tested the ringtone I could hear through the headphones. I can hear through the ear piece when I am placing a call but ringtone tests donQ'Et produce sound in either the back speaker or the ear piece. I have been reading a lot of reports about sound problems which are typically resolved by rebooting and/or plugging and unplugging headphones. These solutions have not worked for me. Some of these other reports say that they can hear the ringtone in the earpiece but not the back speaker. My problem seems related but as I mentioned I canQ'Et hear the ringtone through the ear piece and reboots arenQ'Et helping. This may just be a hardware issue but I have had a hard time contacting Verizon folks (online and by phone) so I am throwing this to the masses to see if there is something I am missing. If there is no crowd-sourceable solution what do you all think about in-store Verizon tech support?

-My queue is empty -I play a podcast -As soon as that podcast is finished it picks up another podcast at random and starts playing it. -Verified that queue was empty at the time. If this is a feature there seems to be no setting to disable it. I am almost certain that its not a feature because its not consistent. Noticed this issue after the last app update. column7: Steps to reproduce. Using microsoft dhcp server in windows server 2008 also tested 2003. 1. Assuming your internet connection is already setup. 2. Assuming you use a dhcp server (verified problem with microsoft dhcp) 3. verify that the android (in this case motorola droid) works properly with a typical dhcp server configuration (dns and gateway settings). 4. Add a Q"Eclassless static routeQ"E config to the dhcp server scope. It can be to any network including a fictitious network so long as it uses intranet addresses. In this case I used network 172.16.0.0 mask 255.255.0.0 gw 192.168.66.6. 5. Disconnect and reconnect wifi on the android. 6. Connection will report to be successful but data apps will all fail to transmit data regardless of whether or not the ip addresses being contacted would use the route or not. ALL internet communication fails... Motorola droid with 2.1 update 1 installed. Microsoft dhcp service.

column7: If you use Evolution as your calendar program and Exchange as calendar server events updated from Evolution into the Exchange server are not synchronized by android (version 2.0 Motorola Milestone). To reproduce it: * In Evolution: create an event in your Exchange calendar if you go to exchange webaccess you can see it and Android also synchronizes it. * In Evolution: edit that event (move it rename it schedule a meeting whatever). After that all changes are reflected in the Exchange calendar (you can check it from exchange webaccess) but the Android device doesnQ'Et update it (neither updates it FROM the Exchange server nor updates it TO the Exchange server if you change it in the android device) Please note that this can be something related to Evolution since updating the event directly in the Exchange Webaccess interface results in the Android device correctly updating the event.

column6: Moto Droid running 2.1 update 1 Build ESE81 Using native email app to access my Verizon email I receive emails from PCMag.com and IQ'Em able to open them with no problem. In fact the emails appear in the same format (HTML) that they do when I open them in a browser window. The problem occurs when I forward the message. When I forward the message to my work email the message is converted and arrives in my Outlook Inbox as plain-text and all the article links are stripped. The same thing happens when I forward to any other email account including my Verizon account. Confirmed that itQ'Es not an Exchange server issue Confirmed that itQ'Es not spam or email filter issue Confirmed that itQ'Es not Verizon.net Confirmed that itQ'Es not a Verizon Wireless issue Finally confirmed with Motorola support that it is a problem with the email app on the Droid. BTW for all you K-9 fans a similar thing happens. The message is converted from itQ'Es original HTML format. It also arrives as a plain-text email. The only difference is that links arenQ'Et stripped. I have a case open with Motorola for over a month with no resolution. Hope someone here is able to get it resolved

Description: Screen turns off due to (5 sec) time limit while user is inputting unlock pattern. Expected behavior is when user starts to input unlock pattern the time limit gets reset (timer restarts once finger is lifted off screen) Steps to reproduce: 1. Set screen unlock pattern. 2. Turn off screen using top power button (locks screen). 3. Turn on screen using top power button. 4. Wait 3 seconds before starting to input unlock pattern. Input pattern slowly Result: While user is inputting the pattern screen turns off (very annoying). Correct Behavior: When user is inputting the pattern screen should not be turned off. Timeout timer should reset and only start again when user lifts finger off the screen. Device: Motorola Droid OS: Android 2.1-update1

column6: IQ'Em using a Motorola Droid running 2.0.1. I have a gmail account and a corporate exchange email account set up on it. I also have a laptop that syncs my exchange calender and Google calender. Twice in the last week it has erased all emails in my exchange inbox. I didnQ'Et link it to the Droid the first time and donQ'Et remember the exact circumstances but I remember having some issues with the Droid and then checking my email on the device to see an empty inbox. My account was still set up however. Checking on a desktop using Outlook confirmed all my inbox emails were gone but all my other folders were unaffected. My lost emails didnQ'Et show up in the deleted folder either. The second time it occurred I the phone in my car mount charging with a very low battery. I took it out of the mount and unplugged the charger. The next time I started it up it did a cold boot up. I didnQ'Et think anything of it since the battery had been low but then I found my contact list and call log empty. The sync icon popped up and the Droid repopulated my contact list but the next time I checked my email (using exchange web access) I found all my inbox emails gone again. This is a very serious issue for people who use exchange email for their work. I canQ'Et afford to keep losing all my emails and IQ'Em sure most other people would agree. IQ'Em also very surprised that I didnQ'Et see this issue brought up yet when I searched this site. I canQ'Et be the only person this has happened to. Please star this issue if you are having the same problem.

column7: Having problems with my Parrot MK6000 and a Sony mex-bt2700 stereo with bluetooth. The Parrot works great if only on A2DP. Switches back and forth seamlessly if I use my Plantronics headset for calls. The problems there start if I try to use the Parrot for calls. If music is playing when a call comes in when the call is over the music gets choppy and the headset profile wonQ'Et connect again four three or four minutes until the Droid resets its bluetooth connection or until I reboot the phone. If not using A2DP and calling same thing but no choppy music. The Sony works great for A2DP until I get a call on my Plantronics or the stereo or if I turn off the vehicle and turn it back on. No choppy music here. It just says paired but not connected and will not connect again until I unpair and repair. These problems everyone are having are clearly unacceptable in a modern phone of any price. Google needs to read these forums and get together with the vendors and force a fix on the carriers. We paid a lot of money for these devices and should not have to choose between safety and a stinking phone. Motorola Droid running 2.01. Parrot MK6000 software update 1.03. Sony mex-bt2700

column7: Client certificates are a form of two-factor authentication introduced in SSL 3.0 and supported in all versions of TLS. It allows organizations to identify and authenticate users by issuing client certificates signed by either a public certificate authority or an internal private CA. Web resources can be protected by configuring the server to require client certificate authentication forcing the client to identify themselves by presenting a valid certificate. If the certificate is validated the client is granted access; if the certificate is invalid or otherwise not present access is denied. Many organizations depend on client certificates to increase security over comparatively weaker password-based schemes. As far as I can tell AndroidQ'Es built-in browser does *NOT* support client certificates. I use client certificates to protect access to some of the most critical administration sections of my websites. I have a Motorola Droid on Verizon and have tested with the official releases of Android 2.0 2.0.1 and 2.1 without any success. While I have been able to successfully import my certificates into the built-in certificate store (Settings -Q>E Locations Q&E Security -Q>E Credential Storage) the browser does not seem to access this store when I attempt to access a Web resource requiring a certificate. Instead the page dies with an error stating it cannot be displayed. As my dependence on my Droid increases I hate the thought of weakening my security just for the convenience of doing administrative tasks on the go. Please add this functionality into the Android browser. ItQ'Es a published standard and one quite a few people depend on. Note: This is *not* the same issue as those requesting client certificate authentication for WiFi. This relates to client certificate authentication in the browser to a remote website. IQ'Eve searched the issue log multiple times and have found many references to the WiFi issue but not to this one.

column7: I have a Motorola Milestone running Android 2.0.1. I am trying to get Android to connect to my Openswan (Linux Openswan 2.4.6 (klips)) IPSEC VPN but it fails to connect. The initial key exchange appears to fail. First I installed a CA certificate and a user certificate on my phone. I installed the CA certificate by browsing to my local web server and downloading it. I installed the user certificate by creating a pkcs12 file and installing from the Q"ELocation Q&E SecurityQ"E menu. Then I added a VPN entry under Q"EWireless Q&E NetworksQ"E. I selected the two installed certificates. When I try and connect the negotiation seems to fail in (what Openswan calls) STATE_MAIN_R2. I have attached the Q"Eadb logcatQ"E output the Openswan kernel debug output and a tcpdump from the router (I cannot get one from the phone as I do not have root access). Android appears to fail to respond to the Q"EMR2Q"E message that Openswan sends. The problem appears to be the line Q"EE/racoon ( 6843): failed to get my CERT.Q"E. This appears to usually refer to racoonQ'Es racoon.conf file pointing to an incorrect user certificate. Since I have set up the certificate in the VPN settings I think this is a bug. Please let me know if you need anything else from me to diagnose this problem. Thanks a lot Michael

Uninstalled the application and rebooted and the message persisted and continued to simply disappear when clicked. What the behavior should be: The application should be downloaded and installed only once or the message notification should redirect me to the applications market page onClick.

Tested on Android 2.1 on Samsung Moment and Motorola Droid. I wrote an application called MileageLog by NetIn.com. When starting MileageLog first and Google Navigation second Android will restart. Google Navigation runs fine by itself. MileageLog by NetIn.com runs fine by itself. Run Navigation first and then MileageLog and there are some oddities with GPS initialization but otherwise both run fine. Start MileageLog and then Navigation and Android restarts when Navigation tries to calculate a route. (There is a free demo version of MileageLog on Market if you want to try this.) The attached logcat (on the Samsung Moment - Android 2.1) is long. You might search for the string Q"EEXCEPTION IN SYSTEM PROCESSQ"E or events around 06-01 15:17:16.167. I think that Navigation does not like the notifications to be updated. MileageLog uses notification updates for things like the GPS going in and out of sync and so on... Has anyone else experienced anything like this? Does someone know how to get this info to the Navigation people? And regardless of that an app shouldnQ'Et be able to restart the kernel should it? thanks Robert

column6: I am a Motorola Droid user and am also diabetic. I use sheets-to-go to track the dates and times of 4 - 5 blood sugar readings that I take every date so I can report them to my MD at our quarterly appointments. I have to first select the formula bar field and then double click the ALT key every time I move from cell to cell. This essentially triples the number of keystrokes needed to enter data. There needs to be a way to set num lock and have it hold across cells. Here are the keystrokes I have to use to enter 4 cells of numbers: select formula bar ALT ALT 7-29-2010 touch next cell (5 way bar will not move to adjacent cell) select formula bar ALT ALT 10:15 touch next cell select formula bar ALT ALT 129 touch next cell select formula bar ALT 2 hours post ALT 1 egg ALT 2 bacon bl coffee WAY too much keyboarding for something that should be very simple. Also you should have your Q"EcontactsQ"E app set so that it defaults to numbers when entering phone numbers rather than having to enter ALT ALT before each number and then ALT ALT again for the next number. This is basic stuff that Palm had figured out years ago...Also not being able to cut Q&E paste is HUGE. And not having Flash Player for my phone is another serious problem...donQ'Et know if its yQ'Eall or Adobe and really donQ'Et care. All I know is I canQ'Et see lots of video clips.Love my Motorola Droid like the synch up with gmail Q&E contacts but things like this are making me look toward the iPhone as much as I hate ATQ&ET. Below is the FAQ for this problem from the Dataviz support website where I learned that this is an Android keyboard issue. Problem: The numeric keypad changes back to the alphabet in Sheet To Go when typing more than 1 number or when switching cells. Cause: This is normal behavior on an Android device: Keypad changes back to alphabet after entering 1 number This is the way the Android keyboard works. It happens because the formula bar field at the top of the screen is not yet Q'EactiveQ'E when you tap the Q'E123Q'E or Q'EAltQ'E key and enter the first number. It becomes active after you enter the first number (you will see a blinking cursor in that field which indicates it is active). But because that field was not yet active when you entered the first number the Android OS deactivated the numeric keypad and Sheet To Go never knew it was enabled in the first place. However if you tap the formula bar field to make it active before you tap the Q'E123Q'E or Q'EAltQ'E key it will already be active when you enter the first number so the numeric keypad will stay enabled until you tap Q'E123Q'E or Q'EAltQ'E again (or until you switch to a different cell). Keypad changes back to alphabet when switching cells This is the way the Android OS works. You can see similar behavior in other apps on an Android device. For example open another app where you can enter text (email calendar etc) then tap the Q'E123Q'E or Q'EAltQ'E key and type a number. Then tap on a different field and you will notice the numeric keypad turns off. In Sheet To Go pressing the Enter/Return key or tapping on a different cell is the same as tapping on a different field so the same thing happens.

For instance home: 555-12121 and home fax: 555-12122 * Save the contact Expected Behavior: All phone numbers in contact should be displayed and available for dialing. Actual Behavior: Only first number is shown. (home: 555-12121) Additional information: May be related to issues 3232 and 5425. When identical numbers are stored in contact only first number is displayed. Numbers after pause are not being compared.

column7: Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Type in a secure self-signed url in the default browser. For example https://review.source.android.com 2. Before the security warning comes up navigate away (or hit forward if trying multiple times) for example to google.com 3. Hit continue on the security warning when it appears. - What happened. The next page gets a nice friendly padlock icon or else a questionmark icon depending on your answer. (even if you are now at a http: url ) - What you think the correct behavior should be. The questionable page should have never had a padlock icon until the user hits continue. Going to a different domain (or changing the non-hash part of the url) should always clear the padlock in the address bar. (Even if this produces false negatives--better than false positives. Android version: Motorola Droid (latest 2.0.1) default webkit browser.

column7: Previously to the 2.2 update when the onscreen keyboard was launched to type something in to the address bar of the browser a Q"E.comQ"E key was available to the left of the space bar. This is now replaced with a forward slash. The .com key was much more useful and there is now no alternative way to access this feature. The removal of this feature has lead to 3 redundant ways of getting a forward slash: - direct onscreen keyboard button - pressing Q"E?123Q"E to get to the symbol keyboard - sliding finger up from the top row of the keyboard to get the new hidden symbols. Please replace the missing Q"E.comQ"E key. Motorola Droid on Verizon Android 2.2 Build FRG01B

column6: There are a lot of Wifi problems posted here but most tend to be aimed towards what people think are specific problems (router or b/g/n related) to where they canQ'Et connect. This report IS NOT for being unable to connect! This problem is occurring for me on the Motorola Droid 2.0.1 on varying connections/ routers. Wifi connects just fine and will function for a random amount of time. After this time the connectivity disappears. Usually less than 30 minutes of browsing is all it takes. The browser wonQ'Et connect to anything market wonQ'Et show any lists and speedtest app wonQ'Et find any servers. When this happens the phone will still show the wifi icon as if its connected. Toggling the phones wifi off/on instantly fixes the problem for a short period of time until connectivity is inevitably lost again. Just to reiterate this is a problem that transcends the connection settings of the signal and occurs on every wifi hotspot IQ'Eve tested.

column6: IQ'Em running the Cyanogen 6.0 (final) which is based on Android 2.2 using a Motorola Droid. However IQ'Eve reproduced this issue on a completely stock device using the stock OTA 2.2 release - itQ'Es evidently something in 2.2 itself (this is not seen in any previous release e.g. 2.1). Attached is a Zip containing three simple html files: testframe.htm is the main one and it has two children testframe_L.htm and testframe_R.htm. Note that these are based directly on Squirrelmail frames (where I first noticed this problem) but I stripped them down to the bare essentials to exclude anything specific to Squirrelmail. Any frameset of this nature should exhibit the same symptoms. Install these somewhere you can browse to and open testframe.htm. The problem is that you *cannot scroll* even though the frames are clearly much longer than the default screen size and each has plenty of data to scroll through. Now zoom in by double-tapping or even using the slightest bit of pinch-zoom. The page suddenly becomes fully scrollable. Zoom out and it becomes un-scrollable (and will move to the top of the page if you had previously scrolled down). It appears that 2.2 does not render the frameset correctly on an un-zoomed page while 2.1 (as well as all desktop browsers IQ'Eve tried) never have difficulty with this. The fact that slightly zooming causes the error to go away further suggests a true bug (reflow or lack thereof doesnQ'Et seem to affect this - just the mere fact itQ'Es zoomed at all).

column7: 1. Create an event on Android with sync enabled. 2. Edit the event (change start time stop time etc.) 3. After a bit the event reverts back to how it was before modified. I suspect it is a timing problem with the sync from Google calendar. It doesnQ'Et happen every time. Once when hitting Q"EDoneQ"E when saving the modification the Q"EDoneQ"E operation seemed to hang I hit done again and when the mobile calendar opened no changes had occurred. Changes on the mobile device should update the online Google calendar. Motorola Droid (Verizon). Android version 2.1-update1.

column8: I come from a Palm background. One of the wonderful things about the Palm calendar was the ability to set repeating or recurring alarms for an event that would continue until the user canceled the alarm. I donQ'Et see this in the Android calendar on my Motorola Milestone with Android 2.0.1. The alarm needs to repeat until the user cancels it The default interval between alarms needs to be adjustable from a few minutes to an hour or so. The default number of repeats on the alarm needs to be adjustable by the user. The default alarm sound needs to be adjustable by the user. The Android application Q"ERemind MeQ"E comes closest to what I need in the Android world. However it is standalone and its entries do not appear in the Android calendar. This means that I have to put my reminders in two places -- in the Calendar so I donQ'Et Q'Edouble bookQ'E and in Remind Me so that if I am unable to drop what I am doing to tend to the reminder it doesnQ'Et let me forget. Presently multiple alarms on a calendar event can be set but it appears that they have to be individually set and they can only be set prior to the event. This is fine for Q'Emust be thereQ'E appointments. It is cumbersome for Q'Emust do sometime todayQ'E reminders. If I am driving and cannot tend to the reminder alarm on a calendar event I often forget that the alarm was triggered by the time I get to my destination. This is why I need the recurring reminder. My ability to forget knows no bounds. :) In scouring the web for information on this I see that this is a common request but perhaps posted in places that the devs donQ'Et see. I hope that posting this here will be helpful to further development of the platform. Thanks for listening. Frank. NOTE: This form is only for requesting new features in Android. For all discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the feature youQ'Ere requesting in as much detail as possible. If youQ'Ere an application developer and are requesting new APIs please include sample code showing how you are proposing the API should be used.

column6: A recurring all-day appointment is created in Outlook (Exchange). The appointment is for a birthday with a recurrence range starting 4/14/1967 and recurring each year. When the Android corporate calendar syncs with Exchange the appointment for the current year shows as being on 4/15/2010 however it should be on 4/14/2010. If I change the recurrence date from 4/14/1967 to 4/14/1969 the problem persists. If I change the recurrence date to 4/14/1970 or later the problem is worked-around (the appointment correctly shows up on 4/14/2010). I am on a Motorola Droid. Firmware 2.1-update1 Kernel version 2.6.29-omap1-g7fa8788 android-build@apa26#1 Build number ESE81

Running the attached application on a Nexus One Motorola Milestone or HTC Desire (running Android 2.1) you can reproduce the problem by doing the following: 1. Install and run the attached MultitouchDragBug application 2. Quickly alternate tapping two fingers on the screen (each positioned near the left and right edges quickly tapping 12121212...). Expected: Dots should appear below where fingers are pressed on the screen. Actual: Lines appear originating from the finger that was lifted up to the finger that is pressed on the screen. I believe this is caused by a misinterpreted android ACTION_MOVE event. Source for the demo application is also included in the attached zip.

I was surprised to not find a Q'ErefreshQ'E option in the calendar app. 2. While moving the appointment I did accidentally change it to spanning two days and then I updated it again. For example the original appointment was say Tue 4-5pm. I updated it to Tue 2pm - Wed 3pm. Then I updated again to Wed 2-3pm. IQ'Em indicating this in case itQ'Es relevant to the problem. Motorola Droid on Android 2.2 (Froyo) goes dim after the screen timeout period while in the car dock and while on the charger. This is when the brightness setting is maximum and Auto brightness is off. To reproduce: - Place Droid in car dock - Attach charger - Set brightness to maximum - Open maps and scroll/zoom to the position where route decisions can be made based on realtime traffic Result: - At about the screen timeout period (I have mine set to 2 mins) the screen dims Expected Result: - Nothing. The screen should stay bright. As did Android 2.1. Workarounds: - Take hand off wheel reach up and momentarily touch/slide the display a bit. Display brightens again until the next screen timeout period. - Change screen timeout to 30 mins. This only means you have to do the first workaround less often. And itQ'Es a pain because the brightness widget wonQ'Et change the timeout period. Other Notes: - I see that when the battery gets fully charged the Q"EchargingQ"E animation on the batter icon stops. Maybe the screen brightness logic incorrectly interprets this as Q"Enot chargingQ"E.

column6: I have a Motorola Droid with the 2.1 update. This problem developed some time after that update. The problem: Essentially what happens is that I will be playing audio in any audio player (Android music player BeyondPod Radio Time ect.) and suddenly the music will become muted. The device shows the music as still playing but there is no audio. Once this has happened I have a secondary problem. Hitting pause or stop only stops the audio for ~2 seconds. It then will automatically start playing again(still muted). There is a corollary to this issue that might be related. When in a phone call my phone will randomly mute as well. This has nothing to do with the sensor or anything else. I have had this happen with the phone lying on my desk in speakerphone mode and Bluetooth in my phone case on Bluetooth while up to my head and just about any other configuration possible. I have seen it with the screen on in its dock switch from normal to mute with me sitting 2 foot away. While I can unmute the phone call often it will mute again though with no set frequency. Things I have tried: I have uninstalled apps that were recently installed when this issue began. Effect = none. I have tried task killer and others to kill everything. Effect = 90% of the time the media begins again ~2 seconds later. I have tried to kill off individual apps then stop the player. Effect = with every single app and idle process the media begins again ~2 seconds later. With third party apps I have closed the app with task killer. Effect = app will not restart but any future media played will be muted from any app till the phone is restarted. If I go to the music player app and try to play something there it will be muted and will only stop for the ~2 seconds. I have turned off the phone. Effect = 90% of the time this will fix the problem for a while. 10% the media will start again as soon as everything is loaded. I have removed all the media widgets. Effect = none I have factory reset the phone and delayed the installation of other media apps. Effect = media will still occasionally go into that same loop. Note: There are very rare occasions where pausing the media and killing all apps will solve the problem but this has happened 3 times since the update. The majority of my media is podcasts and audio books (hour or more per track). Theories to the trigger: Honestly I have no idea. Sometimes this will occur if I was listening to audio and get a phone call in the middle. Other times it may happen when switching apps. However it has happened many times while just sitting on my desk with no external input. I have looked at the background apps that are active when this occurs however all that does in eliminate some apps as potential trouble makers. I cannot make the media go into this loop. I have no way of recreating the issue. It is random. I have looked for any possible coloration between these occurrences but I can find none and have found nothing on the boards that solves this particular issue. It appears that the trigger is in the core OS. Conclusion: I am hoping that Froyo will fix this but since we have no date for release I do not know when I can test that theory. Third party apps do not seem to be triggering this problem. This occurs in all players of local media.

column7: Android 2.1+ Motorola Droid Verizon Wireless There are multiple threads both here and at MotorolaQ'Es Droid forum of people requesting this feature (which appearently was initially present but subsequently lost sometime after the initial release in November) https://supportforums.motorola.com/thread/16334?start=0Q&Etstart=0 https://supportforums.motorola.com/thread/19000 ID 2606 ID 2843 ID 3088 ID 3089 ID 4555 ID 4712 ID 5096 ID 5193 ID 5195 and now 5195 which was opened as an enhancement request has been closed for Q"Eworking as intendedQ"E. How can an enhancement be working as intended if it was never even remotely implemented? Screens that do not currently auto-rotate include but may not be limited to: LOCK HOME CONTACTS PHONE (would be usefull when in dock) CALL LOG (would be usefull when in dock) FAVORITES (would be usefull when in dock) INCOMING CALL (would be usefull when in dock) CALL IN PROGRESS (would be usefull when in dock) Please listen to your users who have clearly identified an opportunity to improve the Android user interface. Please Please Please add this to the list of things that the Iphone canQ'Et... but the DROID DOES! Comment 1 by j...@google.com regarding issue 7607 Q"EPlease stop filing the same feature request over and over again.Q"E There seems to be a lack of knowledge or understanding on supports end of what a feature request is. Q"EWorking as intendedQ"E is not a valid reason/explanation for closing a feature request ticket. Giving zero explanation when merging a ticket into one that has been closed already is purely nonsensical and defeats the whole purpose of a ticket system. This feature request will continue to be filed if it continues to be closed Q"Eover and over againQ"E without explanation.

column6: I have the Motorola Droid phone and am running 2.0.1. I am working on development with my own Web site and have noticed a persistent problem with the CSS Q"Etext-align:justifyQ"E in Android. The text is squashed into the left half of the area where itQ'Es supposed to be when the phone is held vertically (it appears correctly when the phone is held horizontally). When text-align is set to right left or center I donQ'Et have this problem. The text fills nicely. If the text-align attribute is left out and the HTML P tag is set to justify it renders to fill the whole area and justifies correctly. The page renders correctly in a conventional browser - just not the Android browser. This problem also recurs on Infinity Browser and Opera Mini which I downloaded in the Market. See http://www.schuminweb.com/css-test/android-style-bug.php for an example of what itQ'Es doing. The justify attribute is set in CSS in my example.

* Current behavior * When programmaticaly scanning Wi-Fi networks (using WifiManager.startScan() and WifiManager.getScanResults()) when the SSID broadcast is disabled on an access point and the access point has never been connected to the device the ScanResult element for this access point does not appear in the list of access points returned. This was observed on Android HTC Hero (1.5 2.1) HTC Desire (2.1) Nexus One (2.1 2.2) Motorola Droid (2.0.12.1). * Prefered behavior * I would like to see the access points with hidden SSID appear in the ScanResult list at this programmatic level either with SSID as an empty string or with a particular constant string (e.g. android.net.wifi.WifiManager.WIFI_HIDDEN_SSID to be defined). * Related issues * - http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=6601 -Q>E scope seems to be wider than this actual feature request but I am not interested in connecting the the access points. * Analysis * There is no reason at hardware level for active Wi-Fi scans not to show probe responses information from hidden-SSID access points. So the problem is probably software. Apparently the parsing of Wi-Fi scan results occurs in WifiService.parseScanResult() (in platform/frameworks/base.git/services/com/android/server/WifiService.java) The instanciation of a new ScanResult object is only done if the length of the (trimmed) SSID is Q>E0. It looks like an intentional choice. If the purpose of this feature is to avoid showing hidden access points in wifi management applications I suggest using an empty SSID and add a flag to manage the hidden/visible property for the access point.

These behaviors have been experienced with the Motorola Droid HTC Hero and others running Android Eclair 2.1 1. Disappearing contacts: Configuring a Google account on a device causes previously added local contacts to Q"EdisappearQ"E. Previously entered local contacts are lumped into a group called Q"EAll Other ContactsQ"E and when synced are placed in the All Contacts area. By default the Q"EAll Other ContactsQ"E group is unchecked for display so the appearance to the user is that these locally entered contacts have been removed. In addition these local contacts have been lumped in with the potentially large and unmanaged Q"EAll ContactsQ"E list when synchronized. To Reproduce: - Start with a clean device (new or factory reset) - Add a contact local to the device (first and last name is all that is needed). - Configure a Google account on the device. During configuration ensure that Auto-sync is enabled. It is easier to see the behavior using a Google account without any contacts but this is not a limitation. - Return to the Contacts application. The previously added local contact should have disappeared from the contact list. - Sometimes the local contact is still visible; however this is only temporary. To expedite the disappearance: - From the contact list select the Display Options or Display Groups menu item. - Select the Google account from the Display Options activity to display all of the available groups. - Press the Done button to close the activity and return to the contact list. - The locally added contact should no longer be visible Recommended behavior: Upon configuring a Google account either add all previously entered contacts to the Google account Q"ESystem Group: My ContactsQ"E group that is checked for display by default or add them to another new group (I.E. Q"EDevice ContactsQ"E that is check for display by default. 2. Corrupt contact list: Associated with the disappearing contacts adding contacts to a device with a configured Google account that has not been synchronized will cause the contact list to become corrupt. The corruption involves numerous Q"ESystem Group: My ContactsQ"E groups unnamed groups and deleted contacts. This has primarily been seen with Google accounts that are originally configured with Auto-sync disabled; however the contact list can still become corrupt if the user adds a new contact before the initial sync has been completed. To Reproduce: - Start with a clean device (new or factory reset) - Configure a Google account on the device. During configuration ensure that Auto-sync is disabled to prevent synchronizing the contacts or contact groups. It is easier to see the behavior using a Google account without any contacts but this is not a limitation. - Open the Contacts application and navigate to the contact list. View the Google account groups available for display (Menu-Q>EDisplay Options or Display Groups-Q>ESelect Google account). There should be only one group that is named Q"EAll Other ContactsQ"E and it should be unchecked. - Add a contact local to the device (first and last name is all that is needed). This contact should be added to the default Google account Q"ESystem Group: My ContactQ"E group. Since the account has never been synced and the correct Q"ESystem Group: My ContactsQ"E does not exist locally the device creates one. - View the Google account groups available for display. There should now be two groups Q"EAll Other ContactsQ"E that is unchecked and Q"ESystem Group: My ContactsQ"E that is checked. - Add a second contact local to the device. This contact and all additionally entered local contacts are placed into an unnamed group that is unchecked for display by default. View the Google account groups available for display to see this group. Since this second contact was added to this unchecked group it appears to the use that the contact failed to be added. - Return to the Accounts Q&E Sync configuration and manually sync the contacts for this Google account. - After the sync is complete return to the Contacts application and view the Google account groups available for display. There should be at a minimum two Q"ESystem Group: My ContactsQ"E groups. The unnamed group has disappeared; however adding a new contact local to the device will recreate the group. Also note that the second contact added has been moved to the Q"EAll Other ContactsQ"E group. Recommended behavior: Lockout adding new contacts to the Contact application until the first sync of Google account groups has been performed. If Auto-sync has been disabled when the Google account is configured automatically perform a one time sync of the Google account groups.

Android 2.0 Motorola Droid Verizon Wireless There are multiple threads both here and at MotorolaQ'Es Droid forum of people requesting this feature (which appearently was initially present but subsequently lost sometime after the initial release in November) https://supportforums.motorola.com/thread/16334?start=0Q&Etstart=0 https://supportforums.motorola.com/thread/19000 ID 2606 ID 2843 ID 3088 ID 3089 ID 4555 ID 4712 ID 5096 ID 5193 ID 5195 and now 5195 which was opened as an enhancement request has been closed for Q"Eworking as intendedQ"E. How can an enhancement be working as intended if it was never even remotely implemented? Screens that do not currently auto-rotate include but may not be limited to: LOCK HOME CONTACTS PHONE (would be usefull when in dock) CALL LOG (would be usefull when in dock) FAVORITES (would be usefull when in dock) INCOMING CALL (would be usefull when in dock) CALL IN PROGRESS (would be usefull when in dock) Please listen to your users who have clearly identified an opportunity to improve the Android user interface. Please Please Please add this to the list of things that the Iphone canQ'Et... but the DROID DOES!

Hardware: Motorola Sholes (Droid) Software: Stock Verizon Android 2.1 and Ultimate Droid 9.8.0 When talking on the phone if the user switches to another app they can hear the other caller but not speak to them. If they switch back to the PhoneApp they can be heard again. If this is expected (ie Voice Search or other app takes control of the mic) PhoneApp should not give up control of mic without notifying the user.

column6: -Steps to reproduce: Open the attached page in the default Android browser. Click the Q'Edisplay overlayQ'E link; an absolutely-positioned div containing links is displayed that appears over the input fields statically positioned on the page. -What happens: Since the links are Q'Edisplay:blockQ'E and the div theyQ'Ere contained within has a higher z-index than the static input elements on the page touching the links should take precedence and touching around the links shouldnQ'Et Q"Ebleed throughQ"E to the statically-positioned input elements on the page. However it doesnQ'Et take much to touch on or around the links and the focus goes to the input fields opening the keyboard. Interestingly once the user begins to type the keyboard closes (verifying that itQ'Es behavior is correct and it shouldnQ'Et have opened in the first place?). Moving the absolutely-positioned div containing the links around in the DOM (inserting it as the first child of body or as the next sibling of the trigger link) does nothing to alleviate the problem. -What the correct behavior should be: Clearly the focus shouldnQ'Et Q"Ebleed throughQ"E the absolutely-positioned higher z-indexed div when it is touched. Reproduced on the default WebKit web browser on the HTC Eris (Android 1.6) and on the Motorola Droid (Android 2.0.1). This same Q"Ebleed throughQ"E problem exists visiting many major sites that use an overly menu system (including google.com) via the Android browser. *This bug does NOT exist for Mobile Safari or the WebOS WebKit browser so it is clearly an Android-specific defect* Attached the sample html page where this problem is easily reproducible and some screen shots illustrating the problem.

column7: Using DoggCatcher podcast organizer/player and standard phone application on Motorola Droid Android version 2.0.1 When the phone rings media stops (good). After call done (or refused) media starts again (good) - BUT the playback volume is set to the middle of the available range -- BAD IQ'Em often listening to podcasts at home on the phoneQ'Es speakers with the media volume at maximum. I shouldnQ'Et have to set the media volume after every phone call -- the phone app should remember the volume setting and restore it. This also affects me on ANY type of audio device: Speaker Headset (wired) or Bluetooth (Including wireless headset bluetooth connection to car stereo). REALLY annoying. Come to think of it - is the media stopping? Or is the phone app setting the volume to zero instead then setting it to medium because it didnQ'Et save the volume before setting it to zero? If this case is true then IQ'Em guessing the right action is to PAUSE the media playback rather than fiddle with the media volume then resume playback once call is ended! Thanks Steven Dorst

column4: Show all applications in Android Market warn/disallow user download if resolution/size/feature isnQ'Et compatible.
column5: One of the major benefits of Android is that many manufacturers can adopt Android on to many different kinds of devices with different specifications meeting different needs. This essentially allows anyone to jump aboard the Android train: from budget conscious users wanting a basic Android device like the HTC Wildfire or the LG Optimus One to those who must have the end-all and be-all device like the Google Nexus one Samsung Galaxy S or HTC Desire and corporations looking for an Android device that can enforce corporate policy. The main problem with many devices meeting many different needs is essentially fragmentation but on a needs level as opposed to a software level. Specifically different types of screens and therefore screen resolutions as well as disabled or non-existent software/hardware features and their relationship with the Android Market have created this problem. ItQ'Es disconcerting to search Android Market and to not find an application that works on a friends device (a Nexus One for example) but wonQ'Et on yours (a HTC Wildfire) because the application in question only supports 480x800 and not 240x320 or because the device does not sport a camera (Motorola Droid Pro) or because of security reasons enforced by corporate policy (through Android). I believe this creates a feeling of being a sub-par user of Android and therefore is detrimental to the Android experience. Not only that many users would be unaware of this limitation and would be unable to lobby the developer for support of their device and which Android appears to offer no facility to enable this link to communicate because applications are hidden from view. I propose that instead of hiding applications from Android Market that are incompatible with specific screen resolutions corporate policies or features that the user be warned (perhaps be disallowed from downloading the application) because of this issue and that they should be encouraged to contact the developer to facilitate the change to make their application compatible if this can happen. It would not only benefit consumers who at least know the application exists on Android Market but also benefit developers who would get increased exposure to all users of the Android Market (and not just those who are able to use the application) and be actively encouraged to develop their application(s) further by users for not only consumers but the Android ecosystem. IQ'Eve included three mock-ups of the Android Market to visually show how this would work if implemented highlighting the screen size issue as well as a third showing notices being stacked for multiple issues. The first (filename: marketview.jpg) shows the difference between an application that is compatible with the particular device as opposed to one that isnQ'Et. Notice that there is an exclamation symbol on the application that isnQ'Et compatible with a particular device or corporate policy. The second (filename: application.jpg) shows what the warning would look like if a particular user wanted to get more information on the application or wanted to lobby their support for the addition of the screen size for example. This can be done in two ways first: a simple Q"ERegister supportQ"E button which acts in a similar way to Q'EStarringQ'E issues on Google Code and the second allows a user to contact the developer to ask questions or offer support (by way of contributing code etc). By pressing the Q"ERegister supportQ"E button this sends a notification to the developer that someone would like to see their particular resolution implemented (and which sends the device manufactuer name model name and screen resolution) either by email or via their DeveloperQ'Es account. Q"EContact developerQ"E simply opens up an email form which allows inputting of queries or support. If a developer wishes either or both of these options can be disabled and which Android Market only shows the notices as opposed to simply hiding them. The options could be disabled for particular circumstances: if the application by design requires a feature that is disallowed by corporate policy (or isnQ'Et available in the first place) then the options would be automatically disabled. At the user end Android Market could be configured to ignore (hide) applications that raise this warning but display an additional inline notice: ?10 applications were hidden due to incompatibilities [Show These]?. - Expansion of this system - It could be argued that this notification system could indicate other incompatibilities like an application requiring a camera to function correctly which is not present in an Android device (i.e. Motorola Droid Pro (as for corporate security concerns)) or is incompatible with a corporate security policy (as enforced by Android) therefore allowing users to be aware of potential issues and which applications these issues affect instead of just hiding them from the Q'EMarket and essentially denying they exist which confuses users (through word of mouth that an application exists on Android Market but canQ'Et be found on particular devices) and which gives developers the opportunity to rectify issues rather than cutting them off completely. The third image (filename: otherwarnings.jpg) shows issues being stacked in this case an application requiring a camera and that this particular application is incompatible with corporate policy (for example: a particular corporation forbids the use of GPS services for whatever reason) therefore displaying the notices again rather than hiding the application.

column7: This is occurring on a Pioneer car stereo using the Pioneer bluetooth module (I believe it is the BTB-200 bluetooth module). Phone: Motorola Droid Firmware: 2.0.1 Baseband: C_01.3E.01P Kernel: 2.6.29-omap1-g0dd7e0b android-build@apa26 #511 Build Number: ESD56 The bluetooth connects properly. However about 75-85% of the time when I make a call the phone will switch the call to go through bluetooth but the audio will not function (the caller cannot hear me and I cannot hear the person I am calling). If I press the button on the call screen to switch the call off of bluetooth (either to route the call through the earpiece or through the speaker) the call will function for about 30 seconds to 1 minute but then the phone reboots. The bluetooth Q"EscreenQ"E on the car stereo still shows the phone as being connected and the call in progress. Even for the 15-25% of the time when the call goes through correctly and the phone completes the call without crashing and rebooting it will have the failure if I attempt to make a second call after the first call has been completed.

Model: Motorola Cliq MB200 System version: Blur_Version.1.3.18.MB200.T-Mobile.en.US Hardware version: SJUG5469AA Firmware version: 1.5 Kernel version: 2.6.27 build01@il93lnxebld13 #1 Build number: R6380CP1_035.14 When a headset is plugged in to the phone and a call comes in the call will be answered if I blow on the headset mike. This also happens if I am outdoors on a windy day and a gust of wind crosses the mike. The phone will answer the call Q"Eon blowQ"E every time without my pressing a button or touching the screen. Very disconcerting as I prefer to have control over what calls I answer and when. If I do not blow on the mike the call will not auto-answer. The phone does not exhibit this behavior without the headset plugged in. I havenQ'Et tested with a different headset. The headset I am using is The Boom E http://www.theboom.com/v/theboome.html

Phone Model: Droid X Android Version: Motorola BlurQ'Eed Froyo OTA 2.2 Carrier: Verizon Summary: I first noticed this bug by accident and thought I had accidentally pressed some buttons while editing one of my all day events on the blur calendar provided by the Droid X. IQ'Em unsure how much this deviates from AOSP implementations of the calendar but believe this is a core bug. When editing an Q"EAll DayQ"E event in the calendar it will then save the event as spanning across two whole days with the new day being the day after the event was originally scheduled for. The Q"EnewQ"E event is now listed as an Q"EAll DayQ"E event for two days and is successfully updated to Google CalendarQ'Es cloud. Steps to Reproduce: 1) Create a new event in the calendar. 2) Change the event time to Q"EAll DayQ"E. 3) Save the event. It will sync to cloud and become available for editing. 4) Select the event for editing. 5) Without changing anything save the event. 6) Observe that the event will now be an all day event spanning two days. The above steps should result in a two day event. The above steps are executed in a NON-AOSP ENVIRONMENT. The above steps are executed in a CARRIER MODIFIED ENVIRONMENT. The bug may exist in AOSP code even with the CME running on top. Assumed Issue: It is my belief this bug spans all iterations of calendar code and is probably a widespread if unrealized problem. I think that setting an event to Q"EAll DayQ"E sets the time span as including midnight as an endpoint for the event. Then editing that event includes the midnight endpoint (now being read as a simple Q"EinclusiveQ"E point) into the event as the beginning of the next day and the Q"EAll DayQ"E tag treats the event as spanning the second day saving updating and syncing with no issues. Notes: This bug is re-iterative. I can create a month long event from a single day event in a few minutes with never touching the Q"EdatesQ"E. Also I have rooted and tweaked but run Q'EstockQ'E ROM so there should be no introduced idiosyncrasies in date handling by the calendar code. IQ'Em unsure of exactly where this bug exists in code which is why I submitted this to the AOSP bug collector. It could exist in AOSP Verizon soft/mods or Motorola soft/mods so feel free to remove if this is an inappropriate place to post this issue.

If an event is created and saved in AndroidQ'Es Google Calendar app with any data in the event location (Q"EWhereQ"E) field that location cannot be deleted. When the event is edited if the Q"EWhereQ"E field is cleared and the event is saved it will appear to have saved without an event location. However once the app refreshes the calendar the Q"EWhereQ"E field has restored itself to whatever location was previously filled in on the initial creation of the event. If instead of trying to delete a location from the Q"EWhereQ"E field if it is simply modified to something else and then saved the change will stick. It appears that the Q"EWhereQ"E field can be modified it just cannot simply be deleted. Google calendar app should allow for complete deletion of data from this field. This has occurred consistently on the Motorola droid running 2.0 2.0.1 and 2.1.

If you try and purchase an app on the market and your credit card does not go through if you hit the Q'ErefundQ'E button while your credit card transaction is in a suspended state (because you didnQ'Et check your email and your phone only states that the download failed) it records it as a used refund instead of a refused CC transaction. Then later when you fix your credit card info and try to re-purchase the app it thinks that you have used a Q'ErefundQ'E on the app already even though you never downloaded the app and nothing was refunded and now your purchase is a Q'Eno refunds allowedQ'E purchase even though you never downloaded and installed the app in the first place. ThereQ'Es no way IQ'Em purchasing *any* apps ever without the available recourse of a refund. ThatQ'Es just not going to happen. - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Go into Google accounts and alter your credit card data so that it is incorrect. In my case the expiration date was incorrect. 2. Attempt to purchase a non-free app from the market via your headset. 3. While the app is in a Q'Ewaiting authorizationQ'E state hit the Q'ErefundQ'E button to make the page go away. 4. Return to Google Accounts and correct your credit card data. 5. Wait several days and then go back to the market and attempt to re-purchase the same app. You will then be rewarded with a message stating that you have already used a Q'ErefundQ'E on the app and your purchase is not non-refundable even though youQ'Eve never downloaded the app or used it before. The correct behavior should be that after you fix your credit card data and re-purchase the app it should be as if the first transaction never happened since you didnQ'Et really get a refund. Or conversely the Q'ErefundQ'E button should be unavailable to the user unless they were able to make an actual confirmed and funded purchase and download the app. I have Motorola Milestone running 2.1-update1.

column6: I have a motorola droid bought in January 2010 with version 2.0.1 of Android. On Sunday night (3/14/10) I noticed that I had no phone numbers in my google contacts. Most of the contacts were still there but with no details apart from the name or email address. Some of the contacts were entirely gone. This may be related to my phone being stolen and recovered. When I lost the phone I changed my google password. The phone numbers remained (I was able to send sms through a browser) for several days. On Friday the phone was recovered minus the SD card. I changed the password again. It took a while for the phone to synch with google to pull up my calendar and emails. It wasnQ'Et till several hours later that I was able to use gmail and the calendar. But then none of the contacts had phone numbers. Was the loss of phone numbers related to the fact that my phone no longer had any phone numbers? I assumed the contacts would reappear when it synched with google. How could the phone numbers in the phone disappear- are they stored in the sd card?

- Steps to reproduce the problem. Mount the SD card with cable attached to PC. Transfer files (mp3Q'Es or photos) to the mounted SD card. Receive a notification (new mail voicemail missed call). USB transfer stops and headset hangs. Eject from PC indicates USB card is still mounted and unable to eject. Battery removal is only method to get device to reset. - What happened. This behavior has happened with Windows Vista and Windows 7. It has also happened with different file transfer software (Motorola Media Connect TuneSync). It is present in Android 2.0.1 and was also present in Android 2.0. - What you think the correct behavior should be. USB File transfer should not hang when notification is received. Additionally battery removal should not be required to release the mounted SD card. - DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have: Motorola Droid w/ Android 2.0.1

When I text the new DROID X phone from AIM via my computer (not phone to phone texting computer to phone) the text does not show up on the DROID X. It should be received as a text message but it is never received. The DROID X can receive text messages from other phones just fine. Please help!! Can the DROID receive texts from AIM via computer?

column6: This is an enhancement request based on feature I had been using on HTC Diamond (Windows Mobile 6.1). Say I have three numbers as below in my phonebook (or contacts): John 12345678 Bill 12345765 Barry 12348765 If I start dialling new number when I dial 1234 I should get drop down which displays similar numbers in contacts. In this case it would be all three numbers. If I dial 12345 BarryQ'Es name should drop and I should see John and Bill. This would definitely make calling easier. Motorola Milestone Eclair

column13: Droid X Stock Froyo (2.2) from Motorola rooted Alarm Clock Fails When SD Card Not Mounted The other day my alarm failed to go off in the morning (good thing I woke up on my own). When I went to the Alarm page and clicked the two alarms that were set to use .mp3s from the SD card that second screen would not load -- I would have to reload the Alarms application. I realized the SD card was not properly mounted from the most recent startup/reboot. - Steps to reproduce the problem. Unmount your SD card remove the .mp3 files or take other steps to restrict the Alarms appQ'Es access to your .mp3 files. In the first case at least not only will no alarm play (or will play with no sound/vibration which is just as bad) you wonQ'Et be able to change the alarm (only delete it) until you re-mount the SD card. - What happened. A reboot properly mounted the SD card and fixed the problem. - What you think the correct behavior should be. This is UNACCEPTABLE. If the Alarms app cannot find a music file or the SD card is not mounted properly the Alarms app should play a default sound/vibration. Moreover it should not freeze/become unresponsive when trying to modify the details of those alarms.

column6: Milestone UK version 2.0.1 Whenever anything changes in network coverage (hsdpa turning on or off 3g connection being enabled or disabled) the music that is currently playing(using the default player) freezes for a small but noticable amount of time.
