column7: Device used: Motorola Droid Android 2.2 OS Plantronics 925 Bluetooth earpiece Upon using the voice dial feature in the 2.2 OS release by activating the Bluetooth dial function there is no verbal confirmation from the dialer that the correct number is being selected. Refer to the original bug report from issue 1181 (http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=1181)... ----------------snip----------------- 1. Unlock not required. 2. Access the voice dialer via handsfree device (e.g. long press on headset Q"Eanswer buttonQ"E) 3. Aural prompt: Q"ESay a command.Q"E 4. Speak Q"ECall VoicemailQ"E 5. Aural prompt Q"EWould you like to call voicemail?Q"E 6. Speak Q"EYes/NoQ"E 7. Aural prompt Q"Edialing voicemailQ"E Further if the user would like to call their mother the prompt might say Q"EMom has listed home work and mobile. Please select.Q"E In both cases aural prompts and verbal confirmations allows the voice dialer to be a useful functionality. ---------------snip----------------- Steps 5 and 6 listed above are not currently implemented in OS 2.2. In addition aural prompts and verbal confirmations would make the function full-featured and comparable to existing similar applications on other platforms. Without these verbal confirmation features manual intervention can still be needed in cases where the voice recognition erroneously selects the wrong number or if the user makes a mistake. Having to manually intervene in such cases defeats the purpose of the feature which should be a truly hands-free interaction when dialing and driving and is an unsafe practice (and in fact is illegal in several states). This limits the practical use of the function.

column6: Basically time/date in calender changes after event is created with full day selected and then reselecting the event. This only happens if you selected any timezone other than GMT in phone settings. To recreate goto calender. Select menu. Select new event. Type in a name. Select a date. Select full day. Press back to create event. Once back in calender select event again and you will see the event has moved forward or backwards according to the timezone youQ'Eve selected. Hope someone can help. motorola milestone

When editing an event on the deviceQ'Es calendar it is impossible to clear the data in the Event Description or Where fields. Clearing the field can only be done via the web-based calendar. column7: I am using a Motorola Droid with Android 2.0.1 ESD56 an Acer AspireOne D150 with Windows XP Home and a Rocketfish bluetooth adapter. - Steps to reproduce the problem. Pair the phone with a PC On the PC connect the Audio/Voice gateway Observe that the phone will start calling the last dialed number Tap the End button on the phone. On the PC disconnect the Audio/Voice gateway Observe that the phone will start calling the last dialed number - What happened. The phone calls the last dialed number when dis/connecting the Audio Gateway. The first time I paired the phone and enabled the gateway this did not happen. The first time I tried to disconnect I used the Bluetooth Connection Status window (left-click the Bluetooth icon in the system tray and select the Gateway from the list) to disconnect. It did not disconnect but tried to call the last dialed number with every press of the disconnect button. When recreating the problem I selected Disconnect from the context menu in the My Bluetooth Places\Droid window. The the service connected and disconnected properly but still initiated a redial. Incidentally I also noticed that the phone seems to prefer to play sound through the bluetooth connection whether or not an audio connection is enabled. My computer connected data only and Pandora on the phone is silent because audio is being redirected through the bluetooth connection. It was playing through the phone fine a little while ago. - What you think the correct behavior should be. Changing bluetooth settings should not equate to a redial command. Thanks Jim

column6: Device: Motorola DROID Android v2.1 When selecting an image (high res) from the Gallery to use as a Wallpaper the wallpaper image is pixelated / blurry on the home screen. 1. Select image from Gallery to use as Wallpaper. 2. Because the original image size is larger than the DROID screen resolution (in pixels) you are presented with the Q"ESelection BoxQ"E to select a piece of the image. I believe this is where the problem is. Perhaps the image used as the wallpaper is taken from the reduced size (non-original size) image presented on the screen. Because this image is smaller than the screen resolution it must be stretched to be used as the wallpaper. My guess is that this is the same logic used to create the photo frame widget on the home screen. This logic works for the widget but not for the wallpaper. The Wallpaper image should be taken from the original (full size) image in the gallery to maintain a crisp clear picture on the home screen. This was not a problem in 2.0 or 2.0.1.

Device: Moto Droid Carrier: Verizon (always has been) Country / Language: USA/ English OS: Android 2.1 update-1 Build Number: ESE81 PRL Version: 51926 IQ'Eve posted this problem on the forums already here is the text from that post: Q"EBackground info: IQ'Eve had my Moto Droid for almost 2 months now. At this point I called Verizon where the representative walked me through a factory reset. I reluctantly went through with it. It was a major pain to reconfigure and re-sync my phone. As an original Motorola Droid owner I have done extensive tests benchmarking the old Motorola Droid with my new Motorola Droid-X. The Droid-X volume for calls(regular and speakerphone music(speakerphone and headphones)is lower that the original droid. The Motorola Droid-X vibrate mode for incoming calls and notifications is also weaker the the Motorola Droid. Please upgrade the Motorola Droid-X volume and vibrate levels do be equal to or greater than the original Motorola Droid. Not sure if this is a device hareware/fimware update or Android Software update coming with Froyo. Thank you

column8: After I updated my Motorola Droid to Android 2.1 I tried the native web browser to test the pinch to zoom functionality. To my chagrin pinch to zoom does not work on my phone. On all other apps (maps and gallery) pinch to zoom does work. I would appreciate any fixes or suggestions you may have to remedy this issue. Thank you in advance!

column7: IQ'Em not entirely sure if this is a bug but this has been plaguing me since I bought the phone and transferred contacts over. Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. 1. Add a contact named Jeffrey Beumel with a mobile phone number through the phone or as a contact through GMail. 2. Wait for the Google Account (GMail only) to synchronize or force it to synchronize. 3. Contact will disappear eventually. It is hoped that the contact will persist through synchronization. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) Motorola Droid Firmware Version 2.1-update1

column6: Attempts to connect to https://support.skype.com/ produce a Q"ESecurity warning: certificate not from a trusted authorityQ"E warning followed by a Q"EData connectivity problemQ"E error after pressing Continue. I have verified that the root certificate for this site is the Global Sign root CA and that it is present in the cacerts.bks file as a trustedCertEntry. That entry has the same hash as the Skype certificate. The site https://system.globalsign.com/loginpartner_en/loginpartner.do. accessed via the Q"EAccount LoginQ"E link on http://globalsign.com/ is protected with the same certificate and the Droid browser can access it. The Q"EData connectivity problemQ"E error is what I see when connecting to a site I manage which requires client certificates. I suspect an error in the SSL negotiation. The thread at https://supportforums.motorola.com/thread/19222 appears to be related. Some users have had success using Q"EOperaQ"E for these sites; I could not get Opera to function well enough to test this. Android 2.0.1 on Motorola Droid Verizon Wireless Issue occurs with both WiFi and 3G connection

column6: Please describe the problem in detail. Alarm/Snooze Overlap Bug. When 2 or more alarms overlap in their time/snooze period. Succeeding alarms will not sound if previous is in a snoozed state nor is any notification given. Succeeding alarms will sound if previous is dismissed. - Steps to reproduce the problem. Using media station default alarm clock: Set snooze duration to 5 minutes for ease of testing. Set 3 alarms with unique sounds so each is identifiable. Set alarm 1 to a time a few minutes from now. Set alarm 2 to a time 2 minutes later than alarm 1. Set alarm 3 to a time 5 minutes later than alarm 2. - What happened. Allow alarm 1 to sound. Snooze it. Wait for the time alarm 2 is supposed to sound. It will not. Alarm 1 will sounds again this time dismiss it. Wait for the time alarm 3 should sound. It will. - What you think the correct behavior should be. Alarm 2 should sound on time regardless of the snoozed state of alarm 1. Each Alarm should be notified sounded and snoozed independently of all other alarms set in the system. Motorola Droid Firmware 2.0.1 Baseband C_01.3E.01P Kernel 2.6.29-omap1-g0dd7e0b android-build@apa26 #511 Build ESD56

- Steps to reproduce the problem. Under the same contact enter two numbers with the same base number but different extensions pauses waits etc. For example: Work: (123) 456-7890  1234 Work: (123) 456-7890  4321 - What happened. When viewing the contact you only see one of the numbers above. - What you think the correct behavior should be. It should have two different numbers. Using Android 2.1 on a Motorola Droid.

column7: 1. Click on the Q'EappQ'E button (white circle icon on the bottom centre of all phones). 2. Press Q'EsettingsQ'E button (icon: 4 squares with top left square filled in). 3. Click Q'EsearchQ'E. Note that a search bar does come up but this is the generic search which includes apps but indeed it includes everything else. Search should be context based. e.g. if IQ'Em search while in the apps list it should search apps. If IQ'Em in contacts it should search contacts etc etc. Motorola Defy - Android 2.1

Following the 2.2 update to my Motorola Droid the calendar stopped showing some of my Google calendar events from certain shared calendars. For example I have a calendar for my boy scout troop. All the events that were on the calendar prior to the update are missing but events posted after the update show up. Furthermore if I look at my Google calendar from a regular PC or Mac all the events are still there. This is some sort of bug I presume.
As a user views the droid desktop when they tilt the phone to the side the UI does not update to show the side view. Hardware: Motorola Droid Software: Android 2.1 Verizon public release (April 25th)

column8: NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem. I have the original Verizon Motorola Droid. Recently I upgraded my OS to 2.2. In the past if I were to press the magnifying glass to do a search in my contact or other areas of the phone the input field would come up and the keyboard would be immediately enabled. Now when I press the magnifying glass to search for numbers/contats the input field come up and I have to press it to get the keyboard to enable. To me this is a bug because it worked before and it would be intuitive if the keyboard would come up without having to press the input field. Thank you Jerry

column6: I have a motorola droid with Droid 2.0.1 kernel version 2.6.29-omap1- g0dd7e0b android-build@apa26 #511 Every time I try to open up any of my 3 email accounts that are not gmail I receive this error msg Q"EThe application Email (Process com.android.email) has stopped unexpectedly. Please try again.Q"E I also tried and removing one of the accounts but the samething happens also rebooted phone and removed the battery did not resolve. Any ideals on what can resolve this issue??? THanks Chad

column7: On the Motorola Droid the web browser does not seem to display images at their proper resolution. Text in images is usually unreadable and fine details are lost. previously this could be remedied by saving the image and viewing it Gallery but as of the 2.1 update gallery has the same problem. This is especially frustrating since the pinch zoom feature was just added. Also neither Browser nor Gallery will play animated GIFs.

On the Motorola Milestone: If the phone is unable to sync due to syncing being disabled or lack of a connection all the contacts and call log disappear from the phone. As soon as the sync is OK the contacts are loaded again to the phone but not the call log.

PLATFORM: Motorola Defy - Android 2.1 - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Fill a screen (not the home screen - I use the far left screen) on the phone with 4 app icons on the top row then the google search widget (1 x 4) on the second row then the other rows filled up with app icons. 2. Press in the text area of the search widget then as fast as you can press the home key on the phone. 3. Now go back to the far left screen and note that the search widget is now on the too row. - What happened. Normally when the search widget text field is focused (i.e. someone clicks in the text field) the widget correctly floats to the top of the screen and results can then go below it. It seems that due to the fast Q'Ehome keyQ'E press the widget doesnQ'Et have time to put itself back to itQ'Es original position. - What you think the correct behavior should be. The widget should return to itQ'Es original position in this case the second row of the far left screen.

column6: My Motorola Droid is set up to use our companies microsoft exchange server. It will sync email calander and contacts just fine. My issue is with sending email. I can send email to any recipient without difficulty but when sending to other people in our company or even when replying to their email it always ends up in their spam folder. I have researched the problem on the internet and can not find a solution.

column7: I have the Motorola Cliq and one of my biggest issues first stems from there not being an official file browser application on this device. Because of the lack of an official file browser I am unable to search for my pictures/ music etc easily. I have all my files seperated by folders and when I want to compose a message it would be ideal that I can access my memory card and the folders I created to easily find what I want. **side note** when this issue is correct I hope the next feature will allow for us to send an MMS that contains a picture file audio file Q&E text file in one message like most standard phone allow for! I simply hate that i cannot send fun interesting messages from a phone that is so advanced!

Phone: Motorola Droid OS: 2.1 Bluetooth was already somewhat flaky with 2.0.1 firmware and my mercedes C300 nav/multimedia system. There would be issues like not being able to answer incoming calls with the carQ'Es controls disconnected calls loss of bluetooth pairing and being unable to hang up and resume radio/ipod music. With the 2.1 update however things have gotten worse. Now most of the time the phone wonQ'Et even pair up with the carQ'Es system.

column6: I have the original Motorola Droid. I recently Q"EupgradedQ"E to Android 2.2 OS. Ever since the upgrade I have been experiencing multiple problems only one which seems to not have been reported by anyone else as of yet. Since updating to Android 2.2 the quality of the Pandora audio streaming has become TERRIBLE. I have the App set at Q"EHighQ"E quality and it still sounds horrible. I have re-installed the App and the problem still exists. When I switch back and forth between Q"EhighQ"E and Q"EnormalQ"E quality within Pandora there is absolutely no change in the poor quality of the audio playback (App does not re-buffer as it used to with Android 2.1 when switching between quality settings). Not sure what is going on but the audio quality is so crappy with Android 2.2 Pandora that I am very close to throwing my phone in the trash and switching to iPhone.

column8: Phone: Motorola Droid 1 Android Version/Build: 2.2 FRG22D Market Version: 1.82 When using Q"EUpdate AllQ"E apps will randomly hang during download. I have tried several options to remedy: Option 1 (Unsuccessful with major side effects) - 1. Cancel Download Results: App download is canceled Side effects: Force Close of Market when app is redownloaded app does not download Option 2 (Unsuccessful) - 1. Reboot Phone Results: Apps remain in downloading status Option 3 (Unsuccessful) - 1. Navigate to: Menu Q>E Settings Q>E Applications Q>E Manage Applications Q>E All (tab) Q>E Market 2. Clear Cache Results: Apps remain in downloading status Option 3 (Successful with major side effects): 1. Navigate to: Menu Q>E Settings Q>E Applications Q>E Manage Applications Q>E All (tab) Q>E Market 2. Clear Data Results: Apps are no longer hung Side effects: 1. Requires you to accept Market TOCQ'Es again There is a possibly related issue but it was patched before the release of FRG22D: http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=1996

column6: in the suggested word pop-up banner using android keyboard if user scrolls through the list the list will jump upon release. this makes finding then selecting a word in the selection banner very difficult. Motorola Droid 2.0.1

column8: Device: Motorola Droid OS: Android 2.0.1 Steps to reproduce: 1. Turn on Airplane Mode 2. Start any app that requires GPS (Maps or GPS Status) 3. Watch as it searches endlessly for satellites but never finds them. 4. Add the Power Control widget to your home screen observe that it says the GPS is on. Expected results: 1. According to this issue: http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=1163 Airplane Mode does not disable GPS 2. If GPS is disabled it should appear as such to apps and the Power Control widget

column6: In the web interface I have requested access from my personal calendar to my google apps calendar. I accepted the sharing request on my google apps account and now my google apps calendar shows up under the Q"EOther CalendarsQ"E in my personal calendar. I tried doing a reboot and forced sync in my google calendar app on my Motorola Droid (Android 2.0.1) and it still doesnQ'Et show up for viewing or editing. I added the google labs weather calendar to my personal calendar and it lists Q"EweatherQ"E under the other calendars portion on the web UI. The weather calendar syncs correctly to my Droid but still no google apps calendar. IQ'Eve seen a couple other bug posts on this but they look like they were for slightly different senarios and their resolution didnQ'Et fix the problem IQ'Em experiencing. Any ideas?

I have a Motorola Droid running 2.0.1. For some reason the lockscreen combination changes itself seemingly randomly. It changes itself to the same thing both times it happened and appears to only happen when I use a specific combo using every dot.

column7: Using Android 2.0.1 on a Motorola Milestone I can only select the USB device type (Motorola Phone Synchronize with Windows Media SD card access None) when the device is physically connected to an USB port. While this does not actualle impose a problem in a home environment it would be handy to pre-select the USB type or to verify its status in a business environment where connecting USB devices to hardware is not permitted. Should be fairly easy to add a menu item (e.g. in the WirelessQ&ENetworks section). Kind regards Dominik

column6: I have a motorola droid and a droid x. Motorola droid is running 2.2.1 and the droid x is running 2.2.1 Both droid phones have problems when accessing a wireless hotspot that redirects the http request to an aruba wireless controller using the private ip address of 172.16.23.1 The certificateQ'Es common name is 172.16.23.1. Both phones have the follwoing certificate error: There are problems with the security certificate for this site. The name of the site does not match the name of the certificate. I have tried accessing the hotspot with an ipad blackberry torch hp elite and Dell inspirion and all of them work without producing any certificate errors. It seems to be the android os that is not handling the certificates correctly. NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

I am running Android 2.0.1 on a Motorola Droid. I am currently having two problems related to the same calendar. This is a calendar I have subscribed to using calendar.google.com through Q"EAdd by URLQ"E. This calendar correctly shows up through the web interface. However on my Droid I am having the following two problems: 1) Events past January 2nd do not show up on the phone. 2) The name of this calendar under Q"EMy CalendarsQ"E shows up as Q"Eus86350583fs4l0ng7frnjaguomqtueu@import.calendar.google.comQ"E rather than the actual name of the calendar. I have tried un-checking and then re-checking this calendar as well as forcing a Q"ESync NowQ"E under the accounts settings.

Tested this case on Android2.2 with Motorola Blur phone. - Steps to reproduce the problem (including sample code if appropriate). 1. Setup a Blur account that includes a Google account. 2. Navigate to the Main Menu and launch the YouTube application. 3. Select Main Menu Q>E My Account. 4. Select your Google account from Q"EYouTube AccountsQ"E prompt or enter another YouTube account. - What happened. The device freezes and the user can only exit by pressing the home key. The user is never able to successfully log into their You Tube account. - What you think the correct behavior should be. User will have no issues logging into a YouTube account in the YouTube application. ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ - Root cause: In short in this case we have two entries in the account database with the same email addresses but with two different types: Q"Ecom.motorola.blur.service.bsutils.MOTHER_USER_CREDS_TYPEQ"E Q"Ecom.googleQ"E. The blur entry is stored in the database first. When the Youtube appQ'Es GlsLoginActivity activity wants to authenticate the user it queries the db for all account types instead of the Q"Ecom.googleQ"E type only. Consequently it matches Blur entry in the database since email addresses are the same and it fails blocking the Youtube app that is under the transparent GlsLoginActivity without producing any error messages or popups. You tube app fails here on two levels. It does not query the DB correctly for Q"Ecom.googleQ"E account type only and it does not handle the authentication failure gracefully. The issue is that Google for some reason thinks that google is the primary account. Need youtube fix. For more details please check the logs attached.

column7: - Steps to reproduce the problem: Slide out the physical keyboard. Then long-press the capacitive search key while in any app or on the home screen. - What happened: Nothing happens as long as contact with the capacitive search key is maintained. As soon as I remove my finger a search box (either the Google search box or application-specific search box as applicable) pops up. These are the same search boxes that pop up from a short tap on the capacitive search key. - What you think the correct behavior should be: The long-press of the capacitive search key with the physical keyboard open should register and perform the same action that happens when I long- press the capacitive search key with the physical keyboard closed. (Usually this will activate Google Voice search but can be whatever the user has configured a search key long-press to do.) Additionally it would be nice if a long-press of the hardware keyboard search key registered the same as a long-press of the capacitive search key. This is on a Motorola Droid running the 2.1-update1 OS. However IQ'Eve observed this behavior prior to the 2.1 update -- I just havenQ'Et gotten around to reporting it until now.

Support for the html5 audio element appears to be broken in the default webkit browser in android 2.1. The browser neither manages to create an audio element nor display the text between the audio tags. I have tested 7 common audio formats and my test page runs fine on an iphone as well as desktop browsers. I have personally tested with an htc desire running android 2.1 (update 1 with webkit 3.1). Other users have reported same behaviour on htc hero (running custom 2.1) and Motorola Droid. To reproduce point the browser to this webpage: http://textopia.org/androidsoundformats.html The webpage should display the names of 7 common soundformats followed by audio players/play-buttons for each soundfile - or if the audio element is not supported a text that states this should be displayed instead (the text between the audio tags). The latter is done correctly in android 1.6. More details of my testing: http://textopiablog.wordpress.com/2010/06/25/browser-support-for-html5-audio/ I discussed this on stackoverflow before reporting the bug: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3100706/what-audio-formats-are-supported-by-the-android-browser

Enable auto-replace: 1.1. Open the Settings app. 1.2. Navigate to Languages Q&E Keyboard -Q>E Device keyboard. 1.3. Enable Q"EAuto-replaceQ"E. 2. Find a convenient text box. 3. Type the characters Q"EL-E-T-S-Q<EspaceQ>EQ"E. Observe that the word Q"EletsQ"E is changed to Q"EletQ'EsQ"E. 4. Type the characters Q"EQ<EshiftQ>EI-Q<EshiftQ>EM-Q<EspaceQ>EQ"E. Observe that the acronym Q"EIMQ"E is changed to Q"EIQ'EMQ"E. Expected behavior: Q"EletsQ"E and Q"EletQ'EsQ"E should not be auto-corrected as they are distinct words. For example: - LetQ'Es go to the movies. - That key lets you open the safe. Q"EIMQ"E should not be auto-corrected (but Q"EimQ"E probably should be). For example: - IQ'Ell IM you later. - im going to the store. (=Q>E IQ'Em going to the store.)

If you could please start to think of these things and make the device simply do what makes sense your phones would really spank the iPhone. Btw IQ'Em on a Motorola Droid Android 2.2.

column6: I have over 3700 Contacts and over 300 of these records are hiding from view or searching. After working on this for weeks I believe I have narrowed down the exact problem. I believe this must affect many people although they may not realize it at first. According to Motorola Level 3 Tech Support this is a problem with the Android operating system. Here is how the bug works as far as I understand it: BTW I have already used the excellant feature on Google to Find Duplicate Contacts and Merge them. The problem is on the phone in my case on the Droid. On the Droid (apparently all Android phones?) it finds all records which have a common tel number and arbitrarily will only display one of them. (No one can accurately tell me which one it chooses to display BTW.) The ones which are hidden from display do not show up in any searches. Try this: Create two Contacts say for Joe and Mary with the same work tel for both but give them each a different mobile tel. (a realistic example). Create the contacts in Gmail not on the Droid in case it makes a difference. (All of my contacts were initially on Gmail and then synced onto the Droid.) Now go to the Droid and try to search for Joe. Now try to search for Mary. I believe you will find one but not the other. Big problem! HereQ'Es another anomoly -- whichever one is missing now go to Gmail and look up the mobile tel for the one which was hidden on the Droid. Now manually dial the mobile tel on the Droid for the one which the Droid could not find when you searched. Surprise -- the name will pop up when it dials the number -- proving that the Contact is indeed on the Droid but it is hidden. Now Motorola is calling this some kind of Q"EmergingQ"E but I would call it instead Q"EhidingQ"E because the records are there and can be found individually by the Droid except when we (as users) are looking for them. Arghhh. Help! Major problem.

column7: I am using a Microsoft Exchange 2007 server and we have 5 Motorola Droids on our network (All are updated to the 2.1Update1). The phones are synced to download 1 week of email messages. Two of our phones have on three separate occasions lost their corporate email settings. One phone was replaced and still has the problem. Phone number 1: When clicking on the Email icon the phone goes to just a blank screen with the task and notification bar at the top. If I go to account settings and attempt to look at the specific email account settings the screen goes blank again. This is fixed by removing the corporate email account restarting the phone and adding the account settings over again. It has happened twice on this phone within a three week period. Phone number 2: When clicking on the email icon the goes to the corporate email inbox list. All the messages for the last week show up. If you attempt to click on an individual message a force close of the email app occurs. The only way I have found to fix this was resetting the phone to factory settings and re-entering the account settings for the email account in question. The other three Droid phones have not had any problems with Email.

column7: Motorola Droid 2.1. Google account. Create a new event say a birthday. Enter a year before 1970 for the start time. Calendar syncing considers the date out of range. column14: - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Find a phone with NO data plan or alternately drop a GSM chip from an account with no data plan into an Android phone. IQ'Em on T-Mobile with 3G disabled but it still connects to 2G and T-Mobile just drops packets (or redirects them to a Q"EYou have the wrong plan!Q"E web page). I canQ'Et verify whether ATQ&ET behaves the same without a data plan -- some carriers give you data anyway and just charge you for it. 2. Ensure that wifi is not picking up a valid signal [See IMPORTANT note below about my wifi] 3. Enter events into the calendar on the phone. I did not make any changes to my online calendar over the course of the entire test. 4. Wait (on the order of hours but always by the next day). 5. Check the calendar entries. - What happened. Any that you entered while offline will be gone though previously syncQ'Eed appointments will still be there. IQ'Eve reproduced this many times now. - What you think the correct behavior should be. Calendar should never under any circumstances lose events youQ'Eve entered on the phone. This is a CRITICAL bug -- I rely on calendar to remind me when I have important appointments and have already been late for an important meeting as a result of this. Obviously now that I know about it IQ'Em more careful but I expect more of a Google product. - DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) I have a Motorola Milestone with 2.1-update1 kernel 2.6.29-omap1 milestcm@il93lnxgbld04 #1 - If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem. WHY does adb bugreport redirect-to-file not work?! Grr. OK piping through grep makes it work. ThatQ'Es insane but done. IMPORTANT NOTE on wifi situation: For a long time I had a wifi router that the Milestone would connect to but somehow the connection would shortly get into a bad state. It may have been trying repeatedly to sync over the network and after X attempts the failure case ends up wiping out the new data. If you connect your phone to a wifi router that has no Internet that MAY allow you to reproduce the issue. Failing that my router is an ASUS WL500W and it pretty reliably fails to talk to my Milestone (as well as some computers). IQ'Em thinking that the exact point that the communication with the router fails may be your bug and that it could be failing at a different point with my annoying router. It could simply be crashing and losing data; I did verify that it seems to be correctly saving its state though. I tried going into calendar entering events exiting calendar killing it with a task manager and re-running and the events at that point are still present though they will then disappear later. The failure also seems to happen when I enter an appointment away from the router but I havenQ'Et been able to entirely eliminate the bad router as the trigger because I usually leave wifi enabled and eventually would come home and be within range of the bad router. At this point I sync to a different router at home so IQ'Em hoping that the problem goes away entirely; IQ'Ell post a follow-up if it fails when I enter a task out of range of the wifi and it loses it on syncing later or if it loses a task while connected to the Q"EbetterQ"E router. Another possible failure mode IQ'Eve considered is that it eventually DOES sync with the online calendar but somehow the time-stamps are confused and it thinks that the state of the online calendar is newer than the state of the phone calendar. Depending on the internal architecture that may or may not be relevant.

On my Motorola Droid (version 2.0.1) I frequently get Q"EEnterprise ErrorsQ"E or Q"EParnership ErrorsQ"E when the corporate calendar tries to sync. When you go to the notification it says you must resync your calendar. If you say Q"EOKQ"E you end up with duplicate entries in the calendar. If you answer with Q"ECancelQ"E the calendar completely stops syncing. There is a workaround posted here: http://www.google.com/support/forum/p/Google+Mobile/thread?tid=4e4beb756baf5477Q&Ehl=en The solution being to go to the phone settings -Q>E applications -Q>E manage applications -Q>E menu filter all -Q>E scroll down to Corporate Calendar -Q>E clear data. You then can go back into the corporate calendar app and the calendar will resync. I happened to be using the trial version of mNotes Wireless but others have seen the same issue with other Activesync Exchange Server solutions. The workaround is a tedious fix but is better than deleting and re-creating the account.

column7: The strength of the vibration for SMS on my Motorola Droid is so weak that I miss them altogether most of the time. With other phones IQ'Eve had I could definitely feel the vibe if it was in my pocket and could even hear it across the room if it was in my purse and there wasnQ'Et a lot of ambient noise. I have read the same concern in various forums around the web. I know that there are apps that allow me to set the duration pattern and repeat of the vibrate function. But I need something that makes the phone vibrate more strongly. I am self employed and receive job offers via SMS. I have to jump on them; they are being offered to several people at once. If I miss a few SMSes a week it can literally cost me hundreds of dollars. One issue that was raised with this shortcoming is that it limits usefulness of the phone for deaf consumers. I saw that there is an open issue here for vibrate concerns by deaf but it didnQ'Et address this strength issue in quite the same way. Nevertheless itQ'Es an accessibility issue. Please consider beefing up that vibration. ItQ'Es costing me money!

Steps to repro/what happened: - Place a call - Press the Q"EAdd CallQ"E button - Dial # or select a contact from the call log or contact list - The call is immediate added to a conference - There is no option to place the 1st caller on Hold. - Also there is no option to gracefully disconnect either call without ending the entire conference. - There is no way to visually distinguish whom you are on the phone with without verbal confirmation from the other party. - The calls are already in an implicit merge even though Q"EMerge CallsQ"E was not pressed. - Even after pressing Q"EMerge CallsQ"E pressing Q"EManage CallsQ"E does nothing to swap calls. Expected behavior: - The second call should have remained private until I selected the option to Q"EMerge CallQ"E - When you are on a 3 party call that you initiated from the Android phone you should have an option to separate each party and manage each party individually. - Each contact or call should be visually separate and not just display the Q"EIn CallQ"E icon which tells you nothing about whom you are on the phone with. - A hold button needs to be added - When you place the caller on hold and come back the initial contact picture or number dials needs to come back (the original state of the call). - When in a 3-way conference the call initiator needs to be able to make either of the calls private under the Q"EManage CallsQ"E option. Device Details: Motorola Droid Android v2.0.1

column9: I recently purchased a Motorola Droid phone from Verizon and found that the Voice Dialing/Command activation from the Bluetooth headset is not enabled. In Arizona it is illegal to dial a phone while driving. This is not a safe practice in the first place. I have a Bluetooth headset from Plantronics that worked with my five year old Motorola Razor but does not work the same with my Q"ESmartPhoneQ"E. Will this feature be provided in the next release or as a patch? If so has a date been established for this addition?

Expected Result: The Q"EbackQ"E hard key either: 1. closes the music player app or 2. takes the user back to the main library of the music player. Motorola Droid 2.1 also confirmed on Nexus One 2.1

column6: I have had a Motorola Droid. I switched to a Palm Pre pending the fix of this very serious bug. Randomly a sent text message would go to the wrong open conversation. For example I sent a message to Contact A. Contact B whom also has an open conversation thread receives the message. Contact A does not receive the message. This occurred at least 5 times that I knew of over the course of 2 months. I could find not pattern of steps to repeat it it seemed at random. I am using the Motorola Droid with Android 2.2 (Froyo). I have encountered a problem many times since installing Android 2.2 regarding SMS text messaging. The problem is described as follows. My SMS text messages are being sent to the wrong recipients. If I have multiple text threads in my messaging screen which I have not deleted yet this is when i experience the problem. I also experience the problem if there are calls in my call log. For example; if I have 2 text threads on my messaging screen I will click on Jon but when the thread opens up it will actually show Harry at the top. If I am not paying close attention I will end up sending the text to the wrong person. Numerous times I have made sure to click on the name Q'EJonQ'E and still the other text thread labeled Q'EHarryQ'E opens up. The only time that I do not encounter this problem is when there are no other text threads on my messaging screen besides the one person that I am currently texting. A similar problem to the above is as follows. If i have my friend Harry in my call log and i open up my messaging screen to text my other friend Jon the text will send to Jon on the screen but it actually sends to Harry whom is in my call log. For example I send Jon a text saying Q"EHow are you?Q"E. The text will show as sent to Jon on my screen but I will get a reply from Harry saying Q"EIQ'Em doing fine thankyou.Q"E The only way I have found to prevent this problem from occuring is to make sure that my call log is always deleted and empty. Both of the above problems are very serious to any Android user and I have had the same complaints from at least 10 of my other co-workers who use Android 2.2 on the Mororola Droid. These other users also complain about their text messages being sent to people whom are inside of their call log instead of the person that it was intended to send to within their messaging thread. These users also have mentioned that they experience the problem in which when they clock on a persons name to text message them a different thread will open up. I know through experience that I am not the only person experiencing this problem and that it is not my Motorola droid malfunctioning because myself and my co-workers never had these problems with Android 2.1 . The correct behavior should be as follows. When multiple text threads are on your messaging screen the text thread that you click on should always open instead of another thread opening up. As for the second problem when a user has multiple calls within their call log and the user texts one of their recipients a person within the users call log should not recieve the text instead of the person that the text was sent to inside of the messaging thread. Best of luck to all of the men and women developing Android. I hope to see the above problems resolved soon as they are potentially dangerous problems to all Android users.

column7: When I use Navigation on my Droid phone and the GPS signal is lost the GPS function basically stops working until its signal can be reacquired. This becomes a significant issue when in a tunnel or under some other kind of covering for an extended period of time. What Q"Eshould happenQ"E and what IQ'Ed ask to please appear in a system update in the near future is for the device to Q"EprojectQ"E current location and direction based on where it last lost its signal and how the vehicle has been travelling since then. (I understand that some GPS devices already do this.) Once a signal is reacquired it could then recalculate the actual location and continue from there but the use of an estimated location and direction as discussed here would make the GPS function much more effective for users instead of having it basically shut down in the meantime. Thanks! Phone: Motorola Droid Android Version: 2.0.1

I apologize if this has already been addressed but I couldnQ'Et find a post with this problem. All of the images that IQ'Eve taken on this phone seem to have the wrong time stamp. The date and time in the Q"EtitleQ"E field are correct but the time in Q"ETaken onQ"E field is off. For example a picture taken at sunset will have the time 12:33 PM (I remember being at work at that time...). This occurred when I had 2.0.1 and after I updated to 2.1-update1 - Steps to reproduce the problem. Open GalleryQ>E Select any pictureQ>E Select MenuQ>EMoreQ>EDetails. - What happened. Time in Q"ETaken OnQ"E field is off by several hours.Q"E - What you think the correct behavior should be. The time in the Q"ETaken onQ"E field should match the actual time the photo is taken. Device: Motorola Droid Version: 2.1-update1

Phone: Motorola Droid OS: 2.1 (but this happens on 2.0.1 and 2.0) I stumbled upon this by mistake and I think it needs to be looked into. I downloaded the free Weather Widget app from the Android market. Like most people I loved it and I wanted to buy the full version for the clock and skins support. I use ASTRO file manager to backup my APKQ'Es and other data on the phone. When I installed the paid version of Weather Widget I wanted to remove the free version. When I went into the application management tool the free version and the paid version where both named the same so there was a 50/50 chance I would delete the paid one instead of the free one. I backed up both APKs with ASTROQ'Es backup manager and then preceded to remove one of the apps. I picked the paid version. I then removed the free version so that I had no trace of the Widget on the phone other than the backups. I installed the full version back on my phone using ASTROs restore feature and I was back in business. I had my full version of my clock and I was happy. Now for the bug because Google saw that I removed the app they refunded my money latter that day. So now I had he paid version of the Weather Widget for free. I let it go for a day or two just to see if they would re- charge me after I installed some new skins but it never happened. There was an update to the app and when I installed the update Google charged me for the app again. So I am on the level with paying for the app but this process can be done with any app. IQ'Em not really sure how this could be fixed. The most logical thought I have is to implement some kind of lib in the SDK that would allow a developer to have the app check with Google Checkout to see if the app is paid for. I did not search to see if this was a known bug so I apologize if this is a duplicate post of some sort.

Steps to reproduce: 1. Open any program that uses a lot of memory (in this case the browser) 2. Use a lot of memory i.e. open a lot of stuff in new tabs 3. Switch to a different application (Say you received an SMS or IM and want to answer) 4. Switch back to the browser The problem: When you reopen the browser one of two things happens: a) The browser opens the home page all tabs/windows are closed and lost. b) The browser insists on reloading each page when you switch to it (this sometimes even happens within the browser just from switching between windows/tabs). Obviously scenario A is the more horrible of the two scenarios as all the tabs youQ'Eve just opened (say a bunch of links from forum notification E-Mails that you were going to read) are completely and utterly gone. This behaviour is not specific to the browser and happens with many other applications (native Android applications as well as third-party apps). Expected correct behaviour: Save the state before killing an application so that the state isnQ'Et lost when the app is killed. Frankly itQ'Es a little baffling that this doesnQ'Et work yet... Phone info: Motorola Milestone bought from O2 Germany running Android 2.1-update1 build number SHOLS_U2_02.34.0 non-rooted.

Android 2.1+ Motorola Droid Verizon Wireless There are multiple threads both here and at MotorolaQ'Es Droid forum of people requesting this feature (which appearently was initially present but subsequently lost sometime after the initial release in November) https://supportforums.motorola.com/thread/16334?start=0Q&Etstart=0 https://supportforums.motorola.com/thread/19000 ID 2606 ID 2843 ID 3088 ID 3089 ID 4555 ID 4712 ID 5096 ID 5193 ID 5195 and now 5195 which was opened as an enhancement request has been closed for Q"Eworking as intendedQ"E. How can an enhancement be working as intended if it was never even remotely implemented? Screens that do not currently auto-rotate include but may not be limited to: LOCK HOME CONTACTS PHONE (would be usefull when in dock) CALL LOG (would be usefull when in dock) FAVORITES (would be usefull when in dock) INCOMING CALL (would be usefull when in dock) CALL IN PROGRESS (would be usefull when in dock) Please listen to your users who have clearly identified an opportunity to improve the Android user interface. Please Please Please add this to the list of things that the Iphone canQ'Et... but the DROID DOES!

column4: SMS subsistem error sends Q"EgarbageQ"E instead of accentuation of spanish special characters
column5: My phone itQ'Es a Samsung Nexus S (i9023) Android version itQ'Es Gingerbread 2.3.4 base band version I9023XD kernel version 2.6.35.7-ge282d80 android-build@apa28 #1 IMEI: 355921041216712 ItQ'Es been happening since I got this phone in Spain. But I live in Argentina IQ'Em using Movistar (Telef?nica) as a cell provider and I notice most of my sms doesnQ'Et arrive ok to the recipients... I`m not talking about MMS just plain and simple SMS. When this fail happens the sms show a big black bar over the words of the message instead of text letters etc you see just a black bar... IQ'Em attaching you a photo of a Motorola V3i that I owe itQ'Es not just this phone itQ'Es happens in a great number of my friendQ'Es phones too differents brands models and technologies. Testing and investigating a little bit I found that this happens mostly when I use the accentuation letters of the spanish language (my language) meaning the letters: Q"E?Q"E Q"E?Q"E Q"E?Q"E Q"E?Q"E Q"E?Q"E or the Q"EspecialQ"E letters Q"E?Q"E Q"E?Q"E and de Q"E?Q"E o r Q"E?Q"E. IQ'Eve look around in forums and some people have the same fails. Some says itQ'Es an accentuation issue some others said itQ'Es a problem of Q"ElenghQ"E o the sms that when your sms passes the 160 character limit Android fails in Q"EchoppingQ"E the sms in two or more messages. I donQ'Et know for me itQ'Es the accentuation issue. I hope you guys can check it out because itQ'Es a really frustranting when people show you in their phoners that your message it?s unintelligible itQ'Es just big black bar instead of text... Thank you very much please if you read this or find a solution please sent a email to jbsastre@gmail.com Juan B. Sastre Argentina Cell: +54 92954 575012

column9: on 2 seperate Motorola Droid phones I am coming up with an incorrect answer to a calculation using the stock android calculator in the problem 592.17-518.69 i am coming up with a solution of 73.47999999 (repeating) this is obviously an error as there should be no repeating decimal solution to any subtraction or addition problem that does not start with a repeating decimal.

column12: Steps to reproduce: 1. Have a gmail account import from multiple accounts. Set default email address to one of these other accounts. 2. Compose or reply to a mail from the android app with care to set the Q"EFromQ"E field to anything but the default address. What happened: After sending if you open the email in the sent mail folder you will see that it has been sent from the default address even though you did not specify that address. Correct behavior: The email should been sent from whatever address had been selected rather than using the default address every time. Device: Motorola Droid gen 1 build 2.2.2

column4: Q"Ecom.google.process.gappsQ"E occur native crash in monkey test
Spinner.onClick() is called on 2.2 device not called on 3.0 device
column5: Developing using Android SDK 2.2 --------------------------------------------------------------------- public class MainActivity extends Activity { @Override public void onCreate(Bundle icicle) { super.onCreate(icicle); AbsoluteLayout layout = new AbsoluteLayout(this); setContentView(layout); MySpinner spinner = new MySpinner(this); spinner.setAdapter(new ArrayAdapter(this R.layout.simple_spinner_item new Object[]{Q"EabcQ"E Q"EdefQ"E Q"EghiQ"E})); AbsoluteLayout.LayoutParams params = new AbsoluteLayout.LayoutParams(200 50 50 50); layout.addView(spinner params); } private class MySpinner extends Spinner { private MySpinner(Context context) { super(context); } @Override public void onClick(DialogInterface dialog int which) { super.onClick(dialog which); } } } --------------------------------------------------------------------- onClick() is called as per SDK documentation when the user makes their selection on the spinner dialog. Working fine on Android 2.2 device - specifically HTC Desire HD. The exact same code (compiled for both tests on Android SDK 2.2) running on Android 3.0 device - specifically Motorola XOOM does not call onClick(). I believe that the correct behavior should be for onClick() to be called on 3.0 device as it does on 2.2 device.

column18: Hi I have a Motorola Defy with Android 2.2.1. Since IQ'Eve updated it from 2.1 to 2.2 version the Google Maps/Latitude freezes the phone after 1 or 2 days without turn it off. I realize that the problem is related with Latitude when it tries to find my contacts in the map. The processing goes to 100% after that and then the only solution is to turn the device off (I can kill the process but the phone but the phone wont work fine again). Usually I let my GPS turned off too. I suspect that the problem is related with the integration between the GPS hardware and Latitude. Thank you. Eduardo Alevi +55 11 8302-2236 eduardo.alevi@gmail.com

column5: Market: Q"EUpdate allQ"E slows device with simultaneous downloads
column6: The Q"EUpdate allQ"E feature of Market causes all applicable updates to download at the same time. The simultaneous downloads consume all available (3G) network bandwidth and the simultaneous installations cause the OS interface to become unusable. Some downloads will fail possibly because the network connections are starved and time out. Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Wait for a dozen or so apps to have updates available. 2. Select Q"EUpdate allQ"E in Market. What happened: Many downloads were started within a few seconds. The notification list showed a flurry of new updates. The device became very slow to respond to clicks and drags. Market became unresponsive. Several updates failed. Normal responsiveness returned after a few minutes. What I think the correct behavior should be: Market should serialize (queue) the downloads so only one update is downloading at a time. Market should also serialize the installations so only one update is installing at a time. Updates should also be serialized when manual updates are performed in succession. The behavior could be user-configurable so that faster devices are not unnecessarily restricted. The options might be: - Download multiple updates simultaneously: [ ] Always. [ ] Wi-Fi only. [ ] Never. - Install multiple updates simultaneously: [ ] Always. [ ] Never. Device: Motorola Droid Android: 2.2.2 FRG83G

column14: When phones get wet in the rain the touch screen is useless but hardware keyboards (such as on the Motorola Droid series) are still usable. Several people have expressed an interest in an app that would detect when the touchscreen is wet and disable it while still letting them type. Presumably theyQ'Ed open a text editor or email compose window before stepping outside type a message while on their way somewhere and come inside and dry off the screen when theyQ'Ere done. Autodetecting that the touch screen is wet isnQ'Et really necessary since they can just press a hardware hotkey; but the problem is at present there is no way to disable the touchscreen without also disabling the hardware keyboard. So itQ'Ed be nice to have an API which a background service could use to disable and re-enable the touch screen. A more general API which intercepts touches and can cancel them would also be sufficient.

column5: Q"EgQ"E letter typed from ANY page immediately opens gmail!!!!!
column6: Android 2.2 on Motorola. LOTS of problems things worse than the 1.5 android I had on my old Motorola and it had lots of problems. Today: I try to text: Angela when I type the Q"EgQ"E suddenly IQ'Em shunted to my inbox; tried again same result; typed only the letter Q"EgQ"E on the address line of a text same result. Experimenting I find the only way to phone or text anyone with a Q"EgQ"E in their name is to scroll thru the address book open their name and click either call or text from inside their contact info!!!!!! (Remember the more exclamation points the angrier the user) Since IQ'Eve had this phone: opening text messages donQ'Et go to the current message but open about 2 messages back and I have to scroll down to read the most current. Same problem with the calendar: It never opens to the current day but 2-3 days past. If I make an appointment the default day that shows up is 2 days PAST. !!!!!!!!!!! Only phone/organizer (IQ'Eve been totally electronic for calendar and contacts since 1984) IQ'Eve ever seen that had no option for a repeat event Q"Eevery 2 weeksQ"E. Are your programmers really ignorant of the fact that the 1st and 3rd day of every month does not equal every two weeks? Only phone/organizer IQ'Eve ever seen that has no option for an end date on a repeated option!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (see above). For example; I was recently given medication I have to take 3x daily for 3 days then wait 11 days and repeat for 3 months. Because of your asinine programming I had to put EACH ONE IN SEPARATELY. If I put it in and told it to repeat then went to the 4th day and told it to delete Q"Ethis and future eventsQ"E it alternated between deleting just one event or deleting ALL THE EVENTS. New to Android 2.2: I re-download ringtones (they did not move from my old phone!!!!!)and find that in Android 2.2 they can only be used for ringtones! I canQ'Et have the sound I choose notify me of a text email or appointment. I can only use them as phone rings or alarms. I donQ'Et have the option to have my appointment notifications Q"Ering until closedQ"E. It rings ONCE!!!!!!! Bad enough it can only be the innocuous vacuous sounds that come with the phone if I leave my purse at my desk and talk to a colleague or visit the restroom I miss the notice!!!!!!!!!!!!! If someone doesnQ'Et want to have it ring multiple times fine but donQ'Et force that choice on those of us who do. Google went public with the Business Mission Statement of Q"EDonQ'Et Be EvilQ"E and then immediately began behaving exactly like Microsoft; the prime example of evil behavior in the software world. DonQ'Et put it out until itQ'Es ready. The only reason to do so is greed and that automatically means youQ'Ere evil. Buggy. Terrible. Designed poorly. IQ'Eve been Google since Google started and I feel youQ'Ere trying to force me to Q"EI-phoneQ"E

column18: - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1.Go to Settings-Q>EWireless Q&E networks-Q>EVPN settings-Q>EAdd VPN Add a L2TP/IPSec PSK VPN fill VPN name VPN server and most important IPSec pre-shared key. 2.Save the vpn setting and enter a password for credential storage when prompt. 3.Turn off and on (COLD BOOT) your device. 4.Go to Settings-Q>EWireless Q&E networks-Q>EVPN settings-Q>EVPNs list and tap the VPN just added. 5.When prompt enter the password for credential storage and tap OK. - What happened. A dialog of title Q'ESorry!Q'E showed up saying Q'EThe application Settings (process com.android.settings) has stopped unexpectedly. Please try again.Q'E with Q'EForce closeQ'E and Q'EReportQ'E. - What you think the correct behavior should be. A dialog that ask for VPN password shows up instead the Sorry! one. Motorola XOOM HMJ37 Honeycomb 3.1

column17: I have tried to connect to a server running on port 65535 which is a valid TCP/IP port. The server is reachable from a Windows 7 desktop and from my 2.2/Froyo based android phone. It is running https with a self-signed certificate so I have installed the certificate on both windows and both my phone and Xoom honeycomb tablet. The Honeycomb browser displays an error when connecting to the server which is online. Steps to reproduce: 1. Connect to a SSL Socket on port 65535 on a desktop computer (I used IE 9 and Firefox 3.6.10 running on Windows 7 for this step). This shows that the server you chose is online. 2. Connect to same server using the browser on an Android 2.2 phone. Again the server responds. 3. Connect using the browser on Honeycomb tablet (Motorola Xoom). Honeycomb displays its standard error message indicating that Q"EThe webpage at %s might be temporarily down...Q"E 4. Another connection to the same web site on the desktop or phone shows that both the Desktop OS and browser and the Android 2.2 phone have no problems connecting to tht port. Only Honeycomb does...Therefore bug since %s is not the site I visited!

(Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) ***Motorola Backflip version 2.2 update 1 If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

Open http://forum.xda-developers.com/ with stock browser. The scrolling and pinch zoom is very choppy. Open some link in another tab and try to close the newly opened tab. Either it takes a long time to close that tab and return to the previous page or the browser just freezes and force closes. Looks like the browser hardware acceleration and partial rendering is not implemented very well to handle large web pages. Another good website to test browser interaction performance is www.cnbeta.com. IQ'Em on honeycomb with Motorola Xoom.

column11: Motorola Xoom (WiFi) Honeycomb 3.1 (stock) After updating to 3.1 web fonts no longer load through CSS/Font-face. Previous to the update the following worked fine in Honeycomb: @font-face { font-family: Q'EPictosQ'E; src: url(Q'Epictos-web.eotQ'E); src: url(Q'Epictos-web.woffQ'E) format(Q'EwoffQ'E) url(Q'Epictos-web.ttfQ'E) format(Q'EtruetypeQ'E) url(Q'Epictos-web.svg#webfontIyfZbseFQ'E) format(Q'EsvgQ'E); font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; } Now the Q"EPictosQ"E fonts will not load; the default fall-back font is shown instead. This issue does not occur on either an Android phone running 2.2 or Honeycomb 3.0.1 it is unique to 3.1.

column6: If an app containing an enabled input method is moved to the SD card the input method will be disabled after every reboot
column7: This has been reproduced on multiple devices including an HTC EVO 4G running stock Froyo and a Motorola Droid running CyanogenMod 7. ItQ'Es true for every input method whose app lets you move it to the SD card that IQ'Eve tried so far including LastPass AnySoftKeyboard and Tiny Password. Steps to reproduce are simple: 1) Install LastPass from Android Market 2) Move LastPass to the SD card. 3) Reboot the phone. 4) Enable the LastPass input method in Language Q&E keyboard settings. 5) Reboot the phone again. 6) Notice that the LastPass input method is no longer enabled.

column9: Unable to capture screen shot of device screens. Your phone does not appear to be rooted or has not been given root priveleges. To use this application please provide root privileges to this application. Please do not rate this application poorly because of this. This is a limitation that your phone manufacturer placed on your device and not due to any deficiencies in the app itself.Q"E I was able to download and use the same exact application on a Motorla Atrix 4G without having any such issue. Device information as follows: Does not work on: Device: HTC Inspire 4G Software version: 2.3.3 Works on: Motorola Atrix 4G Software version: 2.3.4 Neither phone is rooted.

column4: Android DownloadManager Downloads Same File Twice Fails on Others (Error 1008 ERROR_CANNOT_RESUME)
column5: NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Im trying to use AndroidQ'Es DownloadManager available since SDK 2.3 to download large batches of (hundreds of) jpgs mp3s and other media. IQ'Em developing on an Android 3.1 Samsung Galaxy Tab ( 3.1 rooted) Model: GT-P7510 Kernel 2.6.36.3  an Acer Iconia Tab Version:3.1 Model: A500 Kernel: 2.6.36.3 and a Motorola Xoom wifi Version:3.1 Kernel: 2.6.36.3. However IQ'Em consistently running into an issue where the DownloadManager attempts to download requests twice. It almost always requests the first requested file twice and very often the others twice. Unfortunately I canQ'Et be more specific as itQ'Es fairly unpredictable. On top of that it fails to download requests about half the time caused by ERROR_CANNOT_RESUME (1008) codes from DownloadManager. The end result is some files are downloaded twice: directory/example_image.jpg directory/example_image-1.jpg Some are downloaded once: directory/example_sound.mp3 And some are not downloaded at all. Xoom logcat 07-12 15:43:33.440: INFO/DownloadManager(3950): Initiating request for download 1341 07-12 15:43:35.930: INFO/DownloadManager(3950): Initiating request for download 1341 07-12 15:43:35.940: WARN/DownloadManager(3950): Aborting request for download 1341: Trying to resume a download that canQ'Et be resumed Galaxy Tab 10.1 logcat 07-12 15:48:24.604: INFO/DownloadManager(6179): Initiating request for download 1883 07-12 15:48:27.064: INFO/DownloadManager(6179): Initiating request for download 1883 07-12 15:48:27.064: WARN/DownloadManager(6179): Aborting request for download 1883: Trying to resume a download that canQ'Et be resumed However on my T-Mobile g2 Model:HTC Vision Version:2.3.3 Kernel 2.6.32.28 (cyanogenmod) This behavior does not happen.

column11: Hello I have a Droid X2 from Motorola and everything went fine with the initial version of Android OS that shipped with it; however when the update to 2.3.3 (I think itQ'Es called Gingerbread) a certain instability issue started to arise. During texting I would notice more of a latency between words. Pressing space caused a moderate delay but I didnQ'Et really concern myself with it. Then it started to crash. Once it had crashed the application I was using at the time (usually the text messaging program) would drop out of its typing mode and show just the message typically with a few glyphs with a corrupted look to them. Exiting out of the text messaging application and resuming typing generally fixed the issue; however as time wore on the issue became more and more intrusive. Turning off the phone and powering it back on didnQ'Et seem to have any impact on the overall problem (i.e. it would still crash in within the same frequency.) Then it got to the point where typing one word and pressing space would cause the fault closing the keyboard and making texting exceedingly time consuming and error prone. I started typing multiple words in sequence with no spaces to expedite the issue; however when I would start to insert the spaces between the words the crashes would continue. I decided to dig into the applications and found com.android.inputmethod.latin associated to the multi-touch keyboard. I turned off next word prediction show suggestions auto punctuate auto-correct errors highlight words I also decided to clear the learned words. After doing all this I noticed the application responded in a much more expedient manner and there were no crashes. Given that I was irked at the moment I didnQ'Et take a stepwise approach to determine which specific feature it was that was causing the issue. IQ'Eve turned all the previous features on and it seems to be working fine though were I to guess I think there might be a connection between next word prediction and the learned words. Since the error would happen only after spaces. I only type from 20-40 words per minute on this device which to me is slow compared to typing with a keyboard (90-105) if thereQ'Es anything else I need to add to this please let me know.

column16: I recently upgraded my Droid X from Android 2.2.1 to 2.3.3. I have two POP accounts a Gmail account Facebook account and Twitter account in my phone (all were there and accessible in 2.2.1). Yesterday I went in to edit the settings for one of my POP accounts and found that they no longer show up in the My Accounts list. The accounts are still on the phone and actively receiving emails -- I just cannot edit the account settings or delete the account. The only options I can see currently is (a) to edit the system file table to remove the account manually (which would require rooting) or (b) to do a factory reset neither of which I would like to do. Can someone advise on if there is a workaround to fix this problem and/or if Motorola or Google is working to fix this problem?

column24: It happens a lot when I write emails using Thunderbird. It constantly backs up the email then puts the last backup in the trash. When I look at a conversation it has all the emails in the trash as part of the conversation which I am fine with. Even if I delete the emails from the trash they still show up in the Gmail app on my phone under the conversation that I was writing for. It makes my conversations look as if they have the same email over and over. The only way I found to fix it is to clear the data on the app then when it re-syncs the conversation no longer has the messages that no longer exist. I am using a Motorola Droid Android 2.2.1

column18: Description: AndroidQ'Es webview produces a JavaScript error when accessing the Google (Apps or public) Doclist. This error does not appear when using the standalone browser. *Steps to reproduce*: 1) Follow instructions on http://developer.android.com/guide/tutorials/views/hello-webview.html Q&E http://developer.android.com/guide/webapps/debugging.html - OR - just use the attached project. 2) Modify project so that starting page will point to https://docs.google.com/ - OR - Navigate embedded browser to https://docs.google.com/ 4) Observe JavaScript error in LogCat: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method Q'EsetItemQ'E of null -- From line 2876 of https://docs.google.com/fe/m - AND - Observe never ending Q'Eloading doclistQ'E animation (screenshot) *Expected result* (this is what happens in standalone browser): Observe loaded and ready-to-use doclist. column16: Using a Motorola Xoom 3.0.1 and the new MTP support. Steps to reproduce. 1.) Create files on your Xoom. 2.) Plug your Xoom into a PC 3.) Drag and drop the files in to a folder on your PC (or use WMDM or WPD) 4.) Eventually one of the files will not be the same as one on the Xoom. It appears to me that only part of the file is being copied. 5.) Unplug and replug your Xoom and eventually the whole file will copy If this were mass storage you could simply check that the MD5 checksums do not match and see that the copy was not a success but with the choice of MTP we are forced into thinking the operation was a success. If the user or software assumes success and deletes files from the Xoom users will lose their files to this bug.

column13: Tested on : Samsung galaxy S 2.2TAB/ Motorola xoom/ htc desire  HD/ Nexus S/ Nexus one and more... The problem is that when no wifi is present in the place and when calling getScanResult with wifi manager ( using broadcast receiver) old access point detected before are listed by the getScanResult: a place: 3 wifi AP --Q>E getScanResult return the free IQ'Em moving to a floor where no wifi is present getScanresult return AP from 3 to one depending if the scan was done during the movement between the floor. The worst case is to show the 3 ap while thereQ'Ere not here. The result list is refresh only if the scan get somme result so I think that the tiemout do not refresh the list. column11: I tried searching for something like this but couldnQ'Et think of decent keywords (except Q"EskipQ"E) so my apologies if I missed it. Reproduction steps: 1. Hook up a bluetooth headset (a2dp specific? not sure; mineQ'Es a motorola HT 820) 2. Go to settings text to speech settings set the default engine to Pico (it also happens with svox but less often). 3. Click listen to an example; confirm the TTS is played on the headset 4. Click the Q"Elisten to an exampleQ"E button repeatedly. Result: - About one time in 6? words at the beginning will be lost. IQ'Eve lost much as Q"EThis is an example ofQ"E on occasion. The problem there is that whatQ'Es left Q"ESpeech synthesis in English with PicoQ"E sounds like a whole sentence. This *only* happens with bluetooth: playing TTS over the phone speaker never has this problem at all. It also seems to only happen at the *beginning* of utterances. Music seems to be fine although I donQ'Et think I would notice a missing bar or two at the beginning of most songs anyways so itQ'Es hard to be sure. My use case is that IQ'Em using Moon+ Reader Pro to play ebooks to me via TTS. I eventually discovered that I was regularly losing clauses out of sentences such that I wasnQ'Et aware that it was happening because the results were still understandable but I was missing whole plot points; I had to restart a chapter from scratch because significant chunks of the meaning had been lost. The phone is a T-Mobile G1 (aka HTC Dream). Full disclosure: this thing only has 90MiB on-phone storage and Google Maps *alone* is taking up almost 10% of that. Recent applications take up a lot of space in general. As such itQ'Es almost unusable without 2.2 and the ability to move apps to the SD card. Which is why IQ'Em running CyanogenMod 6.1.0-DS. ItQ'Es possible although it seems very unlikely to me that this is cynaogenmodQ'Es fault especially since IQ'Em pretty sure this was happening before I even rooted the phone. ItQ'Es possible and a lot more likely that itQ'Es the phoneQ'Es fault; too little RAM general crappiness I dunno. If people have a chance to try to replicate though IQ'Ed sure appreciate knowing if itQ'Es just me or not. Please find an ADB bugreport attached. -Robin

column6: Motorola Droid Android 2.2.2 Email 2.2.2 I just found this problem in my environment. I found my IMAP Q"ESentQ"E folder with 370000+ messages. I downloaded all of the messages from my IMAP Q"ESentQ"E folder to my computer and after comparing all the messages I had ~400 unique messages out of 370000+. The messages which were duplicated all originated from my droid. Some of which were duplicated thousands of times. Interestingly the oldest had the most duplicates. This falls in line with many of the other reports in Issue 4761 (I implore you to look at issue 4761 as there are a handful of succinct descriptions of the issue). Many of the messages report all mail in the droidQ'Es local Q"ESentQ"E folder is resent/copied to the IMAP server every time the account is syncQ'Ed. Unfortunately you have to wade through many unrelated messages in that thread which is why it was closed by the owner. I would love to see this resolved as I like using the native apps on my droid but after seeing the frustration of the other people experiencing this problem trying to see this to resolution IQ'Em tempted to jump over to K-9 and call it done... but it would not be without considerable disappointment. IQ'Ed be happy to help anyway I can. -Patrick Referenced Issue: http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=4761

column11: Affected Version: Android 2.1 (Eclair) CTS_R5 What steps will reproduce the problem? CTS Test Case: android.media.cts.AudioManagerTest #testVolume Root Cause: Test is failed for CTS code is not compatible with MotorolaQ'Es requirement. Detailed Analysis: The failure happened on CTS code (File Name AudioManagerTest.java) as below ( marked as red for the root cause): mAudioManager.setStreamVolume(streams[i] 1 FLAG_SHOW_UI); mAudioManager.adjustStreamVolume(streams[i] ADJUST_LOWER FLAG_ALLOW_RINGER_MODES); // lowering the volume should have changed the ringer mode assertEquals(RINGER_MODE_VIBRATE mAudioManager.getRingerMode()); mAudioManager.adjustStreamVolume(streams[i] ADJUST_LOWER FLAG_ALLOW_RINGER_MODES); assertEquals(RINGER_MODE_SILENT mAudioManager.getRingerMode()); The test case requires that when volume index changes to less than 5 the ringtone mode should be RINGER_MODE_VIBRATE; then decreasing volume again the mode shall be RINGER_MODE_SILENT. While the requirement of ISGcq00621889 should change the mode to RINGER_MODE_SILENT first and then RINGER_MODE_VIBRATE. User would like to accept the behavior of change ringer to VIBRATE at last so I submit this request to change the test case as mAudioManager.setStreamVolume(streams[i] 1 FLAG_SHOW_UI); mAudioManager.adjustStreamVolume(streams[i] ADJUST_LOWER FLAG_ALLOW_RINGER_MODES); // lowering the volume should have changed the ringer mode assertEquals(RINGER_MODE_SILENT mAudioManager.getRingerMode()); mAudioManager.adjustStreamVolume(streams[i] ADJUST_LOWER FLAG_ALLOW_RINGER_MODES); assertEquals(RINGER_MODE_VIBRATE mAudioManager.getRingerMode());

column5: Process Q"EMediaserverQ"E uses too much battery.
column6: - Steps to reproduce the problem. Listen music with any application streaming from Internet or using the audio files on the phone. - What happened. Like for 2 months IQ'Eve been listenig music with Pandora Music or Winamp with a decent battery life on my Motorola Droid 2 Global. Mediaserver should use a reasonable amount of battery and close faster after the user ends the media application.

I believe this is related to the new media framework stagefright where looped audio is not longer seemless. Using the following code: Media Player mediaPlayer = MediaPlayer.create(this Uri.parse(someValidPath)); mediaPlayer.setLooping(true); In my testing someValidPath points to a local file stored on a SD card. The audio will loop but there is a brief noticeable gap that didnQ'Et exist in previous versions of Android. I have tested with various ogg and wav files and they all produce the same result a brief pause between sounds. DonQ'Et forget to mention which version of Android youQ'Ere using and/or which device the problem appears on (model and Android version). I have tested on Android 3.2 and have experienced the issue kernel: 2.6.36-gb899528 android-build@apa28 #1 on the Motorola Xoom On version 3.1 on the Xoom this problem was not present. I feel that the expected output should be the same as it was in previous versions of Android where sample is looped seemlessly without any pause that is noticeable to the human ear. Please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output. attached is the output of adb bugreport as well as a sample file to illustrate the issue.

column12: createEditPopupMenu2 creates a ListPopupWindow with an EditText in it and createEditPopupMenu3 creates a PopupWindow with an EditText in it. The IME comes up only when clicking in the EditText of the second method even though the first method uses ListPopupWindow#setInputMethodMode. I am on Honeycomb MR2 Motorola Xoom. // The IME does *not* come up when clicking inside the EditText created in the method below. private void createEditPopupMenu2(View anchor) { final ListPopupWindow popup = new ListPopupWindow(this); EditText editText = new EditText(this); popup.setAdapter(new ListPopupViewAdapter(editText)); popup.setAnchorView(anchor); popup.setWidth(400); anchor.setOnClickListener(new OnClickListener() { @Override public void onClick(View view) { popup.show(); } }); popup.setInputMethodMode(ListPopupWindow.INPUT_METHOD_NEEDED); editText.setFocusable(true); } // The IME does come up when clicking inside the EditText created in the method below. private void createEditPopupMenu3(final View anchor) { final PopupWindow popup = new PopupWindow(this); final EditText editText = new EditText(this); popup.setWidth(400); popup.setHeight(200); popup.setContentView(editText); anchor.setOnClickListener(new OnClickListener() { @Override public void onClick(View view) { popup.showAsDropDown(anchor); } }); popup.setFocusable(true); }
