column14: Device: Motorola Droid 2 Global (android 2.2) Many apps that I knew existed or had installed would not appear in search results on the Market. Examples: - Wardrive (on my dadQ'Es D2 and my friendQ'Es D2Global searching for Wardrive yielded over a screen of results... on my phone it returned ONE. (not the right one even)) - Google+ - the official NASA app for the last launch Additionally using the Market website to download them to my phone remotely would fail silently and opening a market link to them on my phone would result in a Q"EThe requested item could not be foundQ"E error. Those errors also happened frequently when I would try to update apps I already have installed (from the market... and no I donQ'Et use titanium backup or another such app) I stumbled across the following steps on a site for an app I donQ'Et have installed tried them out and IT FIXED THE PROBLEM! 1. Open your application management settings page and go to the all tab 2. Select: Q"EMarketQ"E Clear CACHE ... (NOT data) Force Stop 3. Select Q"EGoogle services frameworkQ"E Clear DATA Force stop 4. Reboot After a minute-ish of the market mourning the loss of its cache it loaded. I searched for Q"EWardriveQ"E and got over a screen of results instead of just 1. Problem solved. What caused it? *shrug*

Apple iPhone is able to see Q'Eandroid apQ'E hotspots but when asked to connect states Q'Eunable to connect to Q'Eandroid apQ'EQ'E 3g connection from xoom is at best level Q'EhQ'E and package with 3 has 5gb of data left for the month. Xoom is able to download apps webpages and documents internally implying it is online through 3g. Measures taken to try and fix problem with no success: Turn xoom off and back on Soft reset xoom Turn wifi radio on whilst having hotspots on Turn wifi radio off whilst having hotspot on Having hotspot with no wpa or security Changing security password Changing ssid to something else Only method that seems to make hotspot work for upto 5 mins: Turn airplane radio on. Leave for a few seconds for it to action on everything. Turn airplane mode off and turn hotspot back on. The netbook can then connect 20% of the time or reverts to the error stated above.if it does connect the netbook can connect for approximately 5 mins then drops out and problem remains. Motorola xoom MZ601 wifi and 3g model Android 3.1 europe Please update me on problem as hotspot feature is very important to me. Adam.brackpool@gmail.com NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user Hdiscussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

column15: Issue: When in silent mode and set text message notification to vibrate it does not stop vibrating when turn the volume up when the notification is set to vibrate only in silent mode. To reproduce the issue: 1. Click Options button Q>E Settings Q>E Sound Q>E Vibrate Q>E Only in Silent mode. 2.Click home key then open text messaging Q>E click options button Q>E Message Settings Q>E Check Vibrate. 3. Set phone to Silent Mode Q>E receive text --Q>E Works 4. Turn volume up so that phone is no longer on Silent Mode receive text --Q>E notification ringer sounds and vibrates. Correct Behavior: The correct behavior the way the text is stated in the settings is that when Only Vibrate in Silent Mode is selected under settings Q>E Sound that the device would only vibrate when you have Silent Mode enabled. Device: Motorola Droid 2 Global (blue)

Steps to replicate: Attempt to play any video in an AVI container. Result: Q"ESorry this video cannot be playedQ"E Expected result: The video to play as long as the A/V codecs are available. This is specifically relating to the ASUS TF101 Transformer but I believe it applies to the Motorola Xoom as well. The media playback engine (Now only StageFright I believe) has been crippled by removing AVI as a parsable container for playback. Given that media playback was already a weakness in Android surely it is foolish to remove existing media playback features. The Tegra2 (the current Q"EstandardQ"E for Honeycomb) can decode many more types of video than Android is currently allowing it to mostly due to limiting which containers are available this is harming the image of Honeycomb devices as a media consumption device. (As an aside IQ'Ed also like to mention how ridiculous it is that WebM is supported and yet the Matroska container that WebM uses is not available)

column10: In the Android browser the shadowOffsetY value is apparently reversed from all of the main browsers on Windows (Chrome Firefox 4 IE9 Opera Safari). With a standard shadow you would expect it to go to the bottom-right. However by default the Android version goes to the top-right if the value is positive. I have tested this on 2.2.1 (HTC Thunderbolt and Motorola Droid X) and 2.3.3 (Cyanogenmod 7 on ViewSonic gTablet) all with the standard browser showing AppleWebKit/533.1 in the user agent string. Example URLs: http://www.html5canvastutorials.com/advanced/html5-canvas-shadow-offset-tutorial/ http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/html-5-canvas-the-basics/#shadows

Steps to reproduce the problem: * Send a MMS message with either a Froyo or Eclair build on a Motorola Droid (note: multiple ROMs including Q"EstraightQ"E AOSP have been tested). * If the MMS fails to send at that immediate moment (such as in areas with low service) it will be queued to send along with the next MMS message is sent from the phone regardless of which contact the 2nd MMS is being sent to. Essentially MMS messages to valid recipients that arenQ'Et fully sent sit in a purgatory-esque state until you attempt to send another MMS. What you think the correct behavior should be: * The MMS should be sent as quickly as possible when service is rediscovered.

column16: I am using a Motorola Droid X running Android 2.2.1. There appears to be an issue with text messages that contain text inside of parentheses. Two issues actually. One is that the parentheses show up as square backets for the FIRST instance in a message. The second is that text that precedes the first set of parentheses is dropped from the message. So for example the following message: leading text (paren 1) following text (paren 2) will show up on the Droid as this: [paren 1] following text (paren 2) I have confirmed that the same message from the same source sent to my gmail account shows up correctly. This was NOT a problem prior to the 2.2 upgrade. Big problem with the 2.2 upgrade got better with the 2.2.1 upgrade but still not right. Seems like it might be similar to but different from issue 13298.

column11: Since upgrading to 2.3 on my wifeQ'Es HTC Inspire the bluetooth audio no longer works in our 2011 Ford Explorer with Sync/MyFordTouch. Once the Ford and Inspire are paired the Inspire believes it has a bluetooth audio Q&E media headset connected. When I play an audio file and adjust the volume it reports as changing the bluetooth audio. The Ford however doesnQ'Et think itQ'Es connected. When I choose the Q'EBT AudioQ'E device from the sound source selection screen it has a popup saying itQ'Es trying to connect to Q'EQ<EMy phone nameQ>EQ'E but it never does. The BT phone capabilities work just fine - no problems using the Ford as a BT headset for making phone calls. ItQ'Es only the media portion thatQ'Es having this problem. This phone worked in the car before the 2.3 upgrade. Also we have a Motorola Atrix which is also running 2.3 and this phone works exactly as it should when paired with the Ford. Possibly related is that the 2 will only pair if the Sync is the discoverable device. If I put the HTC Inspire into discoverable mode Sync cannot find it. To reproduce the problem: 1) Have a Ford Explorer with Sync/MyFordTouch running 2.11 of Sync. 2) Have an HTC Inspire from ATQ&ET 3) Pair the phone and the Ford (discover Sync from your phone it wonQ'Et work the other way) 4) Go to the audio screen on the Sync system. 5) Select Q'EBT StereoQ'E from the sources list. 6) Sync will hang searching for the device but the phone thinks itQ'Es connected and will stream audio over the BT headset (that isnQ'Et really connected).

column8: Hi we got a lot of reports from our users that our Android app consumes a lot of battery. After some extended debugging sessions I now suspect that the battery reporting of Android (concerning sensors) might be incorrect. It seems that no matter how you unregister the sensors that you have used they are still being looked at as active by the battery reporting tool. To reproduce the error: 1. Compile the official Android sensor example (Accelerometer Play) from http://developer.android.com/resources/samples/AccelerometerPlay/src/com/example/android/accelerometerplay/index.html 2. Upload it to the phone and start it 3. terminate it with the back button (after approx. 5 seconds) 4. disconnect the usb cable 5. wait some time (e.g. 20 seconds) 6. open the dailpad and enter *#*#4636#*#* 7. click on battery history=Q>E other usage =Q>E Sensor usage =Q>E Accelerometer Play 8. The displayed sensor usage time is larger than the time the activity was in foreground 9. If you repeat step 7 you will see that the sensor usage value still increases even tough the app is not running anymore I reproduced this error on a Motorola Defy with Android 2.3.4 and a Nexus One with Android 2.3.4. The error does not occur on a HTC Desire running Android 2.2. Alternatively you can observe the same thing by using adb (instead of the tool from the dialpad): adb shell dumpsys batteryinfo I would appreciate it if someone would help me to find a way to correctly unregister the sensors (on 2.3.4 devices). Regards Samuel

column17: Device: Motorola Droid - Running 2.2 Description of bug: Android touch events are fired while interacting with a swf file while it is in windowed mode. Once you switch to full screen flash no android touch events are fired. Ideal behavior: Both window and full screen mode android touch events should be reported. Steps to reproduce 1) Using a webview -or- your own class which extends from webview. 2) Set the setOnTouchListener in webview -or- override the onInterceptTouchEvent and return false (so it will pass the events through) 3) Load an html page with a swf file on 4) Switch to full screen mode for the swf 5) No touch events are fired at the android level. Flash will register the events though.

column15: Problem: When headphones are connected to phone notifications (email/sms and incoming calls) are being played through the phoneQ'Es external speaker in addition to be played through the headphones. This behavior is clearly a bug as it is generally (and correctly assumed) that plugging headphones into a device will prevent audio output to external sounding speakers. Headphones are most commonly used to allow private listening in places where notifications audible to the public would be inappropriate such as libraries courtrooms class etc. While there are a few examples of externally audible notifacations being useful such as not wanting to miss a notification while headphones are plugged in but are not being worn at the moment I believe that users expect and desire that the external speaker be disabled. Assuming that the ability to select the desired behavior of the external speaker is not possible the behavior should be to mute the external sounding speaker when headphones are connected and play notifications only through the headphones. If the behavior of the external speaker could be selected by the user the default behavior should be to mute the external speaker with the ability to chose to have notifications played externally via a checkbox. Until the behavior is selectable or made to always mute the external speaker it should be considered a bug as an Android phone seems to be the only device I can think of that disregards this behavior. The phone I use is a Motorola Dropid X running Android 2.2 but this seems to be an issue to all versions of Android as reported by this Q"EenhancementQ"E request: http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=6696 Please not that I have filed a bug on this issue as I believe this a bug not an enhancement. -- Thank You

column16: The MediaPlayer (Stagefright) does not handle the HTTP/HTTPS cookies set by the server at the beginning of the HTTP Live Streaming session. The session is started passing an autentication parameter in the entry-point URL: http://www.example.org/myvideo.m3u8?auth=myauth and the server replies with a cookie to keep track of subsequent request (m3u8 keys chunks..). However the player ignores the cookie and performs any new HTTP request without it (therefore the server refuses connection since they are unauthorized). This make it impossible to implement services with (even basic) content protection. The MediaPlayer is expected to support all HTTP standard features including cookies. Device info: Android 3.0.1 on Galaxy Tab 10.1 Android 3.1 on Motorola Xoom

column9: We went into troubles developing a social application that uses Bluetooth to communicate. Since there is no ability to establish a connection between Bluetooth devices without pairing we decided to use Bluetooth device name to detect if our application is installed on the remote device and if itQ'Es compatible with ours. As android docs say Q"EValid Bluetooth names are a maximum of 248 bytes using UTF-8 encoding although many remote devices can only display the first 40 characters and some may be limited to just 20.Q"E The problem is that some devices provide only the part of their names for the remote deviceQ'Es Bluetooth API during search. The method getName() of BluetoothAdapter invoked on those phones locally however returns the full set Bluetooth name. Here is a short list of tested devices with this odd behavior: Motorola Milestone (Droid) Android 2.1.1 ? 48 symbols Samsung Galaxy S Android 2.1 Android 2.2 ? 32 symbols Samsung GT-i5800 Android 2.1 ? 32 symbols However there was no such problem on Motorola Milestone with Android 2.0 and Android 2.1. HTC Hero and HTC Wildfire seem to work as expected as well. Is this a known Android issue or is it a bug introduced by the device manufacturers? Generally the http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=6710 resolution would let us drop using this workaround with names. Is it really expected in 3.0?

column12: Hi I uses media query in my CSS in order to manage portrait and landscape presentation of a mobile website. In a page I have an input of type text. - The phone is in portrait mode. - When I focus on the textfield the CSS used is the landscape one. - When hitting on the back button of the device the one that make the virtual keyboard disappear the CSS returns to the portrait one. I think the correct behavior is the display should still be in portrait mode. Tested on: - HTC Nexus One Android 2.2.1. result: reproductible - Samsung Nexus S Android 2.3.3. result: reproductible - HTC Emerald myTouch 4G Android 2.3.3 result: display OK - Motorola Atrix Android 2.2 result: reproductible

column13: IQ'Em on Mac OS X. adb does not see my Atrix. $ adb devices List of devices attached (nothing) However it recognizes my Droid Droid 2 Galaxy Tab HVC EVO and Nexus One. Also adb does see my Atrix when running on windows 7. Also my Mac system profiler does see the Atrix an attached USB device. So the problem is not the phone and not the computer. As such I conclude that there is a bug in adb with the Atrix on OS X. IQ'Eve also tried putting the Q"EUSB vendor idQ"E (0x22b8) into the file ~/.android/adb_usb.ini (and doing a adb kill-server to restart it) But it doesnQ'Et help. However I know the file is getting read because if I put junk in the file adb server wonQ'Et start. I also downloaded and installed MotoDEV studio for Mac OS X but that did not help either. IQ'Eve rebooted the phone the computer... I have USB Debugging and Stay Awake enabled I have a SIM card etc. etc. IQ'Eve googled around on the problem - other people have this issue with a variety of phones. In general the solution seems to be the adb_usb.ini file or a new driver (on Windows) but IQ'Em stuck. And again all my other phones work fine and even the Atrix works fine on my Windows machine. IQ'Eve tried with the very latest Android r10 tools as well as the older r6 tools I had been using up until having this problem. IQ'Eve been in touch with Motorola tech support and they told me to file a bug with Google. So here I am with the fanciest new Android phone on the market but I cannot use it :-( IQ'Eve attached my system profile as both rtf and spx. IQ'Em happy to help you by running any special / diagnostic builds of adb you want to send me. Thanks Brad

column16: NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. While making/initiating a voice call or while the call is under progress there is NO option in android dialer to record the call on Android 2.2. This basic feature of recording a call is supported even in basic phones(Sony ericsson T68i) from as early as 2003. - What you think the correct behavior should be. There should be an option to record the call either while initiating or/and during the call. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have making sure that it runs Android 2.2. I am running commtive z71 clone Spice MI-300 on Android 2.2. The same hardware is supplied to 14 different phone companies which includes Motorola. I have also tested this on Motorola Xt5 aswell. This looks like incomplete implementation as I came to know that there is partial support in the form of APIs in the OS and hence it is filed as a bug. Also this is a common feafunctionality across most of the mobile phones right from the basic phones since 2003 this should be categorised as BUG and NOT a new feature. THIS IS AN ISSUE AND SINCE THE IMPLEMENTATION IS INCOMPLETE and the CALL RECORDING IS Q"ENOT WORKINGASINDTENDEDQ"E kindly fix this issue. I HOPE THIS ISSUE WILL BE FIXED AND THE BUG WILL NOT BE CLOSED. If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

column22: Currently Android cellphones use Different hardware connectors so for example if you buy a docking station for a Samsung cellphone it wonQ'Et work for a Motorola cellphone. The iPhoneiPhone3GiPhone4 all have the same standard pinout hardware connector so all hardware accessories work with any iPhone model as you can see here: http://www.tracyandmatt.co.uk/blogs/media/tracyandmatts_blog/windowslivewriter/appleiphone3greview_5762/iphone_bottom_2.jpg My feature request is for all Android cellphones to have a standard pinout docking connector so ALL android hardware accessories will work on ALL android cellphones. So maybe the Open Handset Alliance could develop a open-source standard pinout hardware connector standard and then ask all android cellphone makers to build new android cellphones using the Same connector. At the same time you should ask android cellphone manufacturers to all use a Micro USB port for cellphone battery charging so all android cellphones can use the same cellphone battery charger.

column25: When using Browser to view embedded Flash elements in full-screen mode and screen is rotated Browser can become scrambled upon exiting full-screen mode. - Go to a webpage with a Flash element in Honeycomb Browser. (e.g. www.bbc.co.uk) - Activate Flash element if Browser is set to on-demand. - Switch Flash element to full screen (either by explicit control button or double tap). - Change screen orientation (portrait to landscape or viceversa). - Exit full screen mode. -Q>E Browser display and controls are scrambled. column6: Some physical keyboard shortcuts seem to have been bugged in 2.3.4. Menu + A for select all will highlight all the text(along with the new fancy selection tabs below the selected text) but then instantly disappear. This doesnQ'Et allow any time for copying cutting deleting or other functions expected. It seems that now it selects all the text and then stops when the button is released. If the button combination is held down it will replace the selected text with Q"EAQ"E. Expected behavior is the same as 2.2 which is the highlight the text and for it to stay highlighted so it may be messed with (copy cut paste delete etc.) In the Browser holding down the shift key brings up the same selection arrow that it use to bring up in 2.2 and previous but if you select any or no text it will have the same outcome. A tool-tip pops up saying Q"EText copied to clipboard.Q"E No text will be copied to the clipboard and the clipboard will empty even if no text was selected. Expected behavior is the same as 2.2 which is the text to be copied to the clipboard if text is highlighted and to not empty the clipboard or open the tool-tip if there was no text highlighted. No need for adb bugreport issue seems to be with the new selection feature and is on multiple devices. Devices tested on: T-Mobile G2(Running new 2.3.4 Gingerbread ROM) Verizon Droid 2(With Motorola Gingerbread OS)

column6: Q"EUse incoming call volume for notificationsQ"E has no effect until the ringtone volume is changed
column7: Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Go to Settings Sound Volume. 2. Uncheck the Q"EUse incoming call volume for notificationsQ"E check box. 3. Set the ringtone volume to max and the notification volume to 0. 4. Check the the Q"EUse incoming call volume for notificationsQ"E check box. The notification volume slider disappears. 5. Touch OK. 6. Do something that should result in a notification sound. No notification sound will be heard. Only when the user (or an app) changes the ringtone volume or notification for the first time after doing the preceding will the notification volume begin to follow the ringtone volume. The text of the setting Q"EUse incoming call volume for notificationsQ"E certainly suggests that as soon as the box is checked the notification volume will be the same as the incoming call volume. Also the fact that the notification volume slider disappears suggests that there is no longer any separate notification volume setting in effect. Note that this issue appears to *not* be the same as issue number 7463. That issue happens when the user sets the ring and notification volumes after setting notifications_use_ring_volume. I have not observed that issue myself. My issue is what happens when the user *does not* set the ring or notification volume after enabling notifications_use_ring_volume. The effect of the NOTIFICATIONS_USE_RING_VOLUME setting when enabled seems to be that any change to the ringtone volume will change the notification volume to the same value and vice versa. But until the first volume change is made following the enabling of the NOTIFICATIONS_USE_RING_VOLUME setting the two volumes may differ from each other. One could argue whether this is a problem with the underlying API not doing what the documentations says or the documentation not matching the behavior of the system or whether this issue should be fixed only in the GUI so that the behavior matches the text in the settings GUI. http://www.androidjavadoc.com/2.3/android/provider/Settings.System.html#NOTIFICATIONS_USE_RING_VOLUME I wonQ'Et take on that debate but clearly the end user isnQ'Et getting the behavior that he or she would expect. In any case I believe it is entirely useful to have the option of linking the notification volume and ringtone volume and I would like to see the option preserved. During the day for example I want the two linked. Any change I make to my ringtone volume should be mirrored in the notification volume as I move between places where I want them to be louder or quieter. At night I want the ringtone volume at the maximum so I can be woken up for emergencies and the notification volume at 0. I change the setting twice a day to achieve this. I observed the issue under Android 2.0 CyanogenMod 6.0.0 on the Motorola Droid.

column10: Motorola Xoom tablet randomly reboots when Hotmail email account is set up on device using Exchange. This issue is definitely caused by the above configuration since I experienced this at least 3 times a day with the above configuration. I ended up doing a factory reset and did not install any apps. The reboot issues did not occur for over 4 days. Then I setup the Hotmail account and the random reboots started occurring again almost immediately. I tried changing the account configuration (manual refresh instead of push notifications etc.) but nothing short of removing the Hotmail account using Exchange would prevent the reboots from occurring. I then set up Hotmail using POP3 and no longer have the issue. As another test I installed the Touchdown For Tablets App by NitroDesk and setup Hotmail using this app and the random reboots started occurring again.

Per the documentation onMovedToScrapHeap is supposed to fire when a view is moved onto the scrap heap and is no longer visible on the screen. I am seeing instances where I move forward through my listview and I am seeing onMovedToScapHeap fire for views that are still on the screen. I am testing on the Motorola Xoom targeted at 2.2. My listview fills the height of the screen. According to the documentation when one item disappears entirely from the screen onMovedToScrapHeap is supposed to fire indicating that the view is no longer visible. However moving forward through my list I am seeing OnMovedToScrapHeap fire for the view that went out off the screen and the current view. This is very reproducable with the following code @Override public void onMovedToScrapHeap(View view) { ViewHolder vh = (ViewHolder) view.getTag(); BookImageView biv = vh.image; if (biv != null) { try { Object tag = biv.getTag(); int tagInt = ((Number) tag).intValue(); Log.e(LOG_TAG Q"EImage View Position: Q"E + tagInt); Log.e(LOG_TAG Q"EIn Cache?: Q"E + ImageLoader.inCache(tagInt)); BookImageView cBiv = getCurrentImageView(); Log.e(LOG_TAG Q"ECurrent Image View Tag: Q"E + cBiv.getTag()); if (!ImageLoader.inCache(tagInt)) { ((BitmapDrawable) biv.getDrawable()).getBitmap().recycle(); Log.e(LOG_TAG Q"ERecycled BitmapQ"E); } else ImageLoader.setRecyclable(tagInt); } catch (Exception excep) { Log.e(LOG_TAG Q"EException recycling the bitmap: Q"E + excep.getMessage()); } } I also hooked up the debugger to make sure the object ID is consistent when you move from position 1 - 2 2 - 3 3 -4 etc. When moving from 2-3 I see onMovedToScapHeap fire for 2 and 3 and then when I move from 3 -4 I see onMovedToScrapHeap fire for 3 and 4. The object ids for 3 in both cases is the same. Also it should be noted that this is not a problem moving backwards through the list.

column15: This is in a production Motorola XOOM tablet build HRI66 kernel version 2.6.36.3-g2a65edc android-build@apa28 #1 The issue was raised on the MOTODEV community boards and reproduced by me. Follow these steps to build and debug one of the samples that comes with the NDK. Assume you have eclipse installed with ADT Plugin for Eclipse installed and the ndk-r5b installed and $NDK pointing at your ndk-r5b directory. == hardware setup * Enable USB Debugging on the device * plug it in to the usb port of your development machine == in Eclipse * Click on the button for the New Android Project Wizard * In the Contents area select Q"ECreate project from existing sourceQ"E * for the location put Q<Eyour ndk directoryQ>E/samples/hello-gl2 * for the build target check Android 3.0 * press finish * Open the AndroidManifest.xml and in the Application tab set Debuggable to true Q<Eapplication android:debuggable=Q"EtrueQ"E.../Q>E == in a command prompt: * cd $NDK/samples/hello-gl2 * $NDK/ndk-build -B NDK_DEBUG=1 NDK_LOG=1 == go back to eclipse * Project Q>E Clean... * Project Q>E Build Project == go back to command prompt: * unzip -l bin/hello-gl2.apk * (Check to see that it contains lib/armeabi/gdbserver and lib/armeabi/libgl2jni.so) * adb install bin/hello-gl2.apk (note: the name of the apk should be the name you gave when creating the project) * $NDK/ndk-gdb --start --force --verbose NDK_LOG=1 * here you will see the run-as segfault. If your setup is working correctly then you should instead be able to set breakpoints in gl_code.cpp and other gdb commands like info threads. Found package name: com.android.gl2jni ABIs targetted by application: armeabi Device API Level: 11 Device CPU ABIs: armeabi-v7a armeabi Compatible device ABI: armeabi Found debuggable flag: true Found device gdbserver: /data/data/com.android.gl2jni/lib/gdbserver Using gdb setup init: /Users/BGD/android-ndk-r5b/samples/hello-gl2/libs/armeabi/gdb.setup Using toolchain prefix: /Users/BGD/android-ndk-r5b/toolchains/arm-linux-androideabi-4.4.3/prebuilt/darwin-x86/bin/arm-linux-androideabi- Using app out directory: /Users/BGD/android-ndk-r5b/samples/hello-gl2/obj/local/armeabi Found data directory: Q'E/data/data/com.android.gl2jniQ'E Found first launchable activity: .GL2JNIActivity Launching activity: com.android.gl2jni/.GL2JNIActivity ## COMMAND: /Users/BGD/android-sdk-mac_x86/platform-tools/adb shell am start -n com.android.gl2jni/.GL2JNIActivity Starting: Intent { cmp=com.android.gl2jni/.GL2JNIActivity } ## COMMAND: /Users/BGD/android-sdk-mac_x86/platform-tools/adb shell sleep 2 Found running PID: 1418 Launched gdbserver succesfully. column13: A set of the newer Android devices seem to be having trouble validating the DigiCert Assured ID Root CA certificate. Test links are available that can be used to easily test devices for each of the three DigiCert root certificates. All three of these test links are at https://www.digicert.com/digicert-root-certificates.htm -- The DigiCert Assured ID Root CA Test link ( https://assured-id-root.digicert.com/testroot/ ) fails to validate on the new Samsung Galaxy Tablets Samsung Nexus S phone The Motorola Atrix and the Motorola Droid X. Instead the attached security warning appears. The other test links for the DigiCert High Assurance EV Root CA and the DigiCert Global Root CA Certificates both work flawlessly on these same devices. All three links continue to work on various other Android devices that weQ'Eve been able to test.

column27: - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Open Browser and download few FL(Forward lock) audio files(mp3 Midi etc). 2. Play them with the music player and listen to the audio. 3. column9: Whilst using the hotspot feature to broadcast a wifi signal to my netbook the signal from the xoom to the netbook is lost. When trying to connect the netbook again the netbook can see the ssid of the access point from the xoom however windows returns an error Q'Eunable to connect to networkQ'E with a troubleshooting problem that says resolves the problem however when trying to connect again replicates the problem. Apple iPhone is able to see Q'Eandroid apQ'E hotspots but when asked to connect states Q'Eunable to connect to Q'Eandroid apQ'EQ'E 3g connection from xoom is at best level Q'EhQ'E and package with 3 has 5gb of data left for the month. Xoom is able to download apps webpages and documents internally implying it is online through 3g. Measures taken to try and fix problem with no success: Turn xoom off and back on Soft reset xoom Turn wifi radio on whilst having hotspots on Turn wifi radio off whilst having hotspot on Having hotspot with no wpa or security Changing security password Changing ssid to something else Only method that seems to make hotspot work for upto 5 mins: Turn airplane radio on. Leave for a few seconds for it to action on everything. Turn airplane mode off and turn hotspot back on. The netbook can then connect 20% of the time or reverts to the error stated above.if it does connect the netbook can connect for approximately 5 mins then drops out and problem remains. Motorola xoom MZ601 wifi and 3g model Android 3.1 europe Please update me on problem as hotspot feature is very important to me. column5: HTML5 Q"Einput type=urlQ"E and Q"EemailQ"E doesnQ'Et show appropriate keyboard
column6: When visiting pages that employ Q"Einput type=urlQ"E or Q"Einput type=emailQ"E on a field the keyboard does not change. It should show a key for Q"E.comQ"E a backslash and it should remove the space bar from the keyboard (spaces are invalid for URLs). column15: Phone: Motorola Droid X Version: 2.3.3 Problem: When any phone number is displayed on-screen (as a link) clicking it will take the user to the dial-pad. However the phone number is not transferred. Instead the last number dialed is displayed. If the user presses Q"EsendQ"E the phone calls the last number dialed not the number that was clicked. NOTE: This also occurs if clicking the call button on the information page of places found in Google Maps. To Reproduce: Go to the google maps app. Search for a location/company. Click the marker for more information. Click the button with a phone on it. Alternatively: Open a text message or email with a phone number in it. The phone number should appear as a link. Click the link. Expected Behavior: The dial pad should automatically display the phone number that was clicked (from email or text messages) or the phone number of the location specified (from Google Maps App).

column5: Honeycomb reports full screen height in height measure spec Gingerbread subtracts the height of the status bar
column6: Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem: 1. Create a View subclass in onMeasure(int widthMeasureSpec int heightMeasureSpec) log MeasureSpec.getSize(heightMeasureSpec) 2. Create a layout the root View node should use match_parent for width and height. The sole child of the root View should be your subclass. 3. In your default activity setContentView to be the layout you just created 4. test your app use adb logcat to see the logs. - What happened. In portrait mode on a Nexus One running stock Gingerbread you get 762 which is the total height of the screen minus the status bar. In portrait mode on a Motorola Xoom running stock Honeycomb you get 1280 which is the total height of the screen. - What you think the correct behavior should be. All previous versions give you the total height minus the status bar height. Honeycomb should do the same.

column15: Android Camera API does not have means to set camera parameter for preview size and best corresponding preview frame rate. A lot of motorola phones have this issues and its difficult to keep on with ever increasing number of devices.

column11: First off using the motorola atrix with android 2.3.4 (but had the some problem on Froyo) I am having problems with google contacts. In my google contacts online they are clearly separate contacts. However on my phone both John Does are merged into one contact. They go under the first John DoeQ'Es contact picture and I canQ'Et tell them apart other than to memorize the email address. I believe this is a bug that should be addressed.

column14: Three problems: 1.) Android doesnQ'Et seem to connect to bluetooth devices automatically. For example if my Android phone (Motorola Atrix) is connected to my Jabra BT8040 earpiece and i reboot the phone when the phone is done booting i have to MANUALLY tell my Android phone to connect to the earpiece that it was previously connected to. My TWO previous NON-Android phones never had this annoyance. The non-Android phones did everything they could to wisely automate bluetooth functionality. For example in a case where there are TWO bluetooth devices connected to the phone and a call comes in i could just press the answer button on whichever paired/connected devices i wanted to take the call on and the bluetooth audio would AUTOMATICALLY be routed to that device. This make a LOT of sense as far as what the USER needs. 2.) Android seems to take an extraordinarily long time to connect to bluetooth devices. (2.2 Q&E 2.3) On ALL of my previous non-android devices bluetooth connections were made instantaneously. On my Android device there is a SIGNIFICANTLY long wait. A long enough wait to cause missing a phone call etc. 3.) Neither Android 2.2 nor 2.3 seem to be able to connect to MULTIPLE bluetooth devices simultaneously on my Motorola Atrix. Both of my previous non-android phones could connect to multiple bluetooth devices. This certainly seems like a bug/shortcoming. (Why should a Q"Esmart phoneQ"E be any less smart than a non-smartphone?)

column24: Seemingly a well known bug and annoying one at that. Fails to open an attachment from inside Gmail with file extension .3gp and file format video/3gpp but works if you rename the file extenstion to .3gpp - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Send an email to your Gmail account on your Android device or to your Gmail web account with two attachments First attachment with video/3gpp file format with a file extension .3gp Second with video/3gpp file format but file extension .3gpp 2. The Gmail application fails to correctly recognise the first attachment with .3gp extension and all the user can do is look at file info which is not a great experience and videos canQ'Et be played. However the second attachment which is incorrectly using the file format .3gpp as the file extension is recognised by Gmail and the user can play the video. - What you think the correct behavior should be. The correct behaviour is to use the file extension of .3gp to recognise the file format to use video/3gpp just as Gmail manages to do with various other file extensions. First worked out fix in Eclair but didnQ'Et see any fixes so decided to write this user bug now. Seen on Motorola Milestone2 but reproduced on friendQ'Es Motorola Defy. Will get SW version if needed but believe from scanning web this is a Android Gmail and Google issue. No need for a log as easily reproduced. Two files attached

column19: I have the Droid 3 by Motorola with Android version 2.3.4 About an hour ago the screen went black while I was reading text messages. This is not unusual as the screen just timed out. column14: When a page containing custom font declared via CSS @font-face is visited the page could load successfully the first time in the Browser (or WebView programmatically) but when you reload the page no text are shown anymore and hyperlinks only contained lines then after few seconds the browser (or application using WebView) crashes. This was tested on Motorola Xoom with Android 3.0 as well as the Emulator for 3.0 and 3.1 with similar behavior. There is no problem though in Android 2.2 up to 2.3.3 (2.1 does not load fonts properly as is already a known bug). * Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Extract the files.zip into a web server folder or into an Android folder. 2. Open the fonts.html in the Android Browser. The first time should be successful. 3. Now press reload button. All text are gone and the hyperlink just shows a line later browser will crash. Now the HTML is very simple like this: Q<EhtmlQ>E Q<EheadQ>E Q<Emeta http-equiv=Q"Econtent-typeQ"E content=Q"Etext/html; charset=utf-8Q"EQ>E Q<EtitleQ>EQ<E/titleQ>E Q<EstyleQ>E @font-face { font-family: Q'EDejaVu Sans CondensedQ'E; src: url(Q'Efonts/DejaVuSansCondensed.ttfQ'E); } body{font-family:Q'EDejaVu Sans CondensedQ'E} Q<E/styleQ>E Q<E/headQ>E Q<EbodyQ>E Q<EhtmlQ>E Q<EbodyQ>E Q<Eh1 id=Q"Ehd1Q"EQ>EQ<Ea href=Q"E#hd1Q"EQ>EG25Q<E/aQ>EQ<E/h1Q>E Q<EpQ>EThe quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.Q<E/pQ>E Q<E/bodyQ>E Q<E/htmlQ>E There is no problem however if the custom font is removed. Tried also testing with other fonts and the crash behavior is the same. There is no stacktrace as the problem is a crash (signal 11) in the native code. Please see the attached Bugreport dump.

column13: Android 3.0 on the Motorola Xoom tablet: When attempting to setup an IMAP account with the native mail application when that account is served by the Courier IMAP server (GoDaddy IMAP uses Courier) the setup fails with an Invalid username/password error. I have debugged the problem and discovered the cause of the failure. When the ID command is sent to the IMAP server the server responds with something like this: * ID( Q"EnameQ"E Q"EGodaddy IMAPQ"E Q"EvendorQ"E Q"EGodaddy Inc.Q"E Q"Esupport-urlQ"E Q"Ehttps://www.godaddy.com/gdshop/support_submit_question.asp?app_hdr=Q&Eci=2200Q"E Q"Eremote-hostQ"E Q"E:98.232.66.89Q"E Q"EversionQ"E Q"E3.1.0Q"E) Note there is no space after the ID tag. This is what is causing the failure. If the response had a space between the Q"EIDQ"E and Q"E(Q"E the setup would succeed. I have verified this with my own testing. Interestingly the setup process continues to login to the IMAP server and gets a valid OK response but the setup still complains about an invalid username/password as a result of the failed ID. The IMAP setup must be more tolerant of the lack of whitespace after the ID tag. In any case it should never fail as a result of the ID command. The IMAP ID extension spec specifically forbids failure due to the response of the ID command.

column14: I found a rather strange behaviour with (nested) RelativeLayouts. In my setup there is one parent relative layout whicht displays two relative layouts each with a group of buttons as corner markers. Case 1: If I align the right rel-layout toRightOf the left rel-layout everything works as expected. The right buttons are stretched as needed. Case 2: If I align the left rel-layout toLeftOf the right rel-layout something strange happens. The left buttons are completely moved out of the screen. Case 3: And the final testcase: If I add a content-width to the first rel-layout things seem to work again. So the reason could be that under certain circumstances the content-width with wrap_content of the first rel-layout isnt calculated properly. This is the short version. For the long version see the supplied main.xml layout file with comments and the three screenshorts for each of the cases. I would expect that the second case looks similar to the third case. I am using a Motorola Milestone with Android 2.1. I have also tested on the emulator with Android 2.2.

column19: Version: Android 2.1 (tested on T-Mobile Motorola Cliq) To reproduce: Create and leave open an RFCOMM connection in its own thread: private void runSession(BluetoothSocket bs) throws IOException { bs.connect(); DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(bs.getInputStream()); while (!timeToDie) { String line = dis.readLine().trim(); // do something with line } // bs.close(); // drop me. } In the app IQ'Em developing bs.close() is not commented out; but runSession is interrupted via thread.interrupt() when my activity is paused so bs.close() is not invoked. Subsequent attempts to connect without resetting the phone fail with IOException - IQ'Em not certain if this is because the remote device has stopped emitting SDP advertisements or if the connection is still considered Q"EopenQ"E because the process has not been terminated. Attempting to power off and then power back on the Bluetooth subsystem via the Power Options menu once the RFCOMM connection has been dropped like this causes the device to reset. I have not controlled whether the process in which my app was running was terminated. ItQ'Es this latter issue that I believe warrants the bug report as it implies a flaw in the Bluetooth cleanup. Workaround: The obvious workaround is to wrap everything after bs.connect() in a try/finally block. This works fine.

column17: With WiFi left on all the time when traveling from one wireless network to another Android will attempt to reconnect to the now-out-of-range first network. Even after getting within range of the second wireless network Android continues its attempts to connect to the first. In the WiFi settings menu the status indicates Q"EConnecting...Q"E The WiFi settings menu becomes unresponsive. The device cannot be connected to the second (now in-range) network or disconnected from the first (now out-of-range). Attempts to turn off/restart the wireless radio are unsuccessful. Attempting to get the device to Q"EforgetQ"E the connections settings for the first network in the hopes that it can be then connected to the second are also unsuccessful. All other device settings menus can be accessed and utilized. The WiFi settings menu is the only one which becomes unresponsive. Getting the device to discontinue attempting to connect to the first out-of-range network so that it can be connected to the second in-range network requires the device to be completely powered down and restarted. Once rebooted it can be connected to the second network. Ideally Android should be able to automatically disconnect/reconnect to each network as they go in/out of range without needing to cycle the wireless radio or reboot the device. Running Android 3.0.1 on Motorola Xoom. Issue present both before and after the OTA update to 3.0.1. Connection settings for both wireless networks I attempted connecting to are saved to the device. One is secured with WPA 2 Personal the other is secured with 802.1x EAP (PEAP) with a CA certificate stored on the device. The issue is not just one-way but occurs when going from either network to the other.

column15: It seems that the gmail app notifier will open the most recently received e-mail (by e-mail time) instead of the notified e-mail. - Steps to reproduce the problem. This problem occurs on a Motorola Droid with Android version 2.2.2 and in the 2.3 emulator. However it does not occur on HTC Evo Shift 4G running Android 2.2. Steps in the 2.3 emulator: 1. Create 2 different contacts that have the same phone number such as: * Contact one: First: Contact Last: One Home phone: 212-555-1212 * Contact two: First: Contact Last: Two Home phone: 212-555-1212 2. Start an activity with the SHOW_OR_CREATE_CONTACT Intent and Uri for the phone number (tel:212-555-1212) -- or open attached app and enter Q"E212-555-1212Q"E and press Q"ESearch ContactsQ"E Result: Force close popup for process android.process.acore Expected: the contacts app to show one or both of the contacts with that number adb bugreport output from 2.3 emulator attached.

column11: Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. Issue usually occurs after using the youtube app I have not been able to replicate the issue consistently. - What happened. The desktop slows to a crawl: swiping through the different screens is extremely choppy almost as if the CPU is being pegged down. I have verified CPU usage is normal during this issue. A soft reboot or a hard reboot will NOT remedy the issue instead clearing out all widgets from all the desktop screens and readding them will resolve it. - What you think the correct behavior should be. There should never be any slow down. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. Android 3.0 Motorola xoom

column10: While tracking down a problem with the depth buffer in an OpenGL ES 1.1 application I tried to find out the size of the depth buffer of the Emulator. In my GLSurfaceView.Renderer in the onSurfaceCreated method I call: int[] depthbits = new int[1]; gl.glGetIntegerv(GL_DEPTH_BITS depthbits 0); Log.d(TAG Q"EDepth Bits: Q"E + depthbits[0]); If I run this code in an Emulator running Android 2.3.3 it returns: Q"EDepth Bits: 0Q"E If I run it on a device (I have tested namely an HTC Hero running Android 2.3.4 and a Motorola Xoom with Android 3.0.1) I get Q"EDepth Bits: 16Q"E It seems that the emulator doesnQ'Et return the size of the depth buffer but it does have a depth buffer otherwise the rendering wouldnQ'Et be correct. NOTE: This form is only for reporting bugs in OpenGL. Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Which version of Android youQ'Ere using - Which hardware youQ'Ere using - Whether your issue exists both on a device and on the emulator - Steps to reproduce the problem - Sample source code demonstrating the problem - What you think the correct behavior should be Please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output.

column7: Motorola Droid 2 Global Android 2.2 Upon sending an SMS the phone immediately replies Q"EMessage not SentQ"E. Under message details the Cause code is Q"EAddr.Vcnt.0Q"E. When the phone is in this failure mode SMS are not received. The first two times this happened Verizon tech support checked the network and found no problems. The conclusion was that the problem is in the unit. Removing and reonstalling the battery has no effect. When a factory reset is performed the SMS functions normally again for some time period. The first functional period was about a week then a few days then one day. It was noted that while the SMS was functional if the unit was powered down and up again the SMS no longer functioned. Finally the factory reset did not correct the problem at all and Verizon is replacing the phone. This failure occured 1) With or without the SIM installed 2) With or without the SD installed 3) With or without downloaded applications installed. Also once failed uninstalling all of the downloaded applications had no effect. Initially I thought the problem was cause by a specific application so I did extensive testing trying to isolate the application. My conclusion was that the actual failure was not application specific. Please note that this problem has been reported on numerous Android boards as well as on the Verizon support board. It is clearly not specific to my phone. Further it has been noted in other manufacturersQ'E phones and on other services. However Verizon does not have this listed as a known problem. I donQ'Et know the mechanics of getting on a known problem list but IMHO this certainly is a recurring Android problem.

column6: When 5.55 minus 5.23 is entered into the Android calculator it returns an incorrect result of 31.99999. I originally found this on a Motorola MB611 Android version 2.2.2. I have since had friends repeat the error on mutiple devices. I have not yet noticed any similar errors with any other calculation but it does make me worry about the accuracy.

column13: - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1. Run Google Calendar and switch to Q"EweekQ"E or Q"EdayQ"E mode. 2. Create 5 all-day events on the same day. Result: events are shown headers are visible OK. 3. Create 1 more all-day event. Result: all 6 events are shown but headers disappeared (picture attached). Same behaviour in case of 7 events. Expected: either all headers are shown or some events with their headers are showhn and others are hidden with Q"E+2Q"E or smth like this. Device: Motorola Xoom Wi-Fi Android: 3.0.1 Calendar: 3.0.1-110420

column12: The slideshow function (in the Home Dock) cycles through all of the images on the device. I would like to be able select some subset of images so that only those images are shown. Long-pressing on the slideshow icon should bring up the image selection interface. The selection interface might be part of the Gallery. Presumably most of the work to implement this feature would be in the interface to select images and the storage of the selection data. Depending on how much effort can be spent possible implementations of the selection feature are: - Individually mark images. Only marked images are shown in the slideshow. - Mark one or more folders. Only images within marked folders (recursively) are shown in the slideshow. - A combination of the previous two: The user marks images and folders. - Select a single folder. Only images within that folder (recursively) are shown in the slideshow. - Only images within a single fixed folder (recursively) are shown in the slideshow. The user must move or copy images to that folder to have them displayed. - Any of the above except the sense of the selection is inverted. For instance the user would mark images that should *not* be shown. Device: Motorola Droid Android: 2.2.2

column15: Verizon HTC Thunderbolt with Android Version 2.2.1 Built # 1.70.605.0 CL343953 release-keys I attempted to respond to a text message in an existing thread of text messages. This person was NOT a contact in my phone. After many responses back and forth I send a message saying Q"Esounds goodQ"E and the message delivered to someone else that I had a previous existing thread with. I apologized to that person and attempted again with a result of it sending to a different person that I had an existing thread of text messaging in place with and the third attempt had the exact same results. I tried restarting the phone and attempting again with similar results. A few days later I was able to send a text message to that number without the same result. This was approx 2 weeks ago. Since then IQ'Eve had numerous issues with other text messages doing the same thing. These are text messages going to contacts. IQ'Eve had Android phones for awhile now and had heard of this issue and never seen it. The only previous issue I had seen was where you open a thread and a different thread opened. This was ok with me since I double check who IQ'Em about to send a text to. This new issue is Unacceptable. IQ'Eve owned previously HTC Incredible Motorola Droid X and the HTC Thunderbolt. I have yet to find a cause or recommended fix for it but if I can identify a consistency I will notify Google. This started with a number that wasnQ'Et in my phone and seems to have introduced a glitch that now is consistent and repetitive. I am concerned to send important texts for fear of who will see them. In the last 20 texts IQ'Eve sent this has happened to at least 5 of them which is a 25% failure rate. **** PLEASE HELP ******

column16: When using the stock browser in Honeycomb (Motorola Xoom) the viewport height does not properly update once the URL bar is scrolled off of the screen. This is noticeable when trying to do a persistent footer in a web page. Once scrolling further down the page the positioning of the element (using window height + scrollTop in JavaScript) is approximately offset by amount the same amount as the height of the URL bar instead of at the bottom of the screen. I tested in Gingerbread on a Nexus One and once the URL bar disappears the viewport correctly updates. This allows a persistent footer to properly position itself at the bottom of the screen.

column9: Occasionally and IQ'Em not quite sure why I will be texting with my Motorola Atrix in the landscape orientation sideways that is and instead of having the option Q"EdoneQ"E to close out the keyboard it will have the option Q"Enext.Q"E When I try to press this it does nothing. I have to return the phone to the portrait orientation to have the option to send the message. I currently have the Android operating sytem version 2.2.2.

column5: The first letter of German PM indicator Q"Enachm.Q"E is cut off on Q"ESet date and timeQ"E screen during device setup flow.
column6: - Steps to reproduce the problem. 1.At initial setup screen select Deutsche from language drop-down list and tap on Q"EStartQ"E button. 2.Navigate to Q"ESet date and timeQ"E screen switch to Q"EPMQ"E (nachm.) in the time section and observe the display of the PM indicator Q"Enachm.Q"E. - What happened. Q"Enachm.Q"E is cut. - What you think the correct behavior should be. Q"Enachm.Q"E be shown as well. Device: Motorola Xoom OS: Honeycomb 3.2

column14: Phone: Motorola Milestone Android: 2.2.1 IQ'Eve recently upgraded from 2.1 to 2.2.1 and now seem to be having many problems with the proximity sensor during calls. In 2.1 it seemed than the phone correctly blanked the display during a call and deactivated the touch screen. In 2.2.1 I now find my phone putting people on hold randomly jumping to other menus and even dialling voicemail directly from the current call screen (how is this even possible?) Steps to repeat: Phone someone Hold phone to ear or balance in crook of neck Continue call Note random touchscreen pressing and behaviour Suggested fix: Proximity during call should result in blank screen and no touchscreen input is acknowledged. Screen should be re-enabled by pressing power button (I believe this is how it worked in 2.1). Additional mechanisms to enable the screen would be to DOUBLE tap the screen or shake the phone. Suggested improvement: Move the call hold button from the top left of the call screen - if you think about it this is exactly where your ear will be (especially if youQ'Ere left handed like me!) I did wonder why the call hold button isnQ'Et in keeping with the standard interface style and on the menu at the bottom of the screen with all the other call options?

column15: I have 3 unit of Asus Transformer TF101 and a unit of Motorola Xoom all purchase in Hong Kong. I live in Malaysia. My problems is i canQ'Et make purchase of any paid apps. free apps can be download but not paid apps. it appear as Q"EThe item you request cannot be foundQ"E. somehow my android phone can purchase apps i turn to my web page android market and i noticed that due to i have 5 device registered to my google account i can buy apps for my phones but not for my device that dont have Q"ECARRIERQ"E bound with it. This makes our wifi only device cant purchase apps. i have mailed google about this issues but nothing yet dissapointed hopes anyone get some solutions. thanks.

column13: WeQ'Eve noticed significant html/javascript performance issues running content inside a webview control on both 3.0 and the 3.1 upgrade. These performance issues are not seen on 2.1 2.2 or 2.3. This same content when packaged as an native application using Dreamweaver 5.5 and Phonegap does not exhibit the same performance problems. Specially we are seeing issues with CSS3 transitions and lag times in rendering content. WeQ'Eve reported this same issue on the Motorola Xoom forums as well. Is there a plan to improve the HTML/javascript performance in a future release of Android?

column12: NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. None this is a random event and just happened today. - What happened. While I was browsing the internet my Xoom suddenly lost its wifi connection while I was trying to load a page so the page wouldnQ'Et load. I looked at the wifi signal icon and it was empty. I checked the router to see if it was on and it was on. I went to the wifi settings and it said it was scanning. I selected wifi settings and found that the network that I was connected to didnQ'Et show up. It showed up after a few seconds than reconected. - What you think the correct behavior should be. This should NEVER happen during normal usage. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) Motorola Xoom wifi android 3.2. If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

column11: On my Motorola Droid there is the Q"EQuick LaunchQ"E feature which allows you to assign any application to any keyboard shortcut. Quote: - To access the Quick Launch feature tap on Settings. - Under Settings tap on Applications. - Under Applications tap on Quick launch. I do not see this feature in Android 3.0... Is it gone?

column14: ISSUE: Multi-touch is not working properly on the Motorola Xoom with Honeycomb. HOW TO REPRODUCE THE ISSUE: - Add two scrollable widgets to the same home screen on the Xoom e.g. gmail and calendar. - Confirm that you can scroll each widget separately. - Now try and scroll both widgets at the same time with two different fingers. Only the first widget that you touched will scroll. The other widget will NOT scroll. - Now remove the first finger that you placed on the screen from the screen but keep the second finger that you placed on the widget that was NOT scrolling on the screen. - With the second finger on the screen move it up and down and notice that the first widget that you touched with the finger that is no longer on the screen will scroll producing a kind of Q'EghostQ'E scrolling. CORRECT BEHAVIOR: 1. Multiple widgets should be scrollable with multiple touch inputs. 2. Q'EGhostQ'E scrolling should not happen.

column8: Upgrading from froyo to gingerbread on two droidx phones caused certain wave files to get stuck in an endless loop. These wav files which were 8 bit mono 16khz would play for about 1/2 second and repeat endlessly. Some were ringtones IQ'Ed set up others were custom sounds for an app I am developing. Motorola sent me a spec for wav files and these files met spec. Changing the files to 16 bit mono 16khz solved the problem. OS: 2.3.3 system version: 4.5.596MB810.Verizon.en.US

column5: Clock mode (Motorola Backflip) doesnQ'Et stay active screen times out
column6: NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user discussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. Enter clock mode by turning screen on unlocking device and opening the keyboard part way to prop the phone open. Enter clock mode. Wait a few seconds and the screen times out and goes blank. - What happened. Screen goes blank rendering clock mode useless. - What you think the correct behavior should be. Clock mode should take priority over screen timeout and screen should stay lit and not time out. Android 2.1 update 1 (Motorola Backflip) DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

column9: Whilst using the hotspot feature to broadcast a wifi signal to my netbook the signal from the xoom to the netbook is lost. When trying to connect the netbook again the netbook can see the ssid of the access point from the xoom however windows returns an error Q'Eunable to connect to networkQ'E with a troubleshooting problem that says resolves the problem however when trying to connect again replicates the problem. Apple iPhone is able to see Q'Eandroid apQ'E hotspots but when asked to connect states Q'Eunable to connect to Q'Eandroid apQ'EQ'E 3g connection from xoom is at best level Q'EhQ'E and package with 3 has 5gb of data left for the month. Xoom is able to download apps webpages and documents internally implying it is online through 3g. Measures taken to try and fix problem with no success: Turn xoom off and back on Soft reset xoom Turn wifi radio on whilst having hotspots on Turn wifi radio off whilst having hotspot on Having hotspot with no wpa or security Changing security password Changing ssid to something else Only method that seems to make hotspot work for upto 5 mins: Turn airplane radio on. Leave for a few seconds for it to action on everything. Turn airplane mode off and turn hotspot back on. The netbook can then connect 20% of the time or reverts to the error stated above.if it does connect the netbook can connect for approximately 5 mins then drops out and problem remains. Motorola xoom MZ601 wifi and 3g model Android 3.1 europe Please update me on problem as hotspot feature is very important to me. Adam.brackpool@gmail.com NOTE: This form is only for reporting user bugs. For all other user Hdiscussions please visit: http://groups.google.com/group/android-discuss Please describe the problem in detail. Be sure to include: - Steps to reproduce the problem. - What happened. - What you think the correct behavior should be. DonQ'Et forget to mention which device you have and which version of Android is installed on it. (Find it under Home Q>E Menu Q>E Settings Q>E About phone.) If you happen to have a development environment please also run Q"Eadb bugreportQ"E and archive the output as it could help diagnose the problem.

column12: Google Talk will not display online contacts or sometimes any contacts at all when I add a second account. When I remove any of my other accounts as long as there in only 1 left (doesnQ'Et matter which one) the problem exists. I canQ'Et even update my status when there is more than one account. I am running Android 3.1 on the Motorola Xoom. Another user is having the same issue on the Transformer. His post is here: http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?p=14251329

column12: This comes from a stackoverflow question: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5318329/how-fragments-handle-touches Copy paste from it: I am playing with androidQ'Es Fragments and I found something that didnQ'Et make a lot of sense to me. column14: API Level 11 Motorola Xoom When hardwareAcceleration is enabled an AnimationSet with an AlphaAnimation doesnQ'Et work properly when applied to a TextView. It behaves as expected when hardwareAcceleration is disabled. - Steps to reproduce the problem: TextView tv = (TextView)findViewById(R.id.hello); AnimationSet anim = new AnimationSet(true); anim.addAnimation(new TranslateAnimation(0.0f 100.0f 0.0f 0.0f)); anim.addAnimation(new AlphaAnimation(1.0f 0.0f)); anim.setDuration(2000); tv.startAnimation(anim); - Expected behaviour: The TextView will animate moving 100 pixels to the right while fading out. - Actual behaviour: The TextView will animate moving 100 pixels to the right but wonQ'Et fade out. I should also note two things: 1. Adding an AlphaAnimation to the TextView works as expected. The problem occurs only when the AlphaAnimation is part of an AnimationSet. 2. The initial value of the AlphaAnimation is applied to the TextView and stays constant throughout the animation. So if in the above example we had added new AlphaAnimation(0.5f 0.0f) to the AnimationSet the TextViewQ'Es alpha would be set to 0.5f and stay that way.

Possibilities: LauncherPro stock power widget voice search WiFi 3G Motorola Droid 2.2.1 FRG83D stock Problem Description: Did not use phone during 01 January 2010. Sent a text message around noon EST 02 January 2010; sent successfully. Watched football then attempted to order a pizza five hours later. Used voice search to get the pizza placeQ'Es number successfully. Attempted to call the pizza place and phone froze. End call button was inoperable. Sleeping/Awaking the phone led to the call being termed Q"EUnknown 00:00Q"E in the notification bar but with the pizza place phone number in the call window. No additional calls could be made from the device. Was able to disable WiFi from stock widget - did not lead to 3G functionality. Phone continued to appear functioning for the 1.5day term (including application usage and WiFi usage at multiple locations - no calls however) Power cycle to phone led to text messages from 01 January to 5pm EST 02 January 2010 to be displayed on phone. IQ'Em calling this a hold buffer - that is everything was buffered up and then dumped to the phone on re-signing with the network. Also my phone has had the Q"ESMS random text contactQ"E issue but this is a minor inconvenience compared to not knowing whether incoming phone/SMS are happening in real-time. Unsure if they are related issues. Unsure if issue is with the local network 3G/LEC or the Motorola Droid phone.

column11: I am developping an application that allows you to stream from an MPD server (MPDroid). On android 2.2 everything worked well Since Android 2.3  the HTTP stream crashes on song change. MPD might send an invalid packet but since mplayer/VLC/etc ... do not crash I belive that StageFright should just Q"EignoreQ"E this and go on. Steps to reproduce the problem : - Get a working MPD server with HTTP Ogg streaming enabled - Launch MPDroid enable Streaming. Trigger a song change by letting it finish. - Stagefright will crash stream will restart 30 seconds later due to retry code. Here is the last thing StageFright outputs before showing some dump : F/VorbisDecoder( 115): frameworks/base/media/libstagefright/codecs/vorbis/dec/VorbisDecoder.cpp:251 numPageSamples Q>E= 0 Here is a full log : http://pastebin.com/6JqSQwGN The stagefright crash/song chance happens at line 220 Android Version : 2.3.3 (but confirmed by many stock Motorola/CM7 users) Hardware : Google Nexus One/HTC Sensation

column25: I have a Motorola DroidX System Ver 2.3.340.MB810.Verizon.en.us Android Version 2.2.1. The Scala G4 is a bluetooth motorcycle communications system that allows multiple riders to talk to each other between different bikes while riding. This system also allows bluetooth connectivity to devices like the Motorolda Droid X and/or a GPS. Allow me to describe the problem and my findings in testing: 1. The Scala G4 works perfectly when no bluetooth devices are connected. I can communicate with another rider without any problem. 2. The Scala G4 works perfectly when the Motorola DroidX is bluetooth connect but NOT playing any audio. This audio could be either MP3 or streaming. I can communicate with another rider without any problems. 3. Anytime any audio signal is being sent via the bluetooth from the DroidX to the Scala G4 you cannot communicate with another rider. The Scala G4 has VOX (voice activation) or push button. Both interuprt the music but the other rider cannot hear you talking and you cannot hear yourself in your own headset. 4. The Scala G4 worked perfectly in all areas when using the LG Dare that I had prior to the DroidX 5. I have a Motorola bluetooth headset (dont have the model # with me) that will also work with the Droid X. The only way to get bluetooth comminication between the DroidX and the Scala G4 to recover is to power cycle either device. Not being able to talk to the other rider makes the Scala G4 combined with the DroidX a useless combination. Any help in this area would be greatly appreciated.

column20: WeQ'Ere working on an app that streams data out from GSM-based phones via UDP. We want the user to be able to hold a voice call at the same time. The downlink date rates drops on average from 4034 Kbps to 846 Kbps once the voice call starts. The uplink data rates drops on average from 720 Kbps to 37 Kbps once the voice call starts. We observed this in our App and then checked it using SpeedTest.Net over a 4 day period with consistent test results throughout the days/evenings. We are using an Motorola Atrix. ItQ'Es details are as follows: Model B860 Android 2.2.2 Baseband version N_01.77.15P System version.4.1.83.MB860.ATT.en.US We observe the same behavior using an HTC Inspire. When we perform the same App/tests running on an Apple iPhone 3GS or iPhone 4 there is no data rate loss when the voice call starts.
